From: "jacob z." <jsz@eds.org>

Subject: [sfraves] east bay advice, life advice

hey there nice people -

been lurking here quietly for years, but now i've got to ask the community 
for some advice.  i recently moved to north oakland from sf with my 
longtime girlfriend, who then went through a major life overhaul and is 
now set to move out.  she's taking charge of her life, moving into an 
awesome artist warehouse community, and i'm very proud of her, but 
unfortunately this has happened at the expense of our relationship, at 
least for now. i'm pretty busted up about it, and it's causing me to 
reevaluate my own life.  i've got some plans, but classes don't start 
until the fall, and at the moment i'm stuck in a kind of limbo.  need to 
widen my horizons.  i've fallen out of touch over the years with most of 
the artsy/hippy/party people i used to know, and most of my current close 
friends are approaching heavy marriage/career/kids mode at this point... 
so i guess my question for y'all is this: any advice on things to do in 
the east bay (what with the bridge closures and my preference for biking, 
sf seems kinda far away these days, but i'm not ruling it out of course)? 
parties where i can dance and meet nice people, art things where i can 
get involved, building, making things, music things where i can get 
involved (i produce digi-dub and other electronic music, know a ton of 
theory, play the guitar, dj some), opportunities for activism, for 
learning, even bars or clubs worth visiting. just looking for new ideas, 
new input, maybe some operating instructions for an artistically 
fulfilling oakland existence.  ;)  any suggestions, advice, hints, or 
treasure maps would be most appreciated.  thanks,

-jacob

ps. personal hellos to those of you that i've met.  hi, danny!  hi, larry 
from philly, if you're out there!  hi, people whose names i've forgotten!

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] east bay advice, life advice

jacob,

i'm about to forward you a shit ton of announcements for activist- 
type things going on in the bay area in the coming months.

if anyone else is interested in water issues, natural building (cob,  
straw bale, adobe, etc) permaculture, bio-fuels and transportation  
alternatives, gardening and composting, or community organization,  
let me know and i'll send you the info too.

-philip-

Subject: Re: [sfraves] east bay advice, life advice

There's still a ton of stuff to do over here in the East Bay. The parties 
are a little scarce unless you like undergrounds, but there are some things 
happening. Oasis in Oakland has regular Thursday and Sunday night house 
nights...my crew Otherworld also does a monthly there. Jupiter in Berkeley 
does a nice electronic event every Thursday as well - not really a dance 
thing per se, but a "have some beers and conversate whilst listening to 
beats" kinda deal.

Beyond that, there are some really cool watering holes here with decent 
crowds...The Mallard in Albany is my favorite, but the Ivy Room is cool, 
Acme  in Berkeley is a nifty spot, Blake's on Telegraph in Berkeley is cool, 
the Ruby Room in Oakland is nice as well.

As far as art, Berkeley is chock full of artists, artist collectives, places 
to do art for free (Albany Bulb is a really cool outdoor spot where anyone 
can go create things!), etc.

If you'd like, sometime you can meet up with me and I'll take you around to 
some of these spots, or just meet so you can get the lowdown from me...

ez.
Marc(O)

"jacob z." <jsz@eds.org> wrote: hey there nice people -

been lurking here quietly for years, but now i've got to ask the community 
for some advice.  i recently moved to north oakland from sf with my 
longtime girlfriend, who then went through a major life overhaul and is 
now set to move out.  she's taking charge of her life, moving into an 
awesome artist warehouse community, and i'm very proud of her, but 
unfortunately this has happened at the expense of our relationship, at 
least for now. i'm pretty busted up about it, and it's causing me to 
reevaluate my own life.  i've got some plans, but classes don't start 
until the fall, and at the moment i'm stuck in a kind of limbo.  need to 
widen my horizons.  i've fallen out of touch over the years with most of 
the artsy/hippy/party people i used to know, and most of my current close 
friends are approaching heavy marriage/career/kids mode at this point... 
so i guess my question for y'all is this: any advice on things to do in 
the east bay (what with the bridge closures and my preference for biking, 
sf seems kinda far away these days, but i'm not ruling it out of course)? 
parties where i can dance and meet nice people, art things where i can 
get involved, building, making things, music things where i can get 
involved (i produce digi-dub and other electronic music, know a ton of 
theory, play the guitar, dj some), opportunities for activism, for 
learning, even bars or clubs worth visiting. just looking for new ideas, 
new input, maybe some operating instructions for an artistically 
fulfilling oakland existence.  ;)  any suggestions, advice, hints, or 
treasure maps would be most appreciated.  thanks,

-jacob

ps. personal hellos to those of you that i've met.  hi, danny!  hi, larry 
from philly, if you're out there!  hi, people whose names i've forgotten!

The Artfag Mafia threw a great event at NIMBY about a month ago.
http://www.artfagmafia.com/
Anything where you have to sign a release on entry is good fun in my 
book!  And their ride is pretty nice too, if you believe in those 
powered vehicle things: 
http://tribes.tribe.net/artfagmafia/photos/f7494a1c-31af-4e4e-b961-ec5823fdda05


Also, don't miss the Fire Arts festival in July at the Crucible (and 
just check out classes available at the Crucible in general, 
http://www.crucible.org for the schedule.)

From: "jacob z." <jsz@eds.org>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Subject: [sfraves] east bay advice, life advice
Date: Thu, 1 Jun 2006 10:30:10 -0700 (PDT)

hey there nice people -

been lurking here quietly for years, but now i've got to ask the community 
for some advice.  i recently moved to north oakland from sf with my longtime 
girlfriend, who then went through a major life overhaul and is now set to 
move out.  she's taking charge of her life, moving into an awesome artist 
warehouse community, and i'm very proud of her, but unfortunately this has 
happened at the expense of our relationship, at least for now. i'm pretty 
busted up about it, and it's causing me to reevaluate my own life.  i've got 
some plans, but classes don't start until the fall, and at the moment i'm 
stuck in a kind of limbo.  need to widen my horizons.  i've fallen out of 
touch over the years with most of the artsy/hippy/party people i used to 
know, and most of my current close friends are approaching heavy 
marriage/career/kids mode at this point... so i guess my question for y'all 
is this: any advice on things to do in the east bay (what with the bridge 
closures and my preference for biking, sf seems kinda far away these days, 
but i'm not ruling it out of course)? parties where i can dance and meet 
nice people, art things where i can get involved, building, making things, 
music things where i can get involved (i produce digi-dub and other 
electronic music, know a ton of theory, play the guitar, dj some), 
opportunities for activism, for learning, even bars or clubs worth visiting. 
just looking for new ideas, new input, maybe some operating instructions for 
an artistically fulfilling oakland existence.  ;)  any suggestions, advice, 
hints, or treasure maps would be most appreciated.  thanks,

-jacob

ps. personal hellos to those of you that i've met.  hi, danny!  hi, larry 
from philly, if you're out there!  hi, people whose names i've forgotten!

---------------------------------------------------------------------

it's on.

Evil Breaks & dROW Beach Party
June 9th, 2006
midnight - 7am

Killer beach party, y'all! Midnight 'til sunrise, under the stars with
the Pacific's waves crashing up a few feet away, with some of the
finest DJs around... BUT, there's very limited capacity, and
directions to the event (1 hour outside of SF) will only be given to
those who sign up before the list is closed. The list will probably
fill in the next day or two (today is 6/1), so sign up if you wanna
go! And please, only sign up if you really plan to go.

Signup for the Evil Breaks & dROW Beach Party Guestlist here:

www.EvilBreaks.com

Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks/XM Radio)

Synner (the dRow)

Evinrude (Renegade Ferrets)


directions will only be given to those that have signed up, and space
is very limited, so please sign up for the event.

www.EvilBreaks.com

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: CloudFactory Design Collective presents: S/heva - a Fashion Performance

In past shows, we've had a robot ballerina, ninja breakdance battles, =20=

aerobatic squirrels, forest faeries and wood nymphs (with outfits =20
made from living sprouts), casual/cocktail lounge wear, bridal gowns =20
made from salvaged recycled plastic, and even formal clothing.  All =20
manner of freaky weird creativity comes out in this show, and it's =20
*lots* of fun.

it's one of those things you'll be hearing about afterwards from =20
everyone who went.

don't miss it this time!

-philip-

www.cfdesign.net

S/heva: Venture into the Fashion Divine
Saturday, June 17, 2006

Doors open at 8pm, Show starts at 9pm
Afterparty until 2am
Designer Sample Sale
Music by Monty Luke and DingDong

Studio Z
314  11th Street at Folsom
San Francisco, CA
415-252-7666
www.StudioZ.tv
21+ w/ID



Tired of the same old duds being peddled by the usual
fashion industry suspects?  Well it=92s time to wake up
and smell the underground!  The Cloud Factory Design
Collective is back on the attack with its 8th Annual
Fashion Performance: =93S/heva: Venture into the Fashion
Divine,=94 to be held in San Francisco on Saturday, June
17, 2006 at Studio Z.

Watch as S/heva destroys your preconceived notions
about fashion rules and limitations, blazing new paths
to the heights of wearable art!  Behold brave new
creations by this inventive, many-armed collective,
rooted firmly in the underground, yet always reaching
out in new directions to entertain and inspire!

S/heva will ignite your imagination with a wild
variety of designs, from kicky patchwork fur and
vibrant dancefloor creations, to flowing goddess
threads.  Find the perfect outfit for your most
outrageous exploits, whether you=92re running from the
paparazzi, taking a twirl at your local gin joint, or
spending a day at the races.

After the show, pick up some up-to-the-minute,
one-of-a-kind goodies in the Designer Sample Sale,
then grab your dancing shoes and hold onto your booty
as DJs Monty Luke and DingDong lead S/heva dancing
into the fire! Remember, this cycle of hyper-creation
only comes around once a year, so don=92t miss out!

Message-ID: <1265.9010407@defsf.com>
Date: Wed, 31 Dec 1969 17:18:29 -0800
From: disconnect <seanocean@defsf.com>
User-Agent: Mozilla Thunderbird 1.0.2 (Macintosh/20050317)
X-Accept-Language: en-us, en
MIME-Version: 1.0
To:  sfraves@hyperreal.org
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] final vinyl philosophy

i was thinking about what was said about vinyl and what was the reason 
why electronic music was first introduced via vinyl.. and came to the 
rationalization that vinyl is just cooler in general.

i know people will bring up the argument "well we didn't have burning 
capability and massive storage hard drives back then."
that is true but we also had the capability to play cds in much the same 
way all mobile djs play now... and by all means the cd decks by tascam 
back then were very state of the art and paved the way for pioneer cdjs 
to dominate. looping, start/ stop cues and all this trickery that people 
have now via cds and mp3 programs.. which were also around circa ten 
years ago. so then why the hell we'ren't we making dub plates on cd..? 
and playing cds back in the day when the technology was there?

my theory of that has to do with the indy music scene back then and the 
origins of electronic music djing.  by the late 80s & early 90s 
everything was on cd and to alot of people at large, vinyl was a joke. 
that is unless you talked to disco heads, hip hop djs, and indy rock 
collectors. independent distributors were making a modest means and 
artists from any sort of electronic act besides synth pop and industrial 
acts couldn't get signed to the majors. the independent scene was 
gaining steam in the underground and all indy collectors who were loyal 
to the independent scene  HATED the majors. since people hated the 
majors so much and hated alot of the things associated with them S/A CDs 
and cassettes, vinyl and all the things associated with it were coveted. 
limited pressings, rare artwork, bonus posters and stickers, who owned 
the vinyl last, color vinyl pressings, super limited acetates and test 
pressings made the indy scene rule compared to the banal cd.. especially 
when they canned the long box. `;)
    i also feel that the djs in the traditional realms of disco and hip 
hop were also impressing new legions of followers such as mad mike at 
Underground Resistance, frankie knuckles at the warehouse, and all the 
djs at the hacienda including laurent garnier. these djs saw the power 
of vinyl and the culmination of independent unheard music unleashed on 
the masses. hop hop mega mixing, live re-edits, and adding drum machines 
to the mix was kicking people's asses. now i'm hearing, 'wait, i can do 
that on my lap-t..' no. -these people were doing it in the face of an 
audience that thought vinyl was dead and bringing it hard and bringing 
it live, all the while giving respect back to the underground whence 
their vinyl came from. for people it was like an epiphany.. making 
something new out of something old.

    alot of the old music back then was made on junk. the history of 
techno was founded in a city of junk called detroit. adopted and 
nurtured ina cold war hell called berlin and rebuilt in dreary london. 
to me this music was a way out of the bleak and mundane with a promise 
of the future. and that promise was made on mostly defunct analog gear, 
digital keyboards were the way of the future back then. but alot of the 
heads made music on dead gear bringing life to new ideas with the old. 
for example, who the hell has heard what the digital roland tr-707 drum 
machine sounds like (you frontline assembly heads keep quiet)?

    i think there is a certain euphoria that comes from watching records 
spin (marcel duchamp 's dadaist piece 'wheel' attests to this. he said, 
"i just like to watch it spin") and without their presence in full 
analog resolution its just not as cool i think. like what's cooler and 
more psychedelic, the square edged /numerical enforced city,.. or the 
analog countryside? countryside everytime. its like the underlying 
meaning of electronic music is more about natural loops, rotation, 
subtle change and patterns. alot of the early electronic music focuses 
on this. arpegiators and  sequences of phlanging rounded sounding 
effects were used  quite alot. the reference to looping patterns and 
change is all in there in the grooves of vinyl and i really think that's 
super cool. there's art, there's subtlety and respect to the past while 
acknowledging the future.

i know i probably didn't get alot of things right in this so please 
forgive.. and i respect digital production and respect digital djing 
when its done right. but i wanted to say my peace about why i thought 
vinyl has been traditionally regarded as cooler than the digital format. 
i also know there is also a revolution going on in electronic music 
hailing the digital reformation.. i'm not blind. giving props to the 
computer and the future, that is also cool.. but to  disregard the ideas 
and principles of what electronic music was founded on is a bit short 
sighted. i would hope that in the future people will bring the idea of a 
hybrid concept that was also around at the time of the late 80s called 
digalog. its kind of like living in the suburb of trippyness, with the 
convenience of the city a short hop away and the country in your back yard.

respect,
sean ocean
aka dj disconnect



---------------------------------------------------------------------

> acts couldn't get signed to the majors. the
> independent scene was 
> gaining steam in the underground and all indy
> collectors who were loyal 
> to the independent scene  HATED the majors. since
> people hated the 
> majors so much and hated alot of the things
> associated with them S/A CDs 
> and cassettes, vinyl and all the things associated
> with it were coveted. 
> limited pressings, rare artwork, bonus posters and
> stickers, who owned 
> the vinyl last, color vinyl pressings, super limited
> acetates and test 
> pressings made the indy scene rule compared to the
> banal cd.. especially 
> when they canned the long box. `;)
>     i also feel that the djs in the traditional
> realms of disco and hip 
> hop were also impressing new legions of followers
> such as mad mike at 
> Underground Resistance, frankie knuckles at the
> warehouse, and all the 
> djs at the hacienda including laurent garnier. these
> djs saw the power 
> of vinyl and the culmination of independent unheard
> music unleashed on 
> the masses. hop hop mega mixing, live re-edits, and
> adding drum machines 
> to the mix was kicking people's asses. now i'm
> hearing, 'wait, i can do 
> that on my lap-t..' no. -these people were doing it
> in the face of an 
> audience that thought vinyl was dead and bringing it
> hard and bringing 
> it live, all the while giving respect back to the
> underground whence 
> their vinyl came from. for people it was like an
> epiphany.. making 
> something new out of something old.
> 
>     alot of the old music back then was made on
> junk. the history of 
> techno was founded in a city of junk called detroit.
> adopted and 
> nurtured ina cold war hell called berlin and rebuilt
> in dreary london. 
> to me this music was a way out of the bleak and
> mundane with a promise 
> of the future. and that promise was made on mostly
> defunct analog gear, 
> digital keyboards were the way of the future back
> then. but alot of the 
> heads made music on dead gear bringing life to new
> ideas with the old. 
> for example, who the hell has heard what the digital
> roland tr-707 drum 
> machine sounds like (you frontline assembly heads
> keep quiet)?
> 
>     i think there is a certain euphoria that comes
> from watching records 
> spin (marcel duchamp 's dadaist piece 'wheel'
> attests to this. he said, 
> "i just like to watch it spin") and without their
> presence in full 
> analog resolution its just not as cool i think. like
> what's cooler and 
> more psychedelic, the square edged /numerical
> enforced city,.. or the 
> analog countryside? countryside everytime. its like
> the underlying 
> meaning of electronic music is more about natural
> loops, rotation, 
> subtle change and patterns. alot of the early
> electronic music focuses 
> on this. arpegiators and  sequences of phlanging
> rounded sounding 
> effects were used  quite alot. the reference to
> looping patterns and 
> change is all in there in the grooves of vinyl and i
> really think that's 
> super cool. there's art, there's subtlety and
> respect to the past while 
> acknowledging the future.
> 
> i know i probably didn't get alot of things right in
> this so please 
> forgive.. and i respect digital production and
> respect digital djing 
> when its done right. but i wanted to say my peace
> about why i thought 
> vinyl has been traditionally regarded as cooler than
> the digital format. 
> i also know there is also a revolution going on in
> electronic music 
> hailing the digital reformation.. i'm not blind.
> giving props to the 
> computer and the future, that is also cool.. but to 
> disregard the ideas 
> and principles of what electronic music was founded
> on is a bit short 
> sighted. i would hope that in the future people will
> bring the idea of a 
> hybrid concept that was also around at the time of
> the late 80s called 
> digalog. its kind of like living in the suburb of
> trippyness, with the 
> convenience of the city a short hop away and the
> country in your back yard.
> 
> respect,
> sean ocean
> aka dj disconnect
> 
> 
> 
>
---------------------------------------------------------------------

> sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
> For additional commands, e-mail:
> sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
> 
>

Subject: [sfraves] Space Girls - Saturday, June 3rd

cause nobody else has mentioned it...this is on track to be a pretty
big event.  south bay.  2 rooms.

and the boys from Viberation are doing visuals!


Hosted By: Bionic Bubbles & SSP
When: Saturday Jun 03, 2006
at 8:00 PM
Where:  Sunnyvale


AREA 51: HARD HOUSE / HOUSE / TRANCE / EBM

DJ IRENE - LA, CA [Hard House]
(Screaming Diva Prod / djirene.net)

DJ SOLANGE - Chicago, IL [House]
(URB Magazine / Oasis FM / Blue Iguana Music)

ELSA HILL - Portland, OR [Trance]
(Armada / NL) ***First CA Performance***

DJ ICON - SF, CA [Trance]
(djicon.com / Reverb Records / Femme DJ......'s)

DENISE - Oakland, CA [House]
(Mizumo Music / djdenise.com)

OWL - SF, CA [EBM] (Muf!)
HOUSE MOUSE - SJ, CA [House] (Earwacks)
MICHELLE FRASER - SJ, CA [Trance](December Records) ***Debut Performance***


THE CROP FILEDS: HARDCORE / BREAKS / DRUM & BASS

REID SPEED - LA, CA [D&B]
(Breakbeat Science / Direct Drive / Contagious Musiq)

JEN MAS - Bronx, NY [Hrdcr / Jngl]
(Versatile Groove Mgmt / Vitus Prod / Hardstep Sistaz)

DIOSA - Tempe, AZ [Breaks / D&B]
(Swell Records / 602 Prod / shejay.net) ***First arrival to the Bay Area***


LITE BRITE - Boston, MA [Happycore]
(Ruffneck Playaz Crew / HCFTP)

FEMME FATALE vs. ULTRA VIOLET
w/ MC AUDIO ANGEL - SF, CA [D&B]

(Sleeveless / Compression / Sister SF)

HI-C vs. 2QT - SF, CA [Happycore] (Nu Vision vs. HCFTP)
FAITH HARMONY - SAC, CA [Freeform] (Social Synthesis Productions)
***Debut Performance***


ALL FEMALE LINEUP
1500+ CAPACITY VIRGIN VENUE
SF BAY AREA, CA
8PM - 4AM


1.21 JIGAWATTS OF GALAXY CLASS SOUND FROM HARD SCIENCE'S MEYER & EV SYSTEMS
MULTI-PROJECTED HYPERSPACE VISUALS BY VIBERATION GRAPHICS
INTERGALACTIC LIGHTING AND UV ENVIRONMENT

TICKETS: $15 PRESALES / $20 DOOR / Girls in SEXY outfits $15

TICKET OUTLETS
ONLINE/PHONE :: GrooveTickets.com :: 877.714.1662

BERKLEY :: Skills DJ Workshop // 2566A Telegraph Ave. // 510.704.9876
SAN FRANCISCO :: Reverb Records // 1816 Haight Street // 415.221.4142
SAN JOSE :: Solid Grooves // 29 E. Santa Clara Street // 408.947.8470
SACRAMENTO :: Channelz // 2371 Arden Way // 916.641.8808

INFOLINE: 415.267.4804


Downstairs:

08:00-09:00 TBA
09:00-10:00 Owl
10:00-11:00 Elsa Hill
11:00-12:00 ICON
12:00-01:00 Dj Irene
01:00-02:00 Dj Solange
02:00-03:00 Denise
03:00-04:00 House Mouse

Upstairs:

08:00-09:00 Faith Harmony

10:30-11:30 Lite Brite
11:30-12:30 Jen Mas
12:30-01:30 Diosa
01:30-02:30 Reid Speed
02:30-04:00 Femme Fatale vs. Ultra Violet w/MC Audio Ange

Killer lineup, looks to be an awesome event, but...

Girls in sexy outfits get $5 off at the door?  I don't have a particular
problem with this, it just seems a little inconsistent with what I think of
as the point of having a female-dominated lineup.

And anyway, aren't we past using female talent as a promotional gimmick?
Have an all-female lineup, sure, that's great--but making that the theme of
the event seems a little late 90s to me.

Maybe I'm being overly judgmental.  Just my 2 cents.

Phi

++++++++++++++++

So come out and support the crew you love to chill with!

What - Ambi-Sonic 3rd Year Anniversary

When - Friday, June 23rd - 9pm - Close

Where - Lucid Bar - 580 Sutter (between Powell and Mason)

Cover - 5 bucks - 21 and over please!

Chlorophil

all out!

two rooms of chillout music!

1. Creativity and innovation always builds on the past.
2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.
4. Ours is a less and less a free society.

From: "Osby Oi Oi Jamz" <osby@viberation.com>

Subject: [sfraves] Ooops... late last weekend review :)

OK.. Yo.. Like Hi.. I was havin' a mad week of like homework stuff i had
to catch up & mad recoup sleeping goin on 'cause the weekend.. oh my
goodness... last weekend.. So Dope!!! :)

So last Friday, i went 2 my Homegirl Ginn's Bday shindig like @ this space
in the City.. it waz fun.. really fun!  I mean.. saw Groovers i ain't seen
in a while & it was Dope.. Music there was well.., Hello 2day.. I was in
Mondo Heaven 'cause it was all about the Happy Hardcore YAAAY!!!  Then
ummm.. CrackerJack i think his name was played some Junlge w/ some HHC
:):):) LOLOLOLMAO  So Dope!!!

So then Unka & I went 2 5SW for their GB shindig.. that was fun!!!  LIke
when we got there.. ooh man.. YAY {{{HUGZ AL}}} :) <3  well  {{{HUGZ
TIMEVADAVEBAMLIMEFROZ}}}  Yeah.. it was dope.. Bamdom busted out this
Groovy "decades" retro set, everything from 70s, 80s, & 90s.. YUMMY!!!  DJ
M busted out old skool hip hop.. Dope Dope Dope!  Very Yummy Family Night,
the new skool & the old skool!

http://s82.photobucket.com/albums/j277/BeatzNStuff/Ginns%20bday%20-%20Goodbye%205SW/

Saturday was Dope!!  It was the Pajama Jammy Jam & WOW!!  OK.. Another
Family night w/ Family!!!  LIke OK.. so the music.. down tempo, hip hop,
trip hop, breaks, minimal techno, Glitch fuckin' everything, some acid
music here & there.. YUMMY!!!

I mean... a whole fuckin' gathering of people in their Jammy's, playin'
games, drinking, haveing fun.. ooh my gosh.. So Dope!!  So Mondo Fun!!! 
Totally!

Oh yeah... this weekend marked the reunion of Ranger & Osby :)  YAAAY!!! 
Love U Ranger!

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Pajama%20Jammy%20Jam%205-27-2006/

Then Sunday.. I didn't think i was gon out, honestly.. 'cause i totally
needed 2 catch up w/ my Homework (which is howcome I haven't posted all
week or whatever) & yeah.. I endedup goin 2 the EB SS outdoor @ GGP.. So
fun!!!  Music was Yummy.. very Yummy!!!  Family in the park.. Dope!!! 
Loved it!

Then we ended up goin 2 McDonalds where i McLarged my drink & had a
McDoublecheese burger thingie.. lol... yeah..

Then we ended up @ Mighty for Orbital.. danced sooooo much that night!  So
Dope!  Like ummm... Lee Combs spun.. oooooooh.. yeah... LoL.. SDud Gris &
I had this loooooooooooong loong catch up chat 'cause it's been forever
since we spoke.. LoL.. Love "Syd" :)  But yeah.. it was my 1st time at
Mighty.. it's a cute place!

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Day%20Party%20at%20GGP%20-%20Mighty%205-28-06/

So yeah.. that was my last weekend review.. it was Groovy seein' y'all! :)
 {{HUGZ}}}

-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Osby Oi Oi Jamz <osby@viberation.com> wrote: OK.. Yo.. Like Hi.. I was havi=
n' a mad week of like homework stuff i had
to catch up & mad recoup sleeping goin on 'cause the weekend.. oh my
goodness... last weekend.. So Dope!!! :)

So last Friday, i went 2 my Homegirl Ginn's Bday shindig like @ this space
in the City.. it waz fun.. really fun!  I mean.. saw Groovers i ain't seen
in a while & it was Dope.. Music there was well.., Hello 2day.. I was in
Mondo Heaven 'cause it was all about the Happy Hardcore YAAAY!!!  Then
ummm.. CrackerJack i think his name was played some Junlge w/ some HHC
:):):) LOLOLOLMAO  So Dope!!!

So then Unka & I went 2 5SW for their GB shindig.. that was fun!!!  LIke
when we got there.. ooh man.. YAY {{{HUGZ AL}}} :) <3  well  {{{HUGZ
TIMEVADAVEBAMLIMEFROZ}}}  Yeah.. it was dope.. Bamdom busted out this
Groovy "decades" retro set, everything from 70s, 80s, & 90s.. YUMMY!!!  DJ
M busted out old skool hip hop.. Dope Dope Dope!  Very Yummy Family Night,
the new skool & the old skool!

http://s82.photobucket.com/albums/j277/BeatzNStuff/Ginns%20bday%20-%20Goodb=
ye%205SW/

Saturday was Dope!!  It was the Pajama Jammy Jam & WOW!!  OK.. Another
Family night w/ Family!!!  LIke OK.. so the music.. down tempo, hip hop,
trip hop, breaks, minimal techno, Glitch fuckin' everything, some acid
music here & there.. YUMMY!!!

I mean... a whole fuckin' gathering of people in their Jammy's, playin'
games, drinking, haveing fun.. ooh my gosh.. So Dope!!  So Mondo Fun!!!=20
Totally!

Oh yeah... this weekend marked the reunion of Ranger & Osby :)  YAAAY!!!=20
Love U Ranger!

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Pajama%20Jammy%20Jam%205-=
27-2006/

Then Sunday.. I didn't think i was gon out, honestly.. 'cause i totally
needed 2 catch up w/ my Homework (which is howcome I haven't posted all
week or whatever) & yeah.. I endedup goin 2 the EB SS outdoor @ GGP.. So
fun!!!  Music was Yummy.. very Yummy!!!  Family in the park.. Dope!!!=20
Loved it!

Then we ended up goin 2 McDonalds where i McLarged my drink & had a
McDoublecheese burger thingie.. lol... yeah..

Then we ended up @ Mighty for Orbital.. danced sooooo much that night!  So
Dope!  Like ummm... Lee Combs spun.. oooooooh.. yeah... LoL.. SDud Gris &
I had this loooooooooooong loong catch up chat 'cause it's been forever
since we spoke.. LoL.. Love "Syd" :)  But yeah.. it was my 1st time at
Mighty.. it's a cute place!

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Day%20Party%20at%20GGP%20=
-%20Mighty%205-28-06/

So yeah.. that was my last weekend review.. it was Groovy seein' y'all! :)
 {{HUGZ}}}

Subject: [sfraves] 6/09/06: IGNITION @ BOCA w/ Myagi (Splank!/Money Shot Recordings - Canada) : FREE before 10pm!!

StrategiK (in cooperation w/ Urban Breaks, The Midnightsons, Modified 
Productions & more) Presents:

IGNITION
Friday June 9th 2006
9pm to 2am

@ Boca (Bar of Contemporary Art)
414 Jessie Street, San Francisco

21 +
Free Before 10pm!
Just $5.00 After!!!

with your vinyl mechanics:

Jay Vigor - StrategiK / www.jayvigor.com (SF)
Undecided - Urban Breaks/ MOB Records (Sacramento)
Influence - StrategiK / www.nfluence.net (SF)
Marc(O) - Otherworld / www.TheMidnightsons.com / Ill Behavior (DC/SF)
Ill-D The DJ - Modified Productions / www.illdthedj.com (SF)
Evolution CQ - StrategiK / www.TheMidnightsons.com (SF)
Karlo - www.TheMidnightsons.com (SF/Seattle)
Audio MacGuyver - SolidGrooves (SJ)

and your very special guest pilot for the evening:

MYAGI (aka Sole Claw)  w/ MC Uprock - Money Shot Recordings / Splank! / 
Funky Cactus (Toronto, Canada)
www.myagimusic.com

"Myagi aka Sole Claw aka Andrew Mavor has shot up like a rocket over the 
last year. Representing Canada internationally, he has played from Seoul to 
San Francisco, Halifax to Brighton, Taipei to Toronto, and has become touted 
as the next major North American breaks don. Comparisons to the other big 
names of the scene seem obvious, but don't really do justice to the range of 
work Myagi has put out, as his releases have varied from hip hop big beat 
infused party breaks through to jackin house and techy big room floor 
fillers.

Dropping a guitar in favor of a synthesizer well before finishing high 
school, Mavor's musical journey has landed him across the board support. The 
late John Peel (the Peel Sessions) used a Myagi track to open his show. 
Front 242 have sent kudos on a track ("Sole Claw - Smartbomb") that was 
licensed to Fingerlickin for the Plump DJ's album "Saturday Night Lotion."

The string of red hot releases that followed have landed him sets on the 
BBC, the CBC and Crystal Method's Community Service and support from 
everyone from Adam Freeland and Meat Katie through to Fatboy Slim and Freddy 
Fresh. Myagi's multi-genre approach to dance music has matured into a true 
journey through b-boy and rave culture, mashing up past and present in one 
of the most high energy, pounding experiences a club could play host to. His 
shows at clubs like The Guvernment in Toronto have led to high profile gigs 
internationally, including such highlights as Fabric in London, Fusion in 
Taiwan and San Francisco's Love Parade, where Myagi played three parties in 
12 hours.

His upcoming releases include remixes for Ursula 1000 (coming out on 
Thievery Corporations label ESL), hip hop don Maestro (as in Fresh Wes), and 
a giant remix for Ricky Stone. He has two tracks licensed to JDS's "Beats N 
Bobs" compilation on Functional Breaks, more remixes in the works, and a 
release schedule that puts most labels to shame. Touring constantly, Myagi 
is one of the hardest working men in the North American dance music, and, 
with his profile rising at an extremely rapid pace he has quickly turned 
himself into a staple of the global breaks scene. "

Forget everything you thought you knew about breaks in San Francisco...you 
ears are about to be flipped!!!

FREE before 10pm!!!!


~Marc(O)
Otherworld // Midnightsons // Ill Behavior // Mario Bros (SF/DC)

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Study finds no marijuana-lung cancer link 

--0-133571005-1149485122=:78480
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

http://www.bluelight.ru/vb/showthread.php?s=&threadid=255419
   
  and
   
  
http://www.cnn.com/2006/HEALTH/05/24...nn_mostpopular
   
             Study finds no marijuana-lung cancer link 
  
  
---------------------------------
    Marijuana smoking does not increase a person's risk of developing lung cancer, according to the findings of a new study at the University of California Los Angeles that surprised even the researchers.

They had expected to find that a history of heavy marijuana use, like cigarette smoking, would increase the risk of cancer.

Instead, the study, which compared the lifestyles of 611 Los Angeles County lung cancer patients and 601 patients with head and neck cancers with those of 1,040 people without cancer, found no elevated cancer risk for even the heaviest pot smokers. It did find a 20-fold increased risk of lung cancer in people who smoked two or more packs of cigarettes a day.

The study results were presented in San Diego Tuesday at a meeting of the American Thoracic Society.

The study was confined to people under age 60 since baby boomers were the most likely age group to have long-term exposure to marijuana, said Dr. Donald Tashkin, senior researcher and professor at the UCLA School of Medicine.

The results should not be taken as a blank check to smoke pot, which has been associated with problems including cognitive impairment and chronic bronchitis, said Dr. John Hansen-Flaschen, chief of pulmonary and critical care at the University of Pennsylvania Health System in Philadelphia. He was not involved in the study.

Previous studies showed marijuana tar contained about 50 percent more of the chemicals linked to lung cancer, compared with tobacco tar, Tashkin said. In addition, smoking a marijuana joint deposits four times more tar in the lungs than smoking an equivalent amount of tobacco.

"Marijuana is packed more loosely than tobacco, so there's less filtration through the rod of the cigarette, so more particles will be inhaled," Tashkin said in a statement. "And marijuana smokers typically smoke differently than tobacco smokers -- they hold their breath about four times longer, allowing more time for extra fine particles to deposit in the lung."

He theorized that tetrahydrocannabinol, or THC, a chemical in marijuana smoke that produces its psychotropic effect, may encourage aging, damaged cells to die off before they become cancerous.

Hansen-Flaschen also cautioned a cancer-marijuana link could emerge as baby boomers age and there may be smaller population groups, based on genetics or other factors, still at risk for marijuana-related cancers

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Wednesday, May 24, 2006; Posted: 2:11 p.m. EDT (18:11 GMT) 
LOS ANGELES, California (Reuters) 
Study finds no marijuana-lung cancer link 

http://www.cnn.com/2006/HEALTH/05/24...nn_mostpopular

shouldn't we be playing that old game of "I'm Going to a Picnic"? 
you know, where one kid says what he or she is bringing, and the next person 
adds something, and has to remember what the first one said? Then the third 
person adds something and has to remember the first two? 
The way I remember it is:  if you fuck up, you have to take a big chug of 
beer. Molson, eh? (my first year of college was not far from Canada so that's 
why). or you have to smoke a huge rip. Then it gets harder and harder to play. 

"I'm going to Stilldream, and I'm bringing
a cooler, tunes to play in the car, sleeping bag, a flashlight.... "  etc 
Repeat until the car is full! 

I'm really looking forward to the party. The pics are going to be on a new 
site, sfraving.com as soon as we have the site up and running. 
Hurray!

-------------------------------1149516206--

--- CHUCK G <chuckg_421@yahoo.com> wrote:

>
http://www.bluelight.ru/vb/showthread.php?s=&threadid=255419
>    
>   and
>    
>   
>
http://www.cnn.com/2006/HEALTH/05/24...nn_mostpopular
>    
>              Study finds no marijuana-lung cancer
> link 
>   
>   
> ---------------------------------
>     Marijuana smoking does not increase a person's
> risk of developing lung cancer, according to the
> findings of a new study at the University of
> California Los Angeles that surprised even the
> researchers.
> 
> They had expected to find that a history of heavy
> marijuana use, like cigarette smoking, would
> increase the risk of cancer.
> 
> Instead, the study, which compared the lifestyles of
> 611 Los Angeles County lung cancer patients and 601
> patients with head and neck cancers with those of
> 1,040 people without cancer, found no elevated
> cancer risk for even the heaviest pot smokers. It
> did find a 20-fold increased risk of lung cancer in
> people who smoked two or more packs of cigarettes a
> day.
> 
> The study results were presented in San Diego
> Tuesday at a meeting of the American Thoracic
> Society.
> 
> The study was confined to people under age 60 since
> baby boomers were the most likely age group to have
> long-term exposure to marijuana, said Dr. Donald
> Tashkin, senior researcher and professor at the UCLA
> School of Medicine.
> 
> The results should not be taken as a blank check to
> smoke pot, which has been associated with problems
> including cognitive impairment and chronic
> bronchitis, said Dr. John Hansen-Flaschen, chief of
> pulmonary and critical care at the University of
> Pennsylvania Health System in Philadelphia. He was
> not involved in the study.
> 
> Previous studies showed marijuana tar contained
> about 50 percent more of the chemicals linked to
> lung cancer, compared with tobacco tar, Tashkin
> said. In addition, smoking a marijuana joint
> deposits four times more tar in the lungs than
> smoking an equivalent amount of tobacco.
> 
> "Marijuana is packed more loosely than tobacco, so
> there's less filtration through the rod of the
> cigarette, so more particles will be inhaled,"
> Tashkin said in a statement. "And marijuana smokers
> typically smoke differently than tobacco smokers --
> they hold their breath about four times longer,
> allowing more time for extra fine particles to
> deposit in the lung."
> 
> He theorized that tetrahydrocannabinol, or THC, a
> chemical in marijuana smoke that produces its
> psychotropic effect, may encourage aging, damaged
> cells to die off before they become cancerous.
> 
> Hansen-Flaschen also cautioned a cancer-marijuana
> link could emerge as baby boomers age and there may
> be smaller population groups, based on genetics or
> other factors, still at risk for marijuana-related
> cancers
> 
>
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Wednesday, May 24, 2006; Posted: 2:11 p.m. EDT
> (18:11 GMT) 
> LOS ANGELES, California (Reuters) 
> Study finds no marijuana-lung cancer link 
> 
>
http://www.cnn.com/2006/HEALTH/05/24...nn_mostpopular
> 
> 
>

> protection around 
> http://mail.yahoo.com

Subject: [sfraves] a mix from Stone Lions

Stone Lions:
http://stonelions.net/music/Thump%20Rock%20Mix%20-%20Volume%20One.mp3

Stone Lions (Marine Parade/StoneLions.net) - UK

Stone lions is the first solo project from world-respected producer
Damian Taylor, (not to be confused with German wonder-kid Daniel
Taylor). Damian was deeply involved in the last Prodigy and Freeland
albums and is currently co producing the new Freeland album with Adam.

His debut as Stone Lions 'Snow over Arizona', is a deep rolling
musical masterpiece and very true to the original Marine Parade sound,
remember 9 Nickel? The dub mix is a heavy sound-system onslaught
designed with Adam's Fabric sets in mind.

For more about Stone Lions:
http://www.myspace.com/stonelionsmusic


Stone Lions will be playing at Bassdrop!

Bassdrop
Wednesday June 21st, 2006
@ Boca (414 Jessie St.)
9pm-2am
21+ w/ID
only $5

Subject: [sfraves] Advice on Vancouver scene for aspiring raver friend? 

-------------------------------1149534458
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi, I have a friend in the Vancouver area who wants to check out some  
parties and doesn't know where to start. I told him if he goes to one party,  he'll 
get flyers, but so far he's just been to clubs and hasn't found the right  
vibe (yeah it's the same in Canada as it is here! Unless you find the right  
clubs) 
I did a little searching on the Internet but didn't find anything focused  
enough (too many entries for club events). 
Does anybody have recommendations for things like good crews in the  
Vancouver area, local stores that sell vinyl, venues to avoid, anything like  that? 
I remember in 1999 or so that Vancouver had a good reputation for parties,  
but I haven't heard recently. 
I'm half tempted to fly up there and help my friend find the good parties!  
Sounds like a fun vacation. 
Thanks, if anybody has advice for my friend.
JonnyR

-------------------------------1149534458--

Subject: [sfraves] Raindance...


was sooo fucking off HOOK!  Heavyweight Dub Champions blew everyone away, I 
have not seen anyone roll around in the dirt in years until this 
party...Sunday's pool party was supposed to be a surprise with having El 
Circo's sound system but up there but the fire marshall ordered everyone to 
pack up and head out.  Thomas' set was sweet, same with Tracy and Ooah, 
Lorin of course. My liver hates me, but we are working out a deal.  Everyone 
was very cool.  We had to close down the party to people who were on there 
way at 9pm saturday night, over 1500 peeps in attendance! but it was still 
golden.  Drum procession was over an hour long and lots of fun....
Props to Little John, Alia and the rest, wolfie and wally with security.
Everyone did a lot of work and it showed.  The most incredible set up  for a 
campout I have ever seen,  Fire tornados, poi, fire breathers, boobs 
everwhere...and then ther was Leslie Ayres making weird, yet yummy drinks
I need water  :P
Danny

didn't really feel most of lorin's set til the end- but man- lil john laid

setup this year opposed to last- however, it felt like people were not into
it as much as they were last year.  I would've liked to have been at the
party from friday til sunday evening- but sometimes life has other
responsibilities than partying!

Message-ID: <20060605210614.84209.qmail@web32410.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
Date: Mon, 5 Jun 2006 14:06:14 -0700 (PDT)
From: <dangrsmind@yahoo.com>

To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Keep those mix CDs hidden!

Here (http://www.courts.state.va.us/opinions/opncavtx/0250053.txt) is a  case where the police in Danville tried to use observation of potentially pirated CDs in someone's car as probable cause for a search which uncovered marijuana.  Note the CDs in question  were identified as pirated simply because they were in "thin cases" and had "homemade labels".  While this case was over turned on appeal, it is clear that police have been given some sort of training by the recording industry in identifying "bogus" CDs.  Other officers may attempt to use observation of such "contraband" materials as probable cause or simply just as an excuse to hassle people and search them.  Those of you seeking to avoid unwanted attention, might want to keep your mix CDs under cover. 
 
 The discussion of the definitions and legal status of mix CDs near the bottom of that page is also interesting IMO...
 
 YMMV.
 
 Peace,
 
 Peter

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Message-ID: <20060605213728.34515.qmail@web32406.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
Date: Mon, 5 Jun 2006 14:37:28 -0700 (PDT)
From: <dangrsmind@yahoo.com>
Reply-To: dangrsmind@yahoo.com
To: Bam <invibe@gmail.com>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.org
In-Reply-To: <7a86c50c0606051420o6b24608bt3a996aa0fbf2136c@mail.gmail.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Keep those mix CDs hidden!

Well, the case was over turned on appeal but the police did get a conviction in the local court first.  It looks like the law is on the right side here for now, and simple possesion of home recorded CDs is not probable cause.  That doesn't mean that the officers out there are aware of this case however,and they have clearly gotten some sort of "training" from the RIAA or their representatives.  If you read that decision you can also see the bias against EDM and dance music:
 
 
 That In this case, the officers had probable cause to believe the CDs in McLaughlin's vehicle 
failed to "conform to the provisions of  59.1-41.4."  See Code  59.1-41.5.  Testimony from the 
Commonwealth's expert, a former police officer experienced in such things, established that a 
trained officer would easily recognize these CDs to be pirated "DJ mixes" subject to statutory 
confiscation.   Packaged in their characteristic "slimline" cases, illegal "DJ mixes" do not 
identify the manufacturer by "true name and address" as Code  59.1-41.4 requires.  Making 
exactly the same assumption underlying the statute itself, the officers could reasonably conclude 
that intellectual property thieves do not provide such detailed self-disclosures.  
The officers also had ample reason to believe that whoever manufactured these "DJ 
mixes" likely did so (at least likely enough to satisfy probable cause) for the very purpose of 
distribution. 
That is, if its a DJ mix CD, its probably illegal.
 
 Peace,
 
 Peter

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Keep those mix CDs hidden!

Yes well not surprisingly the RIAA training sessions didn't require legal accuracy in the presented materials.  They are pushing their agenda which is anti-piracy and, IMO, also anti-EDM.
 
 Its clearly not illegal to posses home recordings and you can't know if any individual home made recording is illegal simply by looking at it.  You are going to need to listen and then analyze the track listing and licensing.  The RIAA is of course fully aware of this, but apparently this knowledge didn't prevent them from teaching the police officers otherwise.  Having had some dealings with these people I am not surprised at all. YMMV.
 
 Peace,
 
 Peter

As long as you aren't selling mixes or don't include a tracklisting, they're 
legal. Once you bring money into the situation or put that TL on the mix, 
things change.


Not that ANYONE ought to be selling their mixes anyway - it's not only rude, 
but illegal as all hell. If your shit ain't on a major record label, then 
you need to eat the costs like the rest of us...

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Raindance...

Yea my friend Nick and myself were one of the people turned away.  Talk 
about being bummed.  I don't live that far from Tahoe at all so it was quite 
the drive.  After 4 hours + driving and getting there, getting turned away 
was one of the last things I was expecting.  Got out of our car and 
stretched our legs with the door staff for a few minutes.  Then turned back 
around and decided to stop by the Space Girls party in Sunnyvale.

I was crushed.  Can't believe we got that close and had to go home. Shitty 
thing is that we were going to get pre-sales but neither of us has a credit 
card and when our friend was going to buy them for us on wendesday we found 
out that she had to be present for pick up of the tickets so we said screw 
we'll get them at the door. DOH!

Oh well...

Paul

----- Original Message ----
From: Danny Picard <blooshaman@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Monday, June 5, 2006 12:41:09 PM
Subject: [sfraves] Raindance...


was sooo fucking off HOOK!  Heavyweight Dub Champions blew everyone away, I 
have not seen anyone roll around in the dirt in years until this 
party...Sunday's pool party was supposed to be a surprise with having El 
Circo's sound system but up there but the fire marshall ordered everyone to 
pack up and head out.  Thomas' set was sweet, same with Tracy and Ooah, 
Lorin of course. My liver hates me, but we are working out a deal.  Everyone 
was very cool.  We had to close down the party to people who were on there 
way at 9pm saturday night, over 1500 peeps in attendance! but it was still 
golden.  Drum procession was over an hour long and lots of fun....
Props to Little John, Alia and the rest, wolfie and wally with security.
Everyone did a lot of work and it showed.  The most incredible set up  for a 
campout I have ever seen,  Fire tornados, poi, fire breathers, boobs 
everwhere...and then ther was Leslie Ayres making weird, yet yummy drinks
I need water  :P
Danny

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Raindance...

Raindance was pretty freaking amazing.. especially since Diego and the El 
Circo crew were my neighbors.. if you get a chance ask him for a copy of his 
new disk.. crap is the Latin Hip-Hop breaks mix good - will become quite the 
new direction for many I am sure.  Lorin just seems to get better and 
better.. what a soundtrack to a magical night.. HeavyWeight Dub Champions 
are a freak of nature.. their shit is so tight it came out like diamonds.  
The dirt roller.. bwahaha! My friend saw him rollin in the dirt the next 
day.. as he was trying to impress some girl and totally called him on his 
shit " Hey I know you.. youv'e done this before :)" haha Needless to say she 
blew his game.. but you gotta give props to the brutha for trying.

I got dialed into a crew from Sanoma called FutureResident(.com) and a 
beautiful woman whom I hope everyone gets to meet as some point in their 
life named Caroline.  She titles herself a futurist, creating lifestyle 
branding for individuals and helping to shape their future by seeing far 
down the path. I think i am in love again. Oh the love!

My friend Kara who tought me to spin Poi was in a gorgeous feather headdress 
and dancing capoeira to a full on 15 peice tribal drumming section from 
Santacruz.  She is a founding member of one of the bay areas premiere fire 
arts performance troupes called Nocturnal-sunshine 
(http://www.nocturnal-sunshine.com/) good shit.

By far though, the best part of this party was the POOL PARTY with  Joclynne 
throwin down the funky techno while the sun was blazin and hundreds of 
scantily clad and naked peoples imortalized one of the most epic scenes I 
have ever witnessed party side.  Wow! Oh the love!

Well i am gushing now... but what a great time.. everyone was sad it didn't 
go the extra day.. but thanks to the santa cruz and LA kidz for throwin 
down.. can't wait till next year!









SFR: Ranger
San Francisco
plurranger@hotmail.com
Who knows where the night leads
It's dark and no one can see

Subject: [sfraves] BSP for this Friday - clean air and fresh beats

get out.  clean air does the body good!  we're starting late and going
early (morning) so you can conveniently swing by after partying it up
in the city (or the south bay).


Evil Breaks & dROW Beach Party
June 9th, 2006
midnight - 7am

Killer beach party, y'all! Midnight 'til sunrise, under the stars with
the Pacific's waves crashing up a few feet away, with some of the
finest DJs around... BUT, there's very limited capacity, and
directions to the event (1 hour outside of SF) will only be given to
those who sign up before the list is closed. The list will probably
fill in the next day or two (today is 6/1), so sign up if you wanna
go! And please, only sign up if you really plan to go.

Signup for the Evil Breaks & dROW Beach Party Guestlist here:

www.EvilBreaks.com


Evil Breaks DJs:
Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks/XM Radio)
dj Bam (Evil Breaks/Invibe)
M.O.D. (Evil Breaks) - Special Sunrise set

the dRow DJs:
4matt (the dRow, Secret Breakedelica) - Trip-hop set
Jason Smith (the dRow)
Synner (the dRow)

Special Guest:
Evinrude (Renegade Ferrets)


directions will only be given to those that have signed up, and space
is very limited, so please sign up for the event.

www.EvilBreaks.com

May 13th:  So You Want Some Breaks? @ Butter

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  GEMINI ARTS MUSIC AND DANCE GATHERING 2006

--============_-1062555960==_ma============
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii" ; format="flowed"

JUNE 9,10,11th 

BROUGHT TO YOU BY: FULL CIRCLE PRODUCTIONS, PHOENIX FAMILY and YOU
to Mapquest: 14785 Belden Town Rd., Belden, Ca. 95915  (530) 283-9662

http://geomagnetic.tv/events/gemini2006.html

http://forum.isratrance.com/viewtopic.php/topic/87596/forum/28/start/45
***********************************************************


Greetings and Namaste,

The time has come once again for the legendary and much anticipated 
northern California underground outdoor music festival lovingly known 
as GEMINI. This gathering is dedicated to unifying our bay area, USA, 
and international global music family. Artists from all over the 
world and many nations have committed to creating an intentional 
community located in our own private town called Belden, 3.5hrs NE of 
San Francisco (full directions from all areas below) . That's right, 
we are taking over a whole resort, complete with bathrooms, showers 
and dance floor porta-potties.

This is a FREE gathering, (i.e. No Entrance or parking/camping Fee) 
which means it is what we all make it. To support this gathering 
please LEAVE NO TRACE and prepare to clean up after yourself and to 
urge your neighbors/friends to do the same
Please CARPOOL to save room for camping and for the environment. =)

We are calling out to any and all participants who would like to help 
create a sacred, mystical setting for us to experience true freedom 
and bliss. If you have decorations, want to volunteer time, anything 
that you think would make this gathering better or safer
Please contact: Richard (wichdokta@hotmail.com)

Please welcome all the new family members that are traveling from 
across the world to present their music and artistic creations for us 
enjoy. The new energy is going to be very welcome on the dance floor. 
This is going to be something a very unique and special gathering.

We proudly present 3 stages of different music for your listening 
pleasure. a dance stage, chill area and we have a whole stage of live 
rock n roll, jam, hip-hop, "techno" and reggae style bands during the 
day and early evening to bring back that old GEMINI vibe. PLEASE 
NOTE: Renegade sound systems will not be tolerated, you will be shut 
down and kindly asked to leave the gathering. Spread the word to all 
family and friends about this UNIQUE and SACRED gathering and the 
amazing new venue. So get ready to have a great time and collectively 
transform this town into a "PSYCHEDELIC CITY".

Belden Resort
14785 Belden Town Rd., Belden, Ca. 95915 (530) 283-9662
Surrounded by majestic mountains, you will drive by many waterfalls 
and through rock mountain tunnels, view luscious valleys of green and 
old bridges on your journey into the Sierra foothills. The river that 
runs adjacent to the town is great for rafting and swimming. The 
event location has plenty of camping under the trees. There is an Old 
Style Saloon there for drinks, snax and water. All cabins at Belden 
are now reserved. There are additional Rooms for rent only 1.5 miles 
from the event at the beautiful Pine Air Hotel (530) 283 - 1730

Sound on both stages by: Full Circle featuring a giant system for the 
Dance Stage with 30,000 watts of Pleasure!
Visuals on both stages by: Geomagnetic.tv
Decorations and Sacred Shrines by: Mindalters, Taodeco and the Phoenix Family
LINE UP FOR DANCE STAGE

Friday Night - Saturday Morning

11 pm Moondogg
12 am Sylph ( Shiva Shakti, Texas )
1 am Helios ( Geomagnetic Rec./Phoenix Family, S.F. )
2 am Nikon ( Psybertribe Rec., S.F. )

Friday Night - Saturday Morning

LINE UP FOR LIVE BANDS STAGE

(Time Slots TBA)

THE MOUNTAIN GYPSIES BAND (Concow, CA)
BAHTOU (Concow, CA)
THE ANCIENT I'S (Chico, CA)
OHM (Chico, CA)
THE RESONATORS (Concow, CA)

(More To Be Announced at the event)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
** FROM THE BAY AREA **

Take hwy. 80 towards Sacramento. Take the Hwy. 505 off ramp and 
follow it to I-5. Take the I-5 North to Williams. Once in Williams, 
take the Hwy.20 East. ( Follow the Hwy.20 signs when you come to the 
first town ). Once past the first town you will follow Hwy.20 to Yuba 
City/Marysville. These 2 towns are separated only by a bridge, you 
can't miss it. Once over the bridge and in Marysville, be in the fast 
lane and follow the Hwy.70 signs. It's alittle tricky but if you pay 
attention you will get through it. Follow Hwy.70 about 49 miles past 
Oroville and turn right into Belden Town. There are signs for the 
town on the Hwy. "

** FROM NORTH OF S.F. ** (Anywhere north of Santa Rosa)

Take Hwy. 101 to Hwy.20 East 5 miles north of Ukiah. Follow Hwy.20 
all the way to Yuba City/Marysville. ( pay close attention to the 
Hwy.20 signs at the first town past Williams). Once in Yuba 
City/Marysville you will go over a bridge ( this bridge separates the 
towns, you can't miss it ) be in the fast lane and follow the Hwy.70 
signs. It's a little tricky so pay attention. Follow Hwy.70 about 49 
miles past Oroville to Belden Town. There are signs on the Hwy. for 
this town. Take a right over the bridge and your there.

** FROM LOS ANGELES **

Take the I-5 North to the Hwy.99 junction and take the Hwy.99 to Yuba 
City. Take a right onto Hwy.20 towards Marysville. Be in the fast 
lane and follow the Hwy.70 signs once over the Marysville Bridge. You 
can't miss it. Follow the Hwy. 70 signs carefully, they're a little 
tricky. Follow Hwy.70 about 49 miles past Oroville to Belden Town. 
There are signs on the Hwy. for this Town. Take a right over the 
bridge and your there.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"No sage or savior has ever endorsed greed and gluttony as a path 
toward social justice or personal fulfillment.  These sane and 
enlightened people come to us from all cultures and all eras, 
sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and 
Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can 
find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and 
economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond 
what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative 
pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in 
squalor."
-Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of 
the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will 
gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

JUNE 9,10,11th

BROUGHT TO YOU BY: FULL CIRCLE PRODUCTIONS, PHOENIX FAMILY and YOU
to Mapquest: 14785 Belden Town Rd., Belden, Ca. 95915  (530) 283-9662

http://geomagnetic.tv/events/gemini2006.html

http://forum.isratrance.com/viewtopic.php/topic/87596/forum/28/start/45
***********************************************************


Greetings and Namaste,

The time has come once again for the legendary and much anticipated =20
northern California underground outdoor music festival lovingly known =20=

as GEMINI. This gathering is dedicated to unifying our bay area, USA, =20=

and international global music family. Artists from all over the =20
world and many nations have committed to creating an intentional =20
community located in our own private town called Belden, 3.5hrs NE of =20=

San Francisco (full directions from all areas below) . That's right, =20
we are taking over a whole resort, complete with bathrooms, showers =20
and dance floor porta-potties.

This is a FREE gathering, (i.e. No Entrance or parking/camping Fee) =20
which means it is what we all make it. To support this gathering =20
please LEAVE NO TRACE and prepare to clean up after yourself and to =20
urge your neighbors/friends to do the same
Please CARPOOL to save room for camping and for the environment. =3D)

We are calling out to any and all participants who would like to help =20=

create a sacred, mystical setting for us to experience true freedom =20
and bliss. If you have decorations, want to volunteer time, anything =20
that you think would make this gathering better or safer
Please contact: Richard (wichdokta@hotmail.com)

Please welcome all the new family members that are traveling from =20
across the world to present their music and artistic creations for us =20=

enjoy. The new energy is going to be very welcome on the dance floor. =20=

This is going to be something a very unique and special gathering.

We proudly present 3 stages of different music for your listening =20
pleasure. a dance stage, chill area and we have a whole stage of live =20=

rock n roll, jam, hip-hop, =93techno=94 and reggae style bands during =
the =20
day and early evening to bring back that old GEMINI vibe. PLEASE =20
NOTE: Renegade sound systems will not be tolerated, you will be shut =20
down and kindly asked to leave the gathering. Spread the word to all =20
family and friends about this UNIQUE and SACRED gathering and the =20
amazing new venue. So get ready to have a great time and collectively =20=

transform this town into a "PSYCHEDELIC CITY".

Belden Resort
14785 Belden Town Rd., Belden, Ca. 95915 (530) 283-9662
Surrounded by majestic mountains, you will drive by many waterfalls =20
and through rock mountain tunnels, view luscious valleys of green and =20=

old bridges on your journey into the Sierra foothills. The river that =20=

runs adjacent to the town is great for rafting and swimming. The =20
event location has plenty of camping under the trees. There is an Old =20=

Style Saloon there for drinks, snax and water. All cabins at Belden =20
are now reserved. There are additional Rooms for rent only 1.5 miles =20
from the event at the beautiful Pine Air Hotel (530) 283 - 1730

Sound on both stages by: Full Circle featuring a giant system for the =20=

Dance Stage with 30,000 watts of Pleasure!
Visuals on both stages by: Geomagnetic.tv
Decorations and Sacred Shrines by: Mindalters, Taodeco and the =20
Phoenix Family

------------------------------------------------------------------------=20=

------------------------------------------------------
** FROM THE BAY AREA **

Take hwy. 80 towards Sacramento. Take the Hwy. 505 off ramp and =20
follow it to I-5. Take the I-5 North to Williams. Once in Williams, =20
take the Hwy.20 East. ( Follow the Hwy.20 signs when you come to the =20
first town ). Once past the first town you will follow Hwy.20 to Yuba =20=

City/Marysville. These 2 towns are separated only by a bridge, you =20
can't miss it. Once over the bridge and in Marysville, be in the fast =20=

lane and follow the Hwy.70 signs. It's alittle tricky but if you pay =20
attention you will get through it. Follow Hwy.70 about 49 miles past =20
Oroville and turn right into Belden Town. There are signs for the =20
town on the Hwy. "

** FROM NORTH OF S.F. ** (Anywhere north of Santa Rosa)

Take Hwy. 101 to Hwy.20 East 5 miles north of Ukiah. Follow Hwy.20 =20
all the way to Yuba City/Marysville. ( pay close attention to the Hwy.=20=

20 signs at the first town past Williams). Once in Yuba City/=20
Marysville you will go over a bridge ( this bridge separates the =20
towns, you can't miss it ) be in the fast lane and follow the Hwy.70 =20
signs. It's a little tricky so pay attention. Follow Hwy.70 about 49 =20
miles past Oroville to Belden Town. There are signs on the Hwy. for =20
this town. Take a right over the bridge and your there.

** FROM LOS ANGELES **

Take the I-5 North to the Hwy.99 junction and take the Hwy.99 to Yuba =20=

City. Take a right onto Hwy.20 towards Marysville. Be in the fast =20
lane and follow the Hwy.70 signs once over the Marysville Bridge. You =20=

can't miss it. Follow the Hwy. 70 signs carefully, they're a little =20
tricky. Follow Hwy.70 about 49 miles past Oroville to Belden Town. =20
There are signs on the Hwy. for this Town. Take a right over the =20
bridge and your there.
------------------------------------------------------------------------=20=

"No sage or savior has ever endorsed greed and gluttony as a path =20
toward social justice or personal fulfillment.  These sane and =20
enlightened people come to us from all cultures and all eras, =20
sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and =20
Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can =20
find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and =20
economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond =20
what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative =20
pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in =20
squalor."
-Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of =20
the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will =20
gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

National Day of Slayer

6.6.06 isn't a date that comes around very often (once per  
millennium, to be exact), and while plenty of stupid horror movies  
and terrible albums will be released for the hype value of the day  
that bears "the number of the beast", we here at NDoS decided that  
this would be a perfect day for Hessians across the country to come  
together and engage in something upon which we can all agree -  
listening to Slayer! Also, do you really want those evangelical Neo- 
Cons to have all the fun with their "National Day of Prayer"?

http://www.nationaldayofslayer.org/

sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and  
Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can  
find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and  
economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond  
what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative  
pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in  
squalor."
-Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.

Subject: [sfraves] My WR thingie: Friday & Saturday :)

So Friday i was reeeeeeeally just planning on staying home, do homework,
watch some The N shows, la la la... anywaze... Atomic wanted to go 2 Anu &
well... I said why not! :)

So we went to Anu... YAY.. saw alota family!!  It was Dope!! :)  Danced my
ass off here & there to the yummy house!!! I forgot who that 1 dude was
who spun, then tagged w/ AP.. but WOW.. YUMMY!!!

So the night was still young, wait, no.. it was almost 2.. so we went 2
DNA to see what was up there :)  LoL... ok.. lol.. it was Asain Hip Hop
night there & man.. it was like heeeeeella people!  LoL.. Ummm.. i guess
we caught the tail end of Apollo's (a la Scratch Pickles etc fame) & i
talked to him for a bit... danced on stage for a while!!  It was fun!!

OK.. this trip me out the most.. i the corner.. lol.. there was a
Philipino food Booth.. they sold Adobo, rice, lumpia, desserts..
LOLOLMAO!!!  Loved it!

Well.. we cut out from there then went to 1015 where there were like
already closing 'cause it was a slow night.. but the coolest thing about
goin' there was getting a bacon wrapped hot dog w/ everything on the
corner.. like this dude had like a grill & everything on the corner!

so that was a fun unexpected night :D

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Friday-Night%206-2-06/

Saturday night was Dope!!  Went 2 Bodhistava.. YAAAAY!!!  So Dope!  OK..
the music was YUMMY.. so mondo Dope!!!  Oh mygosh... like Techno &
Breaks.. ooooooooooh yeah!  Saw alota people there & got 2 hang w/ Family
all night (Love U Nico) :)  Awesome crowd!!!  Oh yeah.. this ummm.. new
"spot".. WOW!!  Love It!!! :)

I guess the headliner was Drum Cell was the headliner.. lol.. like when i
saw him.. we had aloooota to talk about 'cause we ain't seen each other in
2 years.. so yeah.. he broke off w/ his tag partner (Thank God) & he's
just flyin' solo now!!  Hos set was pretty Sick also!!! Man.. all the
sets...

All the sets were Yummy!!!  I was really impressed w/ Aaron Jae's set
thatnight.. honestly.. i mean.. he went DARK.. i never heard him spin a
set like that b4... just lol.. DARK!!!  That's the only way i know how 2
describe it :)

Very fun night!  Ya know.. & as tired & cracked out from dancing most the
whole night.. i had this mondo smile on my face goin' home on BART & bus
:)

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/bodhistava%206-3-2006/

On 6/6/06, Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org> wrote:
>
> National Day of Slayer
>
> 6.6.06 isn't a date that comes around very often (once per
> millennium, to be exact), and while plenty of stupid horror movies
> and terrible albums will be released for the hype value of the day
> that bears "the number of the beast", we here at NDoS decided that
> this would be a perfect day for Hessians across the country to come
> together and engage in something upon which we can all agree -
> listening to Slayer! Also, do you really want those evangelical Neo-
> Cons to have all the fun with their "National Day of Prayer"?
>
> http://www.nationaldayofslayer.org/
>
>
>
> apollo@speakeasy.org
>
> MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo
>
> Tribenet:   http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k
>
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
>
> House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
>
>
> "No sage or savior has ever endorsed greed and gluttony as a path
> toward social justice or personal fulfillment.  These sane and
> enlightened people come to us from all cultures and all eras,
> sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and
> Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can
> find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and
> economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond
> what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative
> pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in
> squalor."
> -Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.
>
> "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of
> the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will
> gradually become visible."
> -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
>
>
>

>>> listening to Slayer! Also, do you really want those evangelical Neo-
>>> Cons to have all the fun with their "National Day of Prayer"?
>>>
>>> http://www.nationaldayofslayer.org/

>>> apollo@speakeasy.org

>>> http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>>>

>>> "No sage or savior has ever endorsed greed and gluttony as a path
>>> toward social justice or personal fulfillment.  These sane and
>>> enlightened people come to us from all cultures and all eras,
>>> sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and
>>> Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can
>>> find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and
>>> economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond
>>> what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative
>>> pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in
>>> squalor."
>>> -Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.
>>>
>>> "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of
>>> the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will
>>> gradually become visible."
>>> -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

Subject: [sfraves] washington post magazine iso 9/11 memorials for special issue





fyi, if anyone is interested ...

message from the washington post magazine

< To commemorate the upcoming 5th anniversary of September 11th 2001,  the
Magazine intends to publish a special photography issue featuring memorials
to victims of the attacks in New York, Washington and Pennsylvania. The
memorials can be located in this area or someplace else in the country or
the world and can range from the very personal, such as body tattoos or a
mural or message painted on a car, to large-scale monuments, murals,
gardens and sculptures. The more unusual or visual, the better. >

contact:  Jennifer Beeson  beesonj@washpost.com

respectfully,
mary

Subject: RE: [sfraves] crush-o-matic funkness

Thanks to everyone who made it out and kept the dancefloor rocking until we
shut at 7.  Chuck was amazing I've never seen anyone combine so many skills
behind the decks let alone as seemlessly as he does it.

Bam you must have been talking about when Deron and Mike Frugaletti were
playing, Mike is part of DHP and Deron runs Stompy they have Jason Hodges
coming in on Friday at Mighty he's really really good and in a similar
style.  The Stompy/Sunset parties at Cocomo on 3 day weekends are the best
club event in the city by far, if you've never been you have to go, great
venue great energy.  Stompy is one of the few really pushing the jackin'
style of house in SF right now.

A

Subject: RE: [sfraves] nrr: Looking for new home by 7/1

Of course you don't fall under rent control if:

Rent Control Coverage
San Francisco's rent control law covers most rental property in San
Francisco. If you live in San Francisco, you are covered by rent control
unless you fall into one of these major exceptions:

1. You live in a building constructed after June of 1979. This "new
construction exemption" is the biggest exemption in SF and can not be
changed locally because it is mandated by state law.

2. You live in subsidized housing, such as HUD housing projects.

3. You live in a dormitory, monastery, nunnery, etc.

4. You live in a residential hotel and have less than 28 days of
continuous tenancy.

> treasure....technically, yes, it is SF
> do you know the lagalities?

Subject: [sfraves] RIP Billy Preston

--=====================_2652984==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Washington - Grammy-winner Billy Preston, often described as the fifth Beatle for his work as a keyboardist with the group, died Tuesday at age 59 in Scottsdale, Arizona, media reports said. 

Preston collaborated with the Liverpool rockers on the albums Let it Be, Abbey Road and the White Album, but also worked with the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, Ray Charles and Bob Dylan, to name a few. 

He was signed by Apple records in the 1960s and followed up his collaborations with a string of solo hits, including the Grammy- winning Outta Space, as well as Will It Go Round In Circles, Nothing From Nothing and Space Race. 

Preston died in a hospital in Scottsdale after falling into a coma on November 21, from which he would never emerge, after medical complications that included kidney failure. 

© 2006 dpa - Deutsche Presse-Agentur 




MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

something like 2,000 square feet of land.

oh well, guess we'll just stick to feeding the families with home grown
food.

Content-Disposition: inline

The Extra Credit presents:

FIELD DAY!
July 14- July 16, 2006


Pining for the days of Summer Camp? Well, pine no more! The Extra
Credit will be throwing a campout located three hours from the Bay
Area to bring back those golden summer days of yore. Enjoy games like
Capture the Flag, Red Rover, Tug o' War, Kick Ball, and many more.
Groove to Downtempo, Trip-Hop, Hip-hop, IDM, and little bit of House
from two different stages. Roast S'mores and pop popcorn over an open
bonfire. Stop by our outdoor theater for a screening of the best 80s
movies under the stars. Prepare to become ecstatic with glee in a
bygone era of Pixie Stix, lemonade, and PB&J sandwiches. FIELD DAY! is
near!

More info coming soon....

------=_Part_62097_31843456.1149639848239--
