Subject: [sfraves] BSP: BASSDROP - Deep Impact, Stone Lions @ BOCA

Bassdrop
Wednesday June 21st, 2006
@ Boca (414 Jessie St.)
9pm-2am
21+ w/ID
only $5


You know how Evil Breaks does it. Super cheap with sick talent. Help
us kick off our new monthly @ BOCA with not one, but two amazing
headliners. We've taken over 3rd Wednesdays and from now on, hump day
won't be so bad. Ed209 to follow in July, and Carbon Community to
follow in August.


Featuring:

Deep Impact (Broke/Lot 49/Super Charged/Plastic Raygun/Cyberfunk) - UK

Deep Impact (aka Mark East) is a DJ/Producer from the UK who
originally started out as a Drum & Bass DJ way back in 1994, mainly
DJing in clubs and on the UKs extreme sport circuit with fellow DJ, DJ
Dust (Sie Dyson). Around 1999 the pair were hearing more and more of a
new sound that was emerging in the UK called Breakbeat and decided to
team up in the studio to have a go themselves, the subsequent track
was called "Give It" which was signed to Plastic Raygun.

Mark continued to produce with Simon moving to Brighton based
Supercharged to record tracks like "Methods" and "I Love Music" along
with remixes for The Freestylers. But unfortunately due to family
commitments Simon would have to quit, the pair's last work together
would be the mix album "Heavy Weight Breaks 2" and after a tour Simon
hung up his headphones.

Mark continued to DJ and produce and went on to write tracks such as
"Carpet Muncher" for Cyberfunk, "Rock Tha House" with fellow heavy
weight Distortionz and set up his own label Broke Recordings which
would see him team up with the Autobots for tracks such as "The
Spanish Tune" and "Bomba Latina" as well as his current outing and
IDJ's single of the month "Ultrafunkula" and "Rockin' With The Best."



Stone Lions (Marine Parade/StoneLions.net)

Stone lions is the first solo project from world-respected producer
Damian Taylor, (not to be confused with German wonder-kid Daniel
Taylor). Damian was deeply involved in the last Prodigy and Freeland
albums and is currently co producing the new Freeland album with Adam.

His debut as Stone Lions 'Snow over Arizona', is a deep rolling
musical masterpiece and very true to the original Marine Parade sound,
remember 9 Nickel? The dub mix is a heavy sound-system onslaught
designed with Adam's Fabric sets in mind.



Along with dj's:

Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks/XM Radio/AaronJae.com)
Athena (Evil Breaks)
Emerge (Disfunktion Crew/Breaks FM)


Check out mixes & get more info:
www.EvilBreaks.com

Signup to our mailing list to get info on all our events as well as a
chance to win free tickets.
-- 
--------------------------
< Brandon / DJ Bam >

DJ Bam - serving breaks and beats
http://www.evilbreaks.com

July 3rd:  Dyn-O-Might! w/ the Breakfastaz @ Mighty
July 19th:  Bassdrop w/ Ed209 @ BOCA

Subject: [sfraves] iSlave karma

Interesting Article referenced on Slashdot today:

"MacWorld summarizes an article published in the U.K., stating that 
Apple's iPods are made in China by women who work 15 hours/day, make 
$50/month, and have to pay half of that right back to the company for 
housing and food. The article also claims the workers live in 
dormitories where they are housed 100 per room, and are not allowed 
visitors."

On the same note:

 I have always been a huge anti speed kills oponent. If you look at all the
traffic accident statistics and use common sense, the number one (by
far) cause of crashes is not paying attention.

 and going too fast for a specific situation is not paying attention.

sorry for the rant, but the NTSB is a piece of shit waste of our taxes.

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

Subject: [sfraves] WR: Thursday - Sunday (I'll try to make it short)

So Thursday night was the big Asindee Jungle Battle.. So Dope!!  I mean..
all my Homies tore it up on the Deck & WOW!!  Loved it!!!  My Faves were
actually DJs Sik & KODA... I did like Ivry's set alot actually 'cause it
went from like Evil shit to like Dubby Yummy stuff :)  LoL.. I mean.. I
Love Audio One's set also.. he was Sick.. there was even a DJ who opened
up w/ a Christmas Carol that everyone on the floor started swing dancing
to.. Hello 2day :)  The DJs who actually won were Ivry 1st, Sik, 2nd, &
KODA 3rd... there was like this mondo contriversy over who took 1st 'cause
every1 though Sik & KODA's set were both better than Ivry's :\  But it
wqas still fun!!!

Method1 like closed out the night spinning this fucki'n Mad Wiked set.. oh
yeah.. Retox opened up the night!! :)  It was Dope!
http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Asindee%20Jungle%20Battle%20june%208%2006/

Friday night.. went to BOCA for that Ignition shindig w/ Unka!!  WOW..
Hello 2Day.. like right when we got up 2 the outside thingie.. like
heeeeeella people greeted us.. LoL.. Ok.. something funny about that
also.. Heeeeeella people came up to me there & asked me if i remembered
them from Ascension in Berkel;ey & ofcourse i remembered them!  :)

As soon as we got in.. Myagi was spinning & I went up 2 the front &
danced.. lol. he like looked up & pointed & like smiled, so i went back
behind the dj table & hugged him.. oh yeah.. SICK FUICKIN SET!  LoL.. it
was Dope!!  After his set, Jay Vigor & ummm... grrr, what's his name
ummm.. Influence!!! :)  They killed it!!!

Crowd, Dope!!  Alota Family!!  I LOVE U KATYA!!! YAAAAAAAAAAAAYAYAYAYAY0 :P

Then we went 2 the EB/dROW outdoor... all i gotta say is WOW!!  SO FUCKIN'
DOPE!!!!  Like the Beach location.. Perfect.. i never saw that side of
that area b4.. so nice!!! :) Ummm.. OK.. Aaron Jae Spun yummy breaks,
MODdie spun (a very EKlekic mix of Tech House. Proggy House, & Breaks :)
Ummm.. then long hair dude spun some ooh... i wanna say Chill music.. but
io dont' rememgber that far back... LoL

Awesome Groovy People showed.. Alota Family... had so much playing in the
sand, water, Sea Amemonies.. LoL.. Wow!!!  :)   It was actually pretty
redfereshing dancing on the beach!! :)
http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Ignition%20-%20EB%20dROW%20BEach%20Rave%206-9-06/

Saturday... went across the street for some REAL Mexican food 'cause the
youngest Son Graduted from high school & they had a fiesta for him!!! 
OK>>> YUMMY FUCKIN" FOOD!!!  HELLO 2DAY :)

OK.. i gotta make a new post for Sunday 'cause that'll be reeeeeally
lengthy.. lol

Subject: [sfraves] WR pt 2: Sunday.. Hello 2Day :)

So Sunday wqas Haight Street Fair & YAAAAAY.. i totally got 2 be Stage
MAanger again.. Year 2! :)  Like it was Dope & kinda tiring (being that i
only got like anywhere btween like half an hour to an hour sleep the early
morning of), but I kinda just like let the adrealine rush of the day just
carry me through.. LoL...

So like we had like 6 bands i think & Like 8 DJs spin... it was Dope..
like i mean... the band performances went from like a Cover band to
Electro Clash Bands then punk Rock to Heavy Metal to a kids school of rock
thingie where kids aged from 5 to 16 played punk covers :)  It was Dope!

There was the lead singer of ummm.. Mile High Club no no no wait.. All
Time Highs well.. he was part of Death Angel, that Bay Area Filipino 
Metal Thrash band from the late 80s-90s that made noise on MTV actually...
anywaze.. so like his cousin in the band dated my cousin's wife's cousin &
like this 1 time like oh shit... 13-14 years ago.. we hung out @ Death
Angel's pad like in South City.. so that was Hello 2Day So Mondo Dope
re-connecting w/ him again :)

It was Sick.. like 11 AM.. Qzen & Felix like started out spinning Electro
Clash, Techno, Breaks, & house thingie... it was Dope!!!  DJ MEI-LWUN
spun like this Pop Music set that ranged from like well.. ok.. there was
some Britney & some ummm.. what's that groups name again.. ummm... not
Fuggees, but ummm.. the "La La La, don't play w/ my heart, I wonder if I
take you home" group.. well.. yeah... I kinda need 2 wake up so i danced
alot alot alot http://static.flickr.com/63/165863225_c94ee279be.jpg?v=0

But yeah man.. I Love bein a stage manager!!!  It sooo much fun like doin'
that organizing stuff & talkin' 2 all the bands.. i got a few free CDs
from my faves that day... but yeah... ooh my gosh man.. if u them kids
from that school of rock.. u woulda been WOW!!! :) <3

Didn't really see alota SFR Groovers, but i did see alota Fam that day as
well :)  YAY!!!

http://s81.photobucket.com/albums/j231/GroovyDope/Haight%20STreet%20Fair%202006/

Subject: [sfraves] Home Depot drug smuggling OOPS!

------=_NextPart_000_00A8_01C68FA9.9DD513F0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/06/14/home.depot.drugs/index.html

(CNN) -- Large quantities of drugs were found inside merchandise from at =
least two Home Depot stores in Massachusetts, and authorities are =
investigating, police said Wednesday.

A contractor late last week discovered two 50-pound "bricks" of =
marijuana wrapped in plastic bags inside a bathroom vanity he had =
purchased at a Home Depot store in Tewksbury, said Chief of Detectives =
Lt. Dennis Peterson.

The estimated street value of the marijuana is around $145,000, Peterson =
said.

Similar incidents have occurred in other parts of the state.=20

A plumber purchased a vanity in western Massachusetts on Monday in which =
he later found 3 kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of marijuana, =
with a total estimated street value of $250,000, according to the =
Southwick Police Department.=20

Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item was purchased at "a =
local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home Depot.

According to Peterson, a third individual discovered large quantities of =
illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise.=20

Peterson would not provide the details of that incident but said it was =
part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were working =
with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement =
Administration (DEA).

Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a search Tuesday of about =
12 Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that =
contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many drug =
caches were discovered in the search.

In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the =
merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were distributed =
through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.

"I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution center and =
someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that person =
[who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty that =
day or the packages were marked wrong."

The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The Home Depot =
was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one employed by =
the company is a suspect at this time.=20

Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the =
vanities that contained drugs are suspects.

In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is cooperating =
with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will support =
law enforcement in any way possible to help bring those responsible to =
justice."=20

------=_NextPart_000_00A8_01C68FA9.9DD513F0--

I get $1,450 a pound(?) Must be some Acapulco Gold!

"Marc(O)" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:  http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/06/14/home.depot.drugs/index.html

(CNN) -- Large quantities of drugs were found inside merchandise from at least two Home Depot stores in Massachusetts, and authorities are investigating, police said Wednesday.

A contractor late last week discovered two 50-pound "bricks" of marijuana wrapped in plastic bags inside a bathroom vanity he had purchased at a Home Depot store in Tewksbury, said Chief of Detectives Lt. Dennis Peterson.

The estimated street value of the marijuana is around $145,000, Peterson said.

Similar incidents have occurred in other parts of the state. 

A plumber purchased a vanity in western Massachusetts on Monday in which he later found 3 kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of marijuana, with a total estimated street value of $250,000, according to the Southwick Police Department. 

Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item was purchased at "a local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home Depot.

According to Peterson, a third individual discovered large quantities of illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise. 

Peterson would not provide the details of that incident but said it was part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were working with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA).

Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a search Tuesday of about 12 Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many drug caches were discovered in the search.

In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were distributed through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.

"I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution center and someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that person [who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty that day or the packages were marked wrong."

The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The Home Depot was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one employed by the company is a suspect at this time. 

Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the vanities that contained drugs are suspects.

In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is cooperating with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will support law enforcement in any way possible to help bring those responsible to justice."

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Alex Laughlin" <aldendy@gmail.com>
Cc: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 1:26 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Home Depot drug smuggling OOPS!


>I suddenly have a very strong urge to go buy a bathroom vanity from home 
>depot.
>
> Marc(O) wrote:
>
>>http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/06/14/home.depot.drugs/index.html
>>
>>(CNN) -- Large quantities of drugs were found inside merchandise from at 
>>least two Home Depot stores in Massachusetts, and authorities are 
>>investigating, police said Wednesday.
>>
>>A contractor late last week discovered two 50-pound "bricks" of marijuana 
>>wrapped in plastic bags inside a bathroom vanity he had purchased at a 
>>Home Depot store in Tewksbury, said Chief of Detectives Lt. Dennis 
>>Peterson.
>>
>>The estimated street value of the marijuana is around $145,000, Peterson 
>>said.
>>
>>Similar incidents have occurred in other parts of the state.
>>A plumber purchased a vanity in western Massachusetts on Monday in which 
>>he later found 3 kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of marijuana, 
>>with a total estimated street value of $250,000, according to the 
>>Southwick Police Department.
>>Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item was purchased at "a 
>>local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home Depot.
>>
>>According to Peterson, a third individual discovered large quantities of 
>>illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise.
>>Peterson would not provide the details of that incident but said it was 
>>part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were working 
>>with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement 
>>Administration (DEA).
>>
>>Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a search Tuesday of about 12 
>>Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that 
>>contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many drug 
>>caches were discovered in the search.
>>
>>In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the 
>>merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were distributed 
>>through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.
>>
>>"I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution center and 
>>someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that person 
>>[who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty that 
>>day or the packages were marked wrong."
>>
>>The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The Home Depot 
>>was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one employed by 
>>the company is a suspect at this time.
>>Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the 
>>vanities that contained drugs are suspects.
>>
>>In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is cooperating 
>>with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will support law 
>>enforcement in any way possible to help bring those responsible to 
>>justice."
>>
>

> For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "CHUCK G"
> To: "Marc(O)" ; "SFR"
> Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 12:03 PM
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] Home Depot drug smuggling OOPS!
>
>
>>I get $1,450 a pound(?) Must be some Acapulco Gold!
>>
>> "Marc(O)" wrote:
>> http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/06/14/home.depot.drugs/index.html
>>
>> (CNN) -- Large quantities of drugs were found inside merchandise from at
>> least two Home Depot stores in Massachusetts, and authorities are
>> investigating, police said Wednesday.
>>
>> A contractor late last week discovered two 50-pound "bricks" of marijuana
>> wrapped in plastic bags inside a bathroom vanity he had purchased at a
>> Home Depot store in Tewksbury, said Chief of Detectives Lt. Dennis
>> Peterson.
>>
>> The estimated street value of the marijuana is around $145,000, Peterson
>> said.
>>
>> Similar incidents have occurred in other parts of the state.
>>
>> A plumber purchased a vanity in western Massachusetts on Monday in which
>> he later found 3 kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of marijuana,
>> with a total estimated street value of $250,000, according to the
>> Southwick Police Department.
>>
>> Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item was purchased at "a
>> local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home Depot.
>>
>> According to Peterson, a third individual discovered large quantities of
>> illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise.
>>
>> Peterson would not provide the details of that incident but said it was
>> part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were working
>> with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement
>> Administration (DEA).
>>
>> Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a search Tuesday of about 12
>> Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that
>> contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many drug
>> caches were discovered in the search.
>>
>> In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the
>> merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were distributed
>> through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.
>>
>> "I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution center and
>> someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that person
>> [who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty that
>> day or the packages were marked wrong."
>>
>> The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The Home Depot
>> was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one employed by
>> the company is a suspect at this time.
>>
>> Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the
>> vanities that contained drugs are suspects.
>>
>> In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is cooperating
>> with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will support law
>> enforcement in any way possible to help bring those responsible to
>> justice."
>>
>>
>>

> >>

> >> local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home

> of
> >> illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise.
> >>
> >> Peterson would not provide the details of that incident but said it was
> >> part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were
> working
> >> with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement
> >> Administration (DEA).
> >>
> >> Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a search Tuesday of about
> 12
> >> Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that
> >> contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many drug
> >> caches were discovered in the search.
> >>
> >> In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the
> >> merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were distributed
> >> through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.
> >>
> >> "I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution center
> and
> >> someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that person
> >> [who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty that
> >> day or the packages were marked wrong."
> >>
> >> The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The Home Depot
> >> was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one employed by
> >> the company is a suspect at this time.
> >>
> >> Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the
> >> vanities that contained drugs are suspects.
> >>
> >> In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is
> cooperating
> >> with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will support
> law
> >> enforcement in any way possible to help bring those responsible to
> >> justice."

> I get $1,450 a pound(?) Must be some Acapulco Gold!

> "Marc(O)" <electrofunk138@hotmail.com> wrote: 
>
http://www.cnn.com/2006/US/06/14/home.depot.drugs/index.html
> 
> (CNN) -- Large quantities of drugs were found inside
> merchandise from at least two Home Depot stores in
> Massachusetts, and authorities are investigating,
> police said Wednesday.
> 
> A contractor late last week discovered two 50-pound
> "bricks" of marijuana wrapped in plastic bags inside
> a bathroom vanity he had purchased at a Home Depot
> store in Tewksbury, said Chief of Detectives Lt.
> Dennis Peterson.
> 
> The estimated street value of the marijuana is
> around $145,000, Peterson said.
> 
> Similar incidents have occurred in other parts of
> the state. 
> 
> A plumber purchased a vanity in western
> Massachusetts on Monday in which he later found 3
> kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of
> marijuana, with a total estimated street value of
> $250,000, according to the Southwick Police
> Department. 
> 
> Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item
> was purchased at "a local hardware store" but would
> not confirm it came from The Home Depot.
> 
> According to Peterson, a third individual discovered
> large quantities of illegal drugs inside Home Depot
> merchandise. 
> 
> Peterson would not provide the details of that
> incident but said it was part of the overall
> investigation and that Tewksbury police were working
> with their Southwick counterparts and the federal
> Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA).
> 
> Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a
> search Tuesday of about 12 Home Depot stores
> statewide and found other bathroom vanities that
> contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not
> elaborate on how many drug caches were discovered in
> the search.
> 
> In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury
> Police, all of the merchandise boxes originated from
> a Texas location and were distributed through one
> Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.
> 
> "I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the
> distribution center and someone was supposed to
> intercept them," Peterson said. "So that person [who
> was supposed to intercept the packages] either
> wasn't on duty that day or the packages were marked
> wrong."
> 
> The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both
> said The Home Depot was cooperating fully with their
> investigations, and no one employed by the company
> is a suspect at this time. 
> 
> Both departments also said none of the customers who
> purchased the vanities that contained drugs are
> suspects.
> 
> In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The
> company is cooperating with authorities as they
> investigate this matter, and we will support law
> enforcement in any way possible to help bring those
> responsible to justice."

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Home Depot drug smuggling OOPS!

-------------------------------1150319626
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

I think it's (delightfully) ironic because Home Depot makes such a big deal  
about having a strict drug policy. 
 
There are signs you can see before you even go in saying that everybody is  
drug tested, to the effect of "you can shop here comfortable in the knowledge  
that no drug users will be interacting with you." 
 
OK, I don't want anybody to be really high while driving a forklift in my  
direction. Definitely don't want people in that job getting high AT work.  
Before? Maybe, depends how many hours. At home at night, and on weekends?  Totally 
their own business. 
 
If they have a forklift accident and then the company wants to test them, I  
guess that's ok. But even still, I'd want proof that drugs contributed toward  
the accident, not that they smoked a blunt three weeks ago. 
 
I've had some management training, and the company (a very large one) said  
they don't do drug testing largely because they feel alcohol abuse is at least  
as much of a problem (I'll drink to that, lol), and nobody has the nerve to  
start testing every employee for alcohol use. 
 
They therefore go by job PERFORMANCE -- if you're doing your job well (and  
safely), what's the problem? Go after the people who are fucking up, FOR 
fucking  up, not for arbitrary reasons that will make conservative customers happy. 
 
I am happy  conducting a personal boycott of Home Depot and any other  
companies that feel they have to trumpet their anti-drug policies as a way of  
gaining business. They have to know that their support of these policies costs  
them business as well. 
 
(Sadly, Home Depot has bought Yardbirds, one of their competitors.  
Alternative: patronize the local lumber company and hardware store.) 

-------------------------------1150319626--

misdemeanor counts of "possession" of marijuana for two EMPTY bowls...

You can LITERALLY be jailed for having A seed...that's right - ONE.

So, I'm not surprised at all that there aren't more growers in the DC/Metro 
area...lol.

>> >> (CNN) -- Large quantities of drugs were found inside merchandise from

>> >> least two Home Depot stores in Massachusetts, and authorities are
>> >> investigating, police said Wednesday.
>> >>
>> >> A contractor late last week discovered two 50-pound "bricks" of
>> marijuana
>> >> wrapped in plastic bags inside a bathroom vanity he had purchased at a
>> >> Home Depot store in Tewksbury, said Chief of Detectives Lt. Dennis
>> >> Peterson.
>> >>
>> >> The estimated street value of the marijuana is around $145,000,
>> Peterson
>> >> said.
>> >>
>> >> Similar incidents have occurred in other parts of the state.
>> >>
>> >> A plumber purchased a vanity in western Massachusetts on Monday in
>> which
>> >> he later found 3 kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of
>> marijuana,
>> >> with a total estimated street value of $250,000, according to the
>> >> Southwick Police Department.
>> >>
>> >> Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item was purchased at 
>> >> "a
>> >> local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home
>> Depot.
>> >>
>> >> According to Peterson, a third individual discovered large quantities
>> of
>> >> illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise.
>> >>
>> >> Peterson would not provide the details of that incident but said it 
>> >> was
>> >> part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were
>> working
>> >> with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement
>> >> Administration (DEA).
>> >>
>> >> Tewksbury police and DEA officials conducted a search Tuesday of about
>> 12
>> >> Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that
>> >> contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many 
>> >> drug
>> >> caches were discovered in the search.
>> >>
>> >> In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the
>> >> merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were 
>> >> distributed
>> >> through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.
>> >>
>> >> "I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution center
>> and
>> >> someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that 
>> >> person
>> >> [who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty 
>> >> that
>> >> day or the packages were marked wrong."
>> >>
>> >> The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The Home 
>> >> Depot
>> >> was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one employed 
>> >> by
>> >> the company is a suspect at this time.
>> >>
>> >> Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the
>> >> vanities that contained drugs are suspects.
>> >>
>> >> In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is
>> cooperating
>> >> with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will support
>> law

>> >> justice."

--0-884559467-1150319852=:7011
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Also ironic how many growers shop there. heheheh

JonnyR@aol.com wrote:  I think it's (delightfully) ironic because Home Depot makes such a big deal 
about having a strict drug policy. 

There are signs you can see before you even go in saying that everybody is 
drug tested, to the effect of "you can shop here comfortable in the knowledge 
that no drug users will be interacting with you." 

OK, I don't want anybody to be really high while driving a forklift in my 
direction. Definitely don't want people in that job getting high AT work. 
Before? Maybe, depends how many hours. At home at night, and on weekends? Totally 
their own business. 

If they have a forklift accident and then the company wants to test them, I 
guess that's ok. But even still, I'd want proof that drugs contributed toward 
the accident, not that they smoked a blunt three weeks ago. 

I've had some management training, and the company (a very large one) said 
they don't do drug testing largely because they feel alcohol abuse is at least 
as much of a problem (I'll drink to that, lol), and nobody has the nerve to 
start testing every employee for alcohol use. 

They therefore go by job PERFORMANCE -- if you're doing your job well (and 
safely), what's the problem? Go after the people who are fucking up, FOR 
fucking up, not for arbitrary reasons that will make conservative customers happy. 

I am happy conducting a personal boycott of Home Depot and any other 
companies that feel they have to trumpet their anti-drug policies as a way of 
gaining business. They have to know that their support of these policies costs 
them business as well. 

(Sadly, Home Depot has bought Yardbirds, one of their competitors. 
Alternative: patronize the local lumber company and hardware store.)

get caught with any amount of drugs in any of the red states the cops 
grow a giant boner for you and generally beat the shit out of you and / 
or arrest you. Both have happened to me in Southern states.

Honestly, I'll take a beating over going to jail any day. What really 
sucks is when you get the shit beaten out of you and then still have to 
go to jail. Shit's fucked up out there, kids.

>>>> >>
>>>> >> In each incident being investigated by Tewksbury Police, all of the
>>>> >> merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were >> 
>>>> distributed
>>>> >> through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.
>>>> >>
>>>> >> "I'm sure the packages were being shipped to the distribution 
>>>> center
>>>> and
>>>> >> someone was supposed to intercept them," Peterson said. "So that 
>>>> >> person
>>>> >> [who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on 
>>>> duty >> that
>>>> >> day or the packages were marked wrong."
>>>> >>
>>>> >> The Southwick and Tewksbury Police Departments both said The 
>>>> Home >> Depot
>>>> >> was cooperating fully with their investigations, and no one 
>>>> employed >> by
>>>> >> the company is a suspect at this time.
>>>> >>
>>>> >> Both departments also said none of the customers who purchased the
>>>> >> vanities that contained drugs are suspects.
>>>> >>
>>>> >> In a written statement, The Home Depot said, "The company is
>>>> cooperating
>>>> >> with authorities as they investigate this matter, and we will 
>>>> support
>>>> law
>>>> >> enforcement in any way possible to help bring those responsible to
>>>> >> justice."
>>>> >>

>>>>>>which
>>>>>> >> he later found 3 kilograms of cocaine and around 40 pounds of

>>>>>> >> with a total estimated street value of $250,000, according to the
>>>>>> >> Southwick Police Department.

>>>>>> >> Southwick Police Lt. David A. Ricardi said the item was purchased
>>>>>>at >> "a
>>>>>> >> local hardware store" but would not confirm it came from The Home
>>>>>>Depot.

>>>>>>quantities
>>>>>>of
>>>>>> >> illegal drugs inside Home Depot merchandise.
>>>>>> >>

>>>>>> >> it was
>>>>>> >> part of the overall investigation and that Tewksbury police were
>>>>>>working
>>>>>> >> with their Southwick counterparts and the federal Drug Enforcement
>>>>>> >> Administration (DEA).

>>>>>>about
>>>>>>12
>>>>>> >> Home Depot stores statewide and found other bathroom vanities that
>>>>>> >> contained drugs, Peterson said. He would not elaborate on how many 
>>>>>> >>  >>

>>>>>> >> caches were discovered in the search.

>>>>>> >> the
>>>>>> >> merchandise boxes originated from a Texas location and were >>
>>>>>>distributed
>>>>>> >> through one Massachusetts warehouse, Peterson said.

>>>>>>center

>>>>>> >>  >>
>>>>>>person
>>>>>> >> [who was supposed to intercept the packages] either wasn't on duty

>>>>>>that
>>>>>> >> day or the packages were marked wrong."

------=_Part_5732_2196191.1150325321624
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=WINDOWS-1252; format=flowed

Content-Disposition: inline

So some of you out there are probably thinking, "Yeah, yeah, Kontrol again.
Fun party usually, but I don't even know who the hell these guys are! Why
should I spend my Saturday night and my hard-earned scrill going out to hea=
r
some music I don't even know if I'm going to like?

Well, good question. But here's your answer. Down towards the bottom of thi=
s
posting is some free music to download. Including a LIVE PA by each of this
month's featured artists. Download that shit. Seriously. Burn it to a CD if
you've gotta, and play it on the nicest soundsystem you can get your hands
on. Turn it up. Turn it WAY up. Hell, smoke 'em if you got 'em.

You hear that shit? Yeeeeaaaaah. Now that's what I'm talkin' about. Now
listen to the other one. Mmmmmm hmmmm. Fuggin' tight. Now imagine these two
guys working together, laying down thick, bumpy beats, precision bass
grooves, and layering loops and effects over each other. Getting the idea?

Bottom line: Saturday is going to be sick. Dark and dirty, intense and
funky. I'm honestly super duper stoked for this show, this will likely be
one of our best nights of music yet. If you're bored of hearing the same ol=
d
thing week after week, do yourself a favor and come check out some
state-of-the-art LIVE techno from the city that stated it all. You'll thank
me later.

__________________________________________


Saturday, June 17

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every 3rd Saturday at Rx Gallery

ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY!


featuring from Detroit in a world premiere dual live PA:


RYAN CROSSON   ( m-nus . trapez . telegraph . archipel )

vs. LEE CURTISS    ( kalimari . iron box . rhumba muzik )


Detroit's latest wave hits as Ryan Crosson (aka Berg Nixon) and Lee Curtiss
join forces for the first time ever in a cooperative dual live PA.  Crosson=
,
hot off his amazing performance at the M-nus "min2MAX" DEMF afterparty (and
equally outstanding track on the new compilation of the same name), has bee=
n
blowing up worldwide in the last couple years. Curtiss, recently back from =
3
months stationed in Berlin and performing all over Europe, is one of the
minimal world's brightest rising young stars.  Individually, each of these
guys deliver a live PA of thumpy, dark, and crisp minimal techno that is
absolutely stunning.  Together=85we can only imagine.


plus resident DJs:

ALLAND BYALLO   ( liebe*detail . kvadrat produkt . mo's ferry )
SAMMY D   ( classic . dirtybird . utensil )
CRAIG KUNA   ( concept sf . esdjco )


Rx Gallery Art Exhibition: Frankenstein Theory and Robotics

________________________________________________

Rx Gallery
132 Eddy @ Mason, SF / 415.474.7973
9pm-2am / 21+ / $10
________________________________________________

Check our website for full bios, pics and lots FREE music!
http://www.kontrolsf.com

View the flyer here:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K13W.gif

View the poster here:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K13P.jpg

________________________________________________


BIOS:

RYAN CROSSON
Born and raised in Metro-Detroit, Ryan discovered electronic music in his
late teenage years. After strictly DJing for a few years, he took the next
logical step by beginning to produce his own music in Fall 2003.  Drawing
from artists like Plastikman, Matthew Dear, Stewart Walker, and a heavy dos=
e
of Magda DJ sets, Ryan focused his attention on percussive programming,
dubby basslines, and dark atmospheres.  By expressing a tireless work ethic
in the studio, Ryan was soon noticed for his efforts by local Detroit label=
,
Beretta Music.  Not long after this, Ryan signed music to Cologne based
label Trapez Limited, just one year after he began writing music.  The EP
release on Trapez LTD. titled, "Say So " was well received with many
positive reviews from a plethora of international artists. In the Summer of
2005, Ryan played his first international dates with impressive live
performances in Berlin, and Cologne.  He has recently taken on a production
alais, "Berg Nixon" under which he was honored with a track on the latest
M-nus compilation, "min2MAX", as well as scoring a pair of remixes for the
latest Troy Pierce 12", "25 Bitches". Current influences include Pierce,
Ricardo Villalobos, Matthew Dear, and Guido Schneider. Talented and driven,
this young Detroit native is making an impact internationally with his
music.   Look for upcoming releases and remixes in the coming months from
Ryan on Minus, Beretta Grey, Telegraph and Trapez Ltd.

LEE CURTISS
Lee has always found sanctuary in the corners of his mind, for in the
corners you will find your true nature and true creative being. His mission
is to free people from the confines of the music they are accustomed to
listening to and elevate electronic music to the next level. He found
himself fixated on music from an early age, constantly learning more about
music as he taught himself to play several instruments over time. When he
found the dance music scene, he immediately moved away from rock oriented
instruments and gravitated toward electronic music. He was completely
fascinated by the anonymity of artists, the raw power of the music and how
it made the crowd move with every churning rhythm until it seemed everyone
was ready to lose their minds all at once. After traveling to Detroit and
Chicago he realized that he had something to contribute to this music and
began collecting records and DJing in 2000. Two years later he had amassed
enough knowledge and equipment to commit to producing full force. He soon
relocated from Grand Rapids to Detroit where he broadened his musical scope
and continued sharpening his skills. His music has become a heavily German
influenced form of minimal with an unorthodox approach to textures and
rhythms, using lo fidelity to create elements of disarray surrounded by
crunching beats, tweaky synthlines, held together by bubble gum sticky bass
lines. With a recent 3 month tour of Europe behind him, a track on the new
Audion Fabric mix, and upcoming releases on Spectral Sound, Underl_ne, and
Milnor Modern, Lee Curtiss is an artist clearly on his way up and showing n=
o
signs of slowing down.

Ryan Crosson's Discography

Lee Curtiss' Discography

Subject: [sfraves] NRR BSP: it's that time of year again:  ROBOT TIME!

yep...  after untold hours of machine-shop time, my team and i have
cobbled together a couple of robots for this year's ROBOGAMES!

http://www.robogames.net/

it's this weekend in SF, at fort mason...  all day friday, saturday and
sunday.  there's all sorts of robotics stuff going on, from combat robots
weighing up to 340lbs each to fully autonomous bipedal kung-fu robots!

here's a listing of the different classes and entries:
http://buildersdb.com/view_bots.asp?eventid=132

my team has two robots entered...  one in the beetleweight combat class
(3lbs), BOT-0.57721 and one in the featherweight class (30lbs), BOT-6:00.

it's a ton of fun, and a really cool place to see all sorts of technology
in action.  if you go, give me a holler on my cell phone and i can come
out and meet you:  408.718.3707

shane

Subject: [sfraves] Wed Night Adventure II

last... lol.. Hello 2day.. it was fun.. oh oh oh.. i also saw my Girl Roxy
who works for Glass cat i just found out like lastnight.. LoL

like 4gt or soemthing & I was sure that when i saw him.. i was just gonna
strait up hate on him.. so after yellin' out 2 the crowd outside "OK..
Who's Shatter?" & the bouncer Dude claiming it was him.. LoL.. then I
re-met Shatter & I dunno man.. LoL.. I just got soo much like well..
Groovy energy, I couldn't hate.. but i sstill called him an Asshole & he
said "Damn right I'm an Asshole"!  Hello 2day

OK... so there are a few bouncers there from other club that I used  2
kick it w/ them @... LoL.. so yeah.. it was kinda funny 'cause like 2 of
them i've known for over like 8-9 years now :)  LoL.. It was fun hangin['
out w/ him again :)  I mean.. this dude was my Big Bro over @ 1015 like
for a loong time & liek alwyas took care of me (next to Rudy :)  The other
bouncer dude I've known for a # of years also & it was just weird seein'
him again & Dope @ the same time :)

So the music @ was Groovy... all new wave, no wave, & IDM stuff.. it was
fun!!! :)  There was even a booty club house track that dropped that i
caught & started laughing when i heard it 'cause it was BAGG... i never
heard booty club house the ummm.. 3-4 times i been there..

Yeah.. i kinda got sucked in2 hangin' out w/ a Poly Family there & got
bit.. whatever than means, i dunno.. but it was fun & they were really
CooL people!

Then after that, i went 2 Omar's pad in downtown & lkike chillled there
when bart opened.. then when i got 2 El Cerrito Del Norte, there were 8
cop cars like outside!  wooop woop :)

I'm still kinda high from  kickin' it w/ Warner Drive.. I Love those
guys!! :)  So yeah.. that was my Wed night vagabond raver gypsy adventure!
:)

Pictures almost done.. will post soon :)
-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

From sfraves-return-132431-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Fri Jun 16 12:35:39 2006
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-132431-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 65341 invoked by uid 1103); 16 Jun 2006 12:35:38 -0000
Mailing-List: contact sfraves-help@hyperreal.org; run by ezmlm
Precedence: bulk
X-No-Archive: yes
list-help: <mailto:sfraves-help@hyperreal.org>
list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 65325 invoked from network); 16 Jun 2006 12:35:37 -0000
Message-ID: <1668.67.169.157.228.1150453286.squirrel@secure.saturn5.com>
Date: Fri, 16 Jun 2006 03:21:26 -0700 (PDT)
From: "Osby Oi Oi Jamz" <osby@viberation.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Reply-To: osby@viberation.com
User-Agent: SquirrelMail/1.4.6
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Importance: Normal
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] NRR: My Wed Night Adventure.. Hello 2day


So like Tuesday i was like well.. i got this invite on myspace from this
dude & he was all sayin' that his band ummmm..... http://warnerdrive.com
was playing @ 330 Ritch... I mean... I admit, i have a habit of adding
tall people to my list on myspace 'cause tall people are Groovy!!!  So i
added this dude, Johny when i saw him on the new people thingie on
myspace.. LoL... http://www.myspace.com/jonnyfl

Anywaze.. so yeah.. he told me that his band was performing & I dunno... i
mean.. his band does have a mypace profile also & I weas thinkin', "Oh
Great, another myspafce band"... but then i thought about it again &
thought like if he was willing to like personally invite people to his
show on myspace as compared to all the other bands who just send out those
myspace invites & say come to my show it's gonna be really Groovy la la
la... i kinda got curious & emailed him back.. we ended up having this
like hour long myspcae note chat 'then he gave me his ### 'cause they were
driving up from LA & I called him.. so yeah.. i kinda scored a GL on the
Warner Drive list.. LOLOLMAO... hello 2day... I mean.. i've also been on
this Indy Rock high since doin' that stage thingie for Masonic/
Groundscore stage @ HSF on Sunday... so yeah.. this was perfect for
getting that fill :)

OK.. but when i got there.. . i found out that it was an Indy Rock kinda
showcase dealie... 1st up this ummm.. well.. OK... Jewel-esque sing
Carolina perofmred this guitar accoustic set... then this like Pop rock
band played next.. ummmm... Philede no no no wait... ummm... Springfield,
then this Metal Rock band played, totally for their name, then this Brit
Rock band played, forgot their name.. then Warner Drive played..
finally!!!!

Like up until that point... we spent those like few hours like talkin' &
stuff, like I got 2 klnow them pretty good, & I was like uuugggh, they
perform last & I decided that well... I might as well miss BART gon' home
'cause I just wanna make sure that Warner Drive ain't some Emo Punk
Wannabe Poser Rock Band!  I mean.. lol... yeah.. it was fun like chillin';
w/ the "headliners" 'cause Pete, the bass player/... hella funny Dude!!!
:)

OK... so ummmm.. lemme see... Like Waren Drive.. they're just fucki'n
strait up good old Yummy Rock Music... probably a lil' Thrashy Punky Metal
sound on the edges.. but yeah... I wouldn't know what type of sub genre
io'd class them as other than just Hard Rock Music!!!

ummm.. so like the band member... since Sunday, I've like faslen in LOVE
w/ Bass Players 'cause I mean.. they all fuckin' ROCK!!!  So yeah. ..Peet,
the bass player, he's your like crazy, bad mouth, loud ass, way lous he
dowsn't need his mic to sing, probably drunk on stage, animated, band
member... the lead singer Johny who is just so fuckin' Dope is a cross
between Freddy Murcury, Steven Tyler, & Richard Simons on Stage w/ the way
he like seductively moves around on stage... the ummm.. I guess lead
guitar player, but he's the only one playing guitar, so i dunno.. but
yeah... guitar player Chris.. he's the like comic relief through actions
of the band well.. that's what it seem like to me anyway.. i mean.. I also
thought he look like a gansta Ewok w/ how far his bandana went down to he
head & he has like these mondo bug eyes :)  But it's like Mondo Cute! :)
Lastly, the drummer Matt, he's like the agro, bite your head off if you
talk to him, pissed off to the world kinda person I thought 'cause he was
like in a raunchy mood waiting too long to play... but when he got
behindhis drums & they played.. oh yeah.. he was a mad man on his drums!!!
LoL.. then he was like in a better like after, approachable mood after
that & apoligized for being an Asshole to me earlier :P

Collectively, Warner Drive gives a good fuckin' Stage show.. in between a
few songs they did these funnny ass skits about like why the next song was
written or what dunken inpriation made those lyrics!  Ummm.. they didn't
have like a whole lota time on stage for this showcase, I do have 2
FAvorite songs & like they performed like somewhere betweem 7-8 songs...
lol.. like ok.. remember those like 80's videos rock band video cliches
where like the guitar players are side by side & do that rowing motion w/
their bodies?  Well I finally saw that Live!  LOL... Hello 2day.. I mean..
it was Cheesy as Fuck like seeing that being done like LIVE, but I Loved
it!!!  LoL.. it actually  look pretty Groovy!!! :) Hello 2Day!  Ummmm...
yeah...

Totally mondo audience interaction.. there was a few times when Peet or
Johny would come in the audience & like sing/ play bass to people in the
crowd :)

So after their show ended & the Rock Showcase was over itself.. I kinda
helped Johny & them pack up their shit in their Uhaul pullie thingie & we
kicked it for like an hour longer :)  It was fun! LoL... I gotta say.. I
Love Warner Drive now!!  I do!!! :)  Hello 2Day... it was worth missing
the last BART trasin to get home & camp out in the City for some 5 hours!
But I really Do Love these guys mondo lots & Wow.. I'm like this huge
mondo fan right now! LOLOLMAO :)

So we said out bye, gave them hugs, like Johny was scared that something
wqs gonna happen to me & wanted to be sure they like drove me somewhere
"safer", but it was all good 'cause i seriously on ly had like 2 hours 2
kill b4 BART opened... so I walked & walk & somehow ended up @ Bondage a
Go-Go.. Hello 2day.. 'cause when ok, wait.. I makin' this way 2 mondo
long.. i gotta make another post :)



Pictures posted soon :) oh yeah...   http://www.myspace.com/warnerdrive
-- 
Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

I'm a Buddhist so I can't agree to this bit, "A Temple member in good standing is anyone who has faith in the one true God of the Bible"  And I don't really dig the whole deal with using a religious organization for non-religious goals (see also Rhythym Society)  Personally I'm not really sure I believe this is a real religion at all.  I expect judges might see it that way as well.  We'll see if it stands up in court.  I also note that this won't help the thousands already in jail for minor marijuana offenses.  

Regards,

Peter

Subject: Re: [sfraves] 420 church

I'm not trying to say what is and isn't a religion, but I don't like the id=
ea of pretending to be religious to achieve some other goal whether that's =
legal, political, of financial.  Personally I don't think any of the member=
s of this church were praying to a weed smoking version of Jesus before the=
 supreme court decision.  Maybe I'm wrong and I could be convinced otherwis=
e.  =20

In the absence of such evidence it just seems to me that this is a phoney r=
eligion constructed to issue "get out of jail free" cards.  I don't really =
have a problem with people doing what they have to in order to avoid jail f=
or marijuana offenses, but personally I'd rather see full legalization and =
amnesty for those already incarcerated.  I'm not sure that this sort of thi=
ng doesn't make that more unlikely actually.

Anyway, the Rastafarians come to mind as a previously existant religious gr=
oup that actually does use marijuana as a sacrament.  They should be protec=
ted under the supreme court decision for sure.

"Ganja (Marijuana) is considered the 'wisdom weed' by Rastafarians,        =
          as its use helps one to gain wisdom. Rastafarians use it as a    =
              part of a religious rite and as a means of getting closer to =
their                  inner spiritual self, Jah (God) and Creation.       =
        Ganja                  is also seen by Rastafarians as the herb of =
life mentioned in                  the Bible. Rastafarians use of ganja is =
justified by the following                  Psalms 104:14 that says, 'He ca=
useth the grass to grow for                  the cattle and herb for the se=
rvice of man, that he may bring                  forth food out of the eart=
h.'  Rastafarians also say it was                  found growing at the gra=
ve of King Solomon in the Bible.


               Rastafarian consume it through smoking and eating (not recom=
ended).                  The smoking of Ganja is a part of a religious ritu=
al. When there                  is a large "reasoning" gathering of Rastafa=
rians, a                  Chalice, which is a large smoking pipe, may be pa=
ssed around and                  smoked. This is similar to the passing aro=
und of a communion cup                  by some Christian denominations. Th=
ese gatherings are also called                  Nyahbinghi (also the name o=
f a Rastafarian sect: Theocratic                  Priesthood and Livity Ord=
er of Nyahbinghi)."
http://www.swagga.com/ganga.htm

Peace (and Ganja),

Peter

who works for Glass cat i just found out like lastnight.. LoL

like 4gt or soemthing & I was sure that when i saw him.. i was just gonna

CooL people!

----- Original Message ----- 
From: <dangrsmind@yahoo.com>
To: "CHUCK G" <chuckg_421@yahoo.com>; "Philip.X.Diaz" 
<st_indigo@earthlink.net>; "SFR" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Friday, June 16, 2006 1:58 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] 420 church


I'm not trying to say what is and isn't a religion, but I don't like the 
idea of pretending to be religious to achieve some other goal whether that's 
legal, political, of financial.  Personally I don't think any of the members 
of this church were praying to a weed smoking version of Jesus before the 
supreme court decision.  Maybe I'm wrong and I could be convinced otherwise.

In the absence of such evidence it just seems to me that this is a phoney 
religion constructed to issue "get out of jail free" cards.  I don't really 
have a problem with people doing what they have to in order to avoid jail 
for marijuana offenses, but personally I'd rather see full legalization and 
amnesty for those already incarcerated.  I'm not sure that this sort of 
thing doesn't make that more unlikely actually.

Anyway, the Rastafarians come to mind as a previously existant religious 
group that actually does use marijuana as a sacrament.  They should be 
protected under the supreme court decision for sure.

"Ganja (Marijuana) is considered the 'wisdom weed' by Rastafarians, 
as its use helps one to gain wisdom. Rastafarians use it as a 
part of a religious rite and as a means of getting closer to their 
inner spiritual self, Jah (God) and Creation.               Ganja 
is also seen by Rastafarians as the herb of life mentioned in 
the Bible. Rastafarians use of ganja is justified by the following 
Psalms 104:14 that says, 'He causeth the grass to grow for 
the cattle and herb for the service of man, that he may bring 
forth food out of the earth.'  Rastafarians also say it was 
found growing at the grave of King Solomon in the Bible.


               Rastafarian consume it through smoking and eating (not 
recomended).                  The smoking of Ganja is a part of a religious 
ritual. When there                  is a large "reasoning" gathering of 
Rastafarians, a                  Chalice, which is a large smoking pipe, may 
be passed around and                  smoked. This is similar to the passing 
around of a communion cup                  by some Christian denominations. 
These gatherings are also called                  Nyahbinghi (also the name 
of a Rastafarian sect: Theocratic                  Priesthood and Livity 
Order of Nyahbinghi)."
http://www.swagga.com/ganga.htm

Peace (and Ganja),

Peter

"real" religion is or isn't.

-philip-

> "Ganja (Marijuana) is considered the 'wisdom weed' by Rastafarians, =20=

> as its use helps one to gain wisdom. Rastafarians use it as a part =20
> of a religious rite and as a means of getting closer to their inner =20=

> spiritual self, Jah (God) and Creation.               Ganja is also =20=

> seen by Rastafarians as the herb of life mentioned in the Bible. =20

> 104:14 that says, 'He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle and =20
> herb for the service of man, that he may bring forth food out of =20
> the earth.'  Rastafarians also say it was found growing at the =20
> grave of King Solomon in the Bible.
>

>               Rastafarian consume it through smoking and eating =20
> (not recomended).                  The smoking of Ganja is a part =20
> of a religious ritual. When there                  is a large =20
> "reasoning" gathering of Rastafarians, a                  Chalice, =20
> which is a large smoking pipe, may be passed around =20
> and                  smoked. This is similar to the passing around =20
> of a communion cup                  by some Christian =20
> denominations. These gatherings are also called                  =20
> Nyahbinghi (also the name of a Rastafarian sect: =20
> Theocratic                  Priesthood and Livity Order of =20
> Nyahbinghi)."

>  And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed,  which 
> is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the  which is the 
> fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for  meat. And to every 
> beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the  air, and to every thing that 
> creepeth upon the earth, wherein there  is life, I have given every green 
> herb for meat: and it was so. --  Genesis 1: 29-30
>
>  And I will raise up for them a plant of renown, and they shall be  no 
> more consumed with hunger in the land, neither bear the shame of  the 
> heathen any more. Thus shall they know that I the LORD their  God am with 
> them, and that they, even the house of Israel, are my  people, saith the 
> Lord GOD."   --  Ezekiel 34:29-30
>
>  "And he shewed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, 
> proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb. In the midst  of the 
> street of it, and on either side of the river, was there the  tree of 
> life, which bare twelve manner of fruits, and yielded her  fruit every 
> month: and the leaves of the tree were for the healing  of the nations. 
> And there shall be no more curse: but the throne of  God and of the Lamb 
> shall be in it; and his servants shall serve  him: And they shall see his 
> face; and his name shall be in their  foreheads." -- Revelations 22:1-4

> Subject: Re: [sfraves] 420 church

>
> I'm not trying to say what is and isn't a religion, but I don't  like the 
> idea of pretending to be religious to achieve some other  goal whether 
> that's legal, political, of financial.  Personally I  don't think any of 
> the members of this church were praying to a  weed smoking version of 
> Jesus before the supreme court decision.   Maybe I'm wrong and I could be 
> convinced otherwise.
>
> In the absence of such evidence it just seems to me that this is a  phoney 
> religion constructed to issue "get out of jail free" cards.   I don't 
> really have a problem with people doing what they have to  in order to 
> avoid jail for marijuana offenses, but personally I'd  rather see full 
> legalization and amnesty for those already  incarcerated.  I'm not sure 
> that this sort of thing doesn't make  that more unlikely actually.
>
> Anyway, the Rastafarians come to mind as a previously existant  religious 
> group that actually does use marijuana as a sacrament.   They should be 
> protected under the supreme court decision for sure.
>
> "Ganja (Marijuana) is considered the 'wisdom weed' by Rastafarians,  as 
> its use helps one to gain wisdom. Rastafarians use it as a part  of a 
> religious rite and as a means of getting closer to their inner  spiritual 
> self, Jah (God) and Creation.               Ganja is also  seen by 
> Rastafarians as the herb of life mentioned in the Bible.  Rastafarians use 
> of ganja is justified by the following Psalms  104:14 that says, 'He 
> causeth the grass to grow for the cattle and  herb for the service of man, 
> that he may bring forth food out of  the earth.'  Rastafarians also say it 
> was found growing at the  grave of King Solomon in the Bible.
>
>
>               Rastafarian consume it through smoking and eating  (not 
> recomended).                  The smoking of Ganja is a part  of a 
> religious ritual. When there                  is a large  "reasoning" 
> gathering of Rastafarians, a                  Chalice,  which is a large 
> smoking pipe, may be passed around  and                  smoked. This is 
> similar to the passing around  of a communion cup                  by some 
> Christian  denominations. These gatherings are also called 
> Nyahbinghi (also the name of a Rastafarian sect:  Theocratic 
> Priesthood and Livity Order of  Nyahbinghi)."
> http://www.swagga.com/ganga.htm
>
> Peace (and Ganja),
>
> Peter
>

Just a reminder folks, our last couple shows have
been sold out, and this, our first birthday party, is
likely to as well.  The capacity is only a couple
hundred, so please arrive early to assure entry.

It's gonna be another rager!

__________________________________________


Saturday, June 17

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every 3rd Saturday at Rx Gallery

ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY!


featuring from Detroit in a world premiere dual live PA:


RYAN CROSSON   ( m-nus . trapez . telegraph . archipel )

vs. LEE CURTISS    ( kalimari . iron box . rhumba muzik )


Detroit's latest wave hits as Ryan Crosson (aka Berg Nixon) and Lee Curtiss
join forces for the first time ever in a cooperative dual live PA.  Crosson=
,
hot off his amazing performance at the M-nus "min2MAX" DEMF afterparty (and
equally outstanding track on the new compilation of the same name), has bee=
n
blowing up worldwide in the last couple years. Curtiss, recently back from =
3
months stationed in Berlin and performing all over Europe, is one of the
minimal world's brightest rising young stars.  Individually, each of these
guys deliver a live PA of thumpy, dark, and crisp minimal techno that is
absolutely stunning.  Together=85we can only imagine.


plus resident DJs:

ALLAND BYALLO   ( liebe*detail . kvadrat produkt . mo's ferry )
SAMMY D   ( classic . dirtybird . utensil )
CRAIG KUNA   ( concept sf . esdjco )


Rx Gallery Art Exhibition: Frankenstein Theory and Robotics

________________________________________________

Rx Gallery
132 Eddy @ Mason, SF / 415.474.7973
9pm-2am / 21+ / $10
________________________________________________

Check our website for full bios, pics and lots FREE music!
http://www.kontrolsf.com

View the flyer here:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K13W.gif

View the poster here:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K13P.jpg

________________________________________________


BIOS:

RYAN CROSSON
Born and raised in Metro-Detroit, Ryan discovered electronic music in his
late teenage years. After strictly DJing for a few years, he took the next
logical step by beginning to produce his own music in Fall 2003.  Drawing
from artists like Plastikman, Matthew Dear, Stewart Walker, and a heavy dos=
e
of Magda DJ sets, Ryan focused his attention on percussive programming,
dubby basslines, and dark atmospheres.  By expressing a tireless work ethic
in the studio, Ryan was soon noticed for his efforts by local Detroit label=
,
Beretta Music.  Not long after this, Ryan signed music to Cologne based
label Trapez Limited, just one year after he began writing music.  The EP
release on Trapez LTD. titled, "Say So " was well received with many
positive reviews from a plethora of international artists. In the Summer of
2005, Ryan played his first international dates with impressive live
performances in Berlin, and Cologne.  He has recently taken on a production
alais, "Berg Nixon" under which he was honored with a track on the latest
M-nus compilation, "min2MAX", as well as scoring a pair of remixes for the
latest Troy Pierce 12", "25 Bitches". Current influences include Pierce,
Ricardo Villalobos, Matthew Dear, and Guido Schneider. Talented and driven,
this young Detroit native is making an impact internationally with his
music.   Look for upcoming releases and remixes in the coming months from
Ryan on Minus, Beretta Grey, Telegraph and Trapez Ltd.

LEE CURTISS
Lee has always found sanctuary in the corners of his mind, for in the
corners you will find your true nature and true creative being. His mission
is to free people from the confines of the music they are accustomed to
listening to and elevate electronic music to the next level. He found
himself fixated on music from an early age, constantly learning more about
music as he taught himself to play several instruments over time. When he
found the dance music scene, he immediately moved away from rock oriented
instruments and gravitated toward electronic music. He was completely
fascinated by the anonymity of artists, the raw power of the music and how
it made the crowd move with every churning rhythm until it seemed everyone
was ready to lose their minds all at once. After traveling to Detroit and
Chicago he realized that he had something to contribute to this music and
began collecting records and DJing in 2000. Two years later he had amassed
enough knowledge and equipment to commit to producing full force. He soon
relocated from Grand Rapids to Detroit where he broadened his musical scope
and continued sharpening his skills. His music has become a heavily German
influenced form of minimal with an unorthodox approach to textures and
rhythms, using lo fidelity to create elements of disarray surrounded by
crunching beats, tweaky synthlines, held together by bubble gum sticky bass
lines. With a recent 3 month tour of Europe behind him, a track on the new
Audion Fabric mix, and upcoming releases on Spectral Sound, Underl_ne, and
Milnor Modern, Lee Curtiss is an artist clearly on his way up and showing n=
o
signs of slowing down.

Subject: [sfraves] Man Charged With Having Crack in Sundae

Man Charged With Having Crack in Sundae
Friday, June 16, 2006

(06-16) 14:12 PDT Richmond, Texas (AP) --

This banana split was topped with something more potent than just a cherry.

A motorist was arrested and charged with possession of a controlled
substance after he was caught with two rocks of crack cocaine he had
stashed in his ice cream dessert.

Oscar Martinez, 41, of Richmond, had been pulled over by police
officer David Bentley late Sunday after he failed to stop at a
pedestrian crossing on the campus of Wharton County Junior College.

Bentley discovered that Martinez had a suspended driver's license and
an outstanding traffic warrant.

Richmond police spokesman Sgt. Lowell Neinast said Martinez told
Bentley that he wished he could finish the banana split he had in his
car.

When Bentley saw the melting banana split on the front floorboard of
Martinez's car, he noticed that it was topped with a square-shaped
object that turned out to be crack cocaine.

"One of the crack rocks was sitting right on top of the bananas,"
Neinast told the Fort Bend Herald-Coaster. "Once he found the first
crack rock, he figured there were more inside. He emptied it out and
there it was."

Martinez was arrested and charged with driving with a suspended
license, a traffic warrant and possession of a controlled substance in
a drug-free zone, a third-degree felony. He was released from the Fort
Bend County Jail after posting an $8,500 bond, Neinast said Friday.

"I've been doing this for 20 years and I could give you all kinds of
stories, but this is really one of a kind," Neinast said. "But true."

Subject: [sfraves] Fight, Flight, or Chill: Subcultures, Youth, and Rave into the
  Twenty-First Century

--=====================_10734062==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"

Recent book from McGill-Queens University Press:


Fight, Flight, or Chill: Subcultures, Youth, and Rave into the Twenty-First Century
Brian Wilson
http://www.mqup.mcgill.ca/book.php?bookid=1957

Rave is one of the first distinct and significant youth subcultures to emerge since the early days of punk rockers and skinheads. A middle-class culture renowned for drug use, computer-generated "techno" music, and all-night dance parties, rave has been described as everything from a drug cult to a neo-hippie community. Brian Wilson uses his ethnographic research on rave during the mid and late 1990s in Southern Ontario to discuss the ways in which young people participate in social and cultural life at the turn of the millennium.
Fight, Flight or Chill explores the extent to which raver youths' experiences are constrained or determined by individualistic, high-tech, mass-mediated Western culture in which alienated and unfulfilled youth are apparently more at-risk for escapist and thrill-seeking behaviours. Wilson considers how raver youth creatively and proactively subvert these constraints in novel and empowering ways - from political activism to symbolic and stylistic expressions of resistance to community-building efforts. He also discusses the globalization and political economy of rave and youth culture and examines the ideologies that underlie simple solutions to the complex concerns over young people today.

Table of Contents

Acknowledgments | vii
Introduction
1 Youth Culture, Complexity, and Rave | 3

PART ONE
Rave Culture, History, and Social Experience
2 From New York to Ibiza to Britain to Toronto: Rave Histories, Contexts, and Panics | 36
3 Doctrines, Disappointments, and Dance: Perspectives and Activities in the Rave Scene | 72
4 Making Impressions, Making Investments: Identities, Relationships, Commitments, and Rave | 106

PART TWO
Reading Rave, Interpreting Youth Culture
5 Fight, Flight, or Chill: Reconsidering Youth Subcultural Resistance | 128
6 Marketing "The Vibe": Community, Nostalgia, Political Economy, and Rave | 156

Conclusion
7 Raise a Fist? Reflections on Theory and Practice | 174
Appendix 1: Comments about Method and Theory | 182
References | 193
Index | 211


MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 

Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

"A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves."
-Edward R. Murrow

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

SPECIAL NOTICE:

THE SFRaves Calendar is being fixed, tested and checked for various
stresspoints under test.

If you are interested in working on helping to fix the SFRaves Calendar or
know of someone who is interested in becoming involved with the next
generation of the SFRaves Calendar Project - please email
karina@hyperreal.org

If you would like an event posted to the Calendar, please submit to:
karina@hyperreal.org and it will be listed on the Weekly Calendar Mailing.

The SFRaves Calendar is located @
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

Technologies: Zope: http://www.zope.org

Experience with / understanding / development experience with *a Plus* :

* authoring and building applications using the Zope application framework
(http://www.zope.org)
* ZPT * Python (http://www.python.org
* PHP
* MYSQL
* Plone

Please note if you are seeing issues with the current calendar (bugs,
errors, etc) please note that I am aware of them and am currently in the
process of addressing / fixing these issues.

Please send responses to karina@hyperreal.org

Alternative solutions are also being considered for the next generation of
this codebase. Other languages are being considered to enhance the SFR
Calendar Application. This includes languages specific to the development of
applications in a web environment.

do it, right? If not, come on out and see for yourself. the Panda 
Rejects dj's: Aaron Jae Alxndr Donna Matrix Ernie Trevino Kapt'n Kirk

Friday, June 16, 2006 - Sunday, June 18, 2006 * Stilldream *

  Date & Time:  Friday, June 16, 2006 - Sunday, June 18, 2006 5:00 PM 
Alright everybody the moment we have all been waiting for: The most 
anticipated event of the summer is back! <<<STILLDREAM>>> 6 Year 
Anniversary Campout June 16, 17 & 18th, 2006 <<< Synchro >>> - 
Netherlands (Tip World, Avatar, Novatekk, Atomik, Transient) Synchro or 
Jeroen, as he is formerly known, is one such man who over the years has 
continually produced a rare blend of trance, leaving a lasting 
impression on both his listeners and viewers.In 1997 he was signed to 
the trance label TIP Records, where he released a swag of stomping 
tracks, such as Kitchen Sync, Power On, See Ya Later Oscillator and 
Human Oscillator. Since Synchro released his first album Science 
Friction on TIP, his booking have subsequently picked up 400%.Synchro 
has seriously explained how making music means so much to him. And the 
rush that it gives him to play live and DJ. He quotes Tony De Vit 
saying: Its a real high when you play a track and the whole house 
goes bananas and you can multiple that by a hundred if its a track you 
made yourself. <<< Terry Mullan >>>- Chicago, IL (Catlyst Records, 
Kontrast, EAM) Music has always been the driving force in Terry's life, 
from Jazz band to DJ'ing it was only a matter of time before Terry made 
his career in music. Dj'ing has taken Terry all over the world, where 
he's been exposed to many different styles of dance music. Feeling 
miffed by the overwhelming popularity and sheer amount of vacuous music 
in the dance scene, eventually led Terry to take a stand for his sound. 
Starting a label that specialized in the sounds of Chicago and funky 
music was the only plan. As a DJ Terry knew that there was no way the 
sound would be denied when presented properly. With his faith in the 
music, Terry planned to turn people on to these sounds. Facilitating 
this vision was easier with friends like Richie Hawtin and John 
Acquaviva who ran Plus 8 Records. <<< Patrick DSP >>> - Toronto, Canada 
(www.patrickdsp.com, Hardsignal, Hydraulix, Cluster) Patrick 
Gharapetians dreams of becoming a superhero were thwarted the day he 
was caught shoplifting by his parents. Not to let this deter him from 
his dreams, he decided to pursue another avenue to help save the world 
- not from the usual suspects and evil villains, but from mainstream, 
over-played generic cookie-cutter music. He foresaw boy-bands and 
teeny-bobber girls taking over the world and he knew he could not stand 
idly by and let that happen. Since then he has dedicated his life (at 
least the musical part of it) to the other side of good - Evil. <<< 
Keith MacKenzie >>> - Florida (www.illeveneleven.com, Zone, Afterdark) 
Having earned a reputation for workin the bassbins proper w/ his 
upfront selection of breakbeat pressure, Keith MacK has solidified 
himself as a cornerstone in the US breaks movement. Being apart of DJ 
Icey's legendary Zone Records and an original member of Afterdark 
Records, as well as recently starting his own imprint..illeven:eleven, 
Keith continues to push forward w/ his cutting-edge sound, while at the 
same time providing a positive vibe towards the dance scene. His 
releases include collaborations w/ artists such as infiniti, dj fixx, 
and brian van dalen have made him not only a dancefloor favorite, but 
also popular w/ breaks dj's worldwide. <<< Dyloot >>>- San Francisco 
(Skills, Deep Voices) <<< Forest Green >>> - San Francisco 
(ForestGreen.org, Daly City Records, Sister SF) <<< Serch >>>- Chicago 
(www.theserch.com, Freshout Music) <<< Dragn'fly >>>- Sacramento 
(Shaolin Prod's, djdragnfly.com) <<< Michael Liu >>> - San Jose 
(Illumination Records, Secret Psycadelica) <<< Mr. Nefarius >>> - San 
Luis Obispo (Planet Zombee, Rogue Techno) <<< Dirt >>> - San Francisco 
(Techno Truth, Cymbalic, Omniscient) <<<Stilldream Residents:>>> Mek 
(Techno Truth) G.A.M.M.A. (Techno Truth, movementnow.com) Jyant 
(Stilldream) Cantos (djcantos.com) David Aaron (Mixlife.com, 
djdavidaron.com) Nick Nyquil (Ill Behavior, Oneiromancey) Wavelength 
(Oneiromancey) Hoth (Infinite Space) Covert (transcendevents.com) 
Funguy! (cybertribe) <<<Hometown Heroes:>>> Carlos Alfonso (Bayraves, 
House Nation, Zapatistas) Athena (Evil Breaks, 840 Ent) Andy P 
(Nocturnalism) Atom O.N.E. (National Entity, Nocturnal Beats) Kris Kent 
(Ill behavior) Thomas Kent (Ill Beahavior, Modified) Korpus Kallosum 
(korpuskallosum.com, Ritual Sounds) Mr. Rogers (Ooze System) Adam Ant

Friday, June 16, 2006 * Leftism CD Release Party * Recorded as a live 
promotional mix for Winter Music Conference 2006, Leftism captures two 
of the Left Coasts most diverse, in-demand DJs at the peak of their 
game. OM Records recording artist/producer J-Boogie and party rocker 
extraordinaire DJ Sake One of the (((Local 1200))) Sound System go 
back-to-back -- with mixes that transcend musical boundaries and, in 
the process, define the New Sound of the West Coast. Produced in 
collaboration with San Franciscos tastemaking FRESCO brand, Leftism 
contains exclusive cuts, edits and remixes made especially for this 
mix, as well as a unique cover design c/o Fresco. Building on the 
considerable buzz created at Winter Music Conference, Sake1, J-Boogie 
and Fresco are distributing the mix for a proper release worldwide, as 
well as launching a DJ tour to support the CD. The mix of Downtempo, 
Soul, Hip-Hop, Afro, Latin, and Broken Beats is sure to please.  boca: 
The Bar of Contemporary Art 414 Jessie Street San Francisco, CA 94103
