Wednesday, August 02, 2006 * BOOM FESTIVAL Magic *

Date & Time:  Wednesday, August 2, 2006 - Wednesday, August 9, 2006 4:00 AM
Heya, All! We would like to share with you information about a very special
global arts, music and culture-gathering that incarnates biannually in
Portugal. Boom Festival takes place in a stunning outdoor location on the
shore of the Lake Idanha-a-Nova, approximately 2 hours North-West from
Lisboa. Bringing together the latest in psychedelic sights & sounds,
phantastic art installations & workshops, this week-long event is a harmonic
convergence of people, energy, information, and philosophies, from planet
Earth & beyond. Synchronized multi-dimensionally with the full moon of
August, the next Boom-Festival is taking a bio-dynamic approach by
incorporating a variety of sustainable techniques, and Earth-based forms
throughout its infrastructure. Reflecting a harmonic balance of the organic
and the cyber-technologic, Boom 2006 maps the metaphysical framework in
accordance with Peace, Love, Unity and Respect. A very magical event indeed!
5000 BOOM Festival 2006 Early Bird Tickets are available now. They are only
70 Euro for 7 days. Getting there is no big deal. Reasonable flights to
Lisboa can be purchased on most of the European Budget Airlines, and
Transatlantic flights from America are also quite cheap. The Boom has
organized busses that take you directly from the international airport to
the sacred womb of the vacation party paradise. This year, Boom-festival has
extended its length to ONE WEEK! Great news about the timing of BOOM 2006 is
that it's not happening in conjunction with Burning Man, so the devoted
"Burners" have a chance to partake on European creative community
expression. BOOM is similar to Burning Man, but with a lake & great sounds!
Not to be missed ... For more info, please visit: www.boomfestival.org

Friday, August 11, 2006 * Sound Asylum by Mizumo Music and Dj Denise *

amazing vocals by Audio Angel (celebrityjunglist). Lasers & lights by 
STIM-U-LIGHTS. 18+ event located in the heart of San Francisco. Access 
to full bar for the 21+. 9pm-4am. $20 @ door. Infoline 415.267.7656

------------------------------------------------- 
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week. To subscribe to the
list, send a message to: sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

If you have events to add to the SFRaves calendar, please publish them by
Friday @ Noon to be included in the SFR Calendar Weekly Edition Mailing.

SFRaves is a not for profit entity serving the Bay Area & all forms of
electronic music for 14 years.

& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

Subject: Re: [sfraves] 420 church

"coming back from the dead to live in magical happy-land forever with his pops"

While some people take that story literally, its also possible to view it as a deep spiritual metaphor.  Perhaps the true meaning is something more along the lines of the following:

The universe, the sum total of all existence, is one; and our seperateness from it is an illusion we create for ourselves.  In the end, at death, the illusions fall away and we return from whence we came.  We rejoin the entirety of what is, from which really we were never apart, much like a son returning to his father.

In Buddhism people talk about the "child light" rejoining the "mother light"... 

As far as Scientology, I think its really about controlling people and making money and much less about spritual health and well being.  I could be wrong. 

However, their e-meter things look like a cheap voltmeter I got from Shack ten years ago. All the "demonstrators" lined up at the tables near Union Square waiting to plug people in, seem to be just a little bit confused or something...  Besides their alien story is just damn weird. 

Are you clear yet?  

Sheesh.

Regards,

Peter

(The location isn't underground, but the clothes sure as hell are)

www.cfdesign.net

S/heva: Venture into the Fashion Divine
Saturday, June 17, 2006

Doors open at 8pm, Show starts at 9pm
Afterparty until 2am
Designer Sample Sale
Music by Monty Luke and DingDong

Studio Z
314  11th Street at Folsom
San Francisco, CA
415-252-7666
www.StudioZ.tv <http://www.studioz.tv/>
21+ w/ID



Tired of the same old duds being peddled by the usual
fashion industry suspects?  Well it's time to wake up
and smell the underground!  The Cloud Factory Design
Collective is back on the attack with its 8th Annual
Fashion Performance: "S/heva: Venture into the Fashion
Divine," to be held in San Francisco on Saturday, June
17, 2006 at Studio Z.

Watch as S/heva destroys your preconceived notions
about fashion rules and limitations, blazing new paths
to the heights of wearable art!  Behold brave new
creations by this inventive, many-armed collective,
rooted firmly in the underground, yet always reaching
out in new directions to entertain and inspire!

S/heva will ignite your imagination with a wild
variety of designs, from kicky patchwork fur and
vibrant dancefloor creations, to flowing goddess
threads.  Find the perfect outfit for your most
outrageous exploits, whether you're running from the
paparazzi, taking a twirl at your local gin joint, or
spending a day at the races.

After the show, pick up some up-to-the-minute,
one-of-a-kind goodies in the Designer Sample Sale,
then grab your dancing shoes and hold onto your booty
as DJs Monty Luke and DingDong lead S/heva dancing
into the fire! Remember, this cycle of hyper-creation
only comes around once a year, so don't miss out!


PHOTOGRAPHY BY PERMISSION ONLY

$10 Advance Tickets available at www.ticketweb.com,
Or in person at the following locations:

::San Francisco::
Doe
629 A  Haight St (at Steiner)
San Francisco, CA
415-558-8588

Porcelynne Boutique & Gallery
487 14th Street (at Guerrero)
San Francisco, CA
415-310-8919
Open Thur-Sun

::East Bay::
Blow Salon
2112 Berkeley Way (at Shattuck)
Berkeley, CA
510-381-3923

Subject: Re: [sfraves] iSlave karma



Well, by using the Internet at all, you are relying on electronic
hardware built in China under the exact conditions. 

So, if this bothers you, please disconnect your internet now.

Look, the available pool of labor in China is shrinking, and workers
enjoy more flexability, better pay, and more work options now then
they ever did before.  Chinese workers use the Internet to find out
which factories pay and treat their employees the best, forcing all
factories to improve their conditions and pay.

Thanks to American demand for devices such as iPods, China has an exploding
middle class that is pulling itself up from poverty.  

-troy

Subject: Re: [sfraves] iSlave karma

Its no secret that most consumer electronics are made by poorly paid workers in other countries. That's mainly China right now.  

The by products of production of consumer electronics include highly toxic materials which are often dumped into the environment and some products contain toxic materials that end up in landfills too.  Most batteries contain toxic materials for example.

And most of these devices have an expected lifetime of less than 3 years...

Might make you think differently about it next time you by an iPod or whatever. 

Peace,

Peter

Subject: [sfraves] Fighting California Vehicle Codes

------=_Part_104788_24583634.1150760421290
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Anyone out there have to deal with CHP and window tinting?

I got pulled over a couple of weeks back and they pig wrote me up for having
no front license plate (cvc 5200) and a restricted view (cvc 26708a).  My
car has not had a front license plate in at least 10 years, and neither
myself or the previous owner recieved a ticket for that.  I'm willing to
deal with that one, i'll contact DMV and have them send me out new plates.

My problem is with the restriced view.  I have nothing in any of my
windows.  the only thing it could be is the window tint.  The tinting is
factory.  the rear, rear side and front side windows are tinted.  When he
pulled me over my front driver side window was completely down, so he
couldnt have seen the tint there.  When he pulled me over, i rolled down the
passenger side window to talk to him.  Maybe he saw that window on his walk
up, but in any case, he didnt test my window tint to see if it was within
the boundries (i think it's 88% according to ca dmv).

Has anyone had to deal with this?  Can i tell them the dude never tested my
window tinting and therefore has no basis to write me up on that?  If i
don't get these corrected, i owe $352.  If i do get them corrected i still
owe $157.  I'd like to be able to get this done at little to no cost to
myself.  Like i said i'm willing to get new plates and go through whatever
it takes to do that, but the window tinting i think is a little too much.
Or at least have them come out and test the windows to make sure it's within
the boundries, like i said it is a factory tint job and if you're going to
sell a car in california you shouldnt be able to sell it with windows that
are too dark.

-- 
Chester Copperpot

"Fightin' cancer with one hand."
"Dead people are the new Potatos!"
"Meth Monsters are my Anti-Drug"

------=_Part_104788_24583634.1150760421290--

-&e->well then, what constitutes a "real religion" to you?

practitioners the same which has been the crux of the matter in American

is one of the most clearly worded freedoms we have and you'd have to twist 
the constitution pretty bad to prevent it.

Of course this administration has already done it's share of twisting

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Fighting California Vehicle Codes

wrong.

(d) Notwithstanding subdivision (a), clear, colorless, and 
transparent material may be installed, affixed, or applied to the 
front side windows, located to the immediate left and right of the 
front seat if the following conditions are met:

(1) The material has a minimum visible light transmittance of 88 percent.

(2) The window glazing with the material applied meets all 
requirements of Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 205 (49 
C.F.R. 571.205), including the specified minimum light transmittance 
of 70 percent and the abrasion resistance of AS-14 glazing, as 
specified in that federal standard.

(3) The material is designed and manufactured to enhance the ability 
of the existing window glass to block the sun's harmful ultraviolet A rays.

(4) The driver has in his or her possession, or within the vehicle, a 
certificate signed by the installing company certifying that the 
windows with the material installed meet the requirements of this 
subdivision and identifies the installing company and the material's 
manufacturer by full name and street address, or, if the material was 
installed by the vehicle owner, a certificate signed by the 
material's manufacturer certifying that the windows with the material 
installed according to manufacturer's instructions meets the 
requirements of this subdivision and identifies the material's 
manufacturer by full name and street address.

(5) If the material described in this subdivision tears or bubbles, 
or is otherwise worn to prohibit clear vision, it shall be removed or replaced.

sarilion

Hey Everybody

Breasts Not Bombs is Back!

Since I will be performing my one-woman show 
OH MY GODDESS! at THE MARSH, 1062 VALENCIA ST, SAN FRANCISCO
THURSDAY JUNE 22ND THROUGH SATURDAY JULY 14TH  AT 8 PM

THIS IS A GREAT OPPORTUNITY TO DO OUR BREASTS NOT BOMBS DEMONSTRATIONS IN THE 
BAY AREA

THIS IS TO ANNOUNCE OUR FIRST OF THREE ACTIONS

FRIDAY JUNE 23RD
NOON
THE MILITARY RECRUITMENT CENTER IN OAKLAND
21ST AND BROADWAY

We are heartbroken over the story of US Soldier Suzanne Swift who has not 
only suffered the emotional injuries of an unjust war, but further damaged by the 
indecencies of soldiers in her own unit. She has refused to return to Iraq 
and was arrested by the Military and taken to Fort Lewis in Washington.  This 
and the ongoing indecencies of the Military under George Bush and Donald 
Rumsfeld, from Haditha to Guantanamo Bay brings us into the streets again to make the 
most powerful,, positive non-violent statement we can think of.  We welcome 
women and men to bare their Breasts to define what is decent in this world 
(mothers, babies, kindness, nurturing, feeding, education, etc.) and what is not 
(torture, massacres, warprofiteering, raping female soldiers, etc) Bring signs 
to indicate what you feel is indecent.

The right to demonstrate bare breasted in protected under the First Amendment.

If you have further questions about the legality of this demonstration feel 
free to contact me at mothersmilk@mcn.org

My benefactor told me about it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no use."
-Don Juan

Subject: Re: [sfraves] 420 church

Back in the early 1980's when I was running with what was left of the
Yippies there was this ancilliary organization called 'The Church of
The Realized Fantasies' run by a guy that called himself 'Pope Mickey'
that was actually a front for NYC's first marijuana delivery service.

Our phone number was 777-CASH and our motto was 'We Deliver.'

We had an office above the McDonald's in Union Square and were the
first to use pagers, though those were the ones that when they beeped,
that's all they did, beep, which meant you had to call your office to
see who wanted to talk to you.

Also around this time there was a storefront church in the East
Village that was selling the same sacrament cited in the first Chief
Justice Robert's Supreme Court decision, DMT, for $35 a gram, though I
don't think it's the same group of people cuz their's was a smokeable
blend versus the tea that this group uses.

The East Village group had a freaky religion based around the drug
that kind of centered on Jesus being the serpent in the Garden of
Eden, don't ask, too complicated.

I posted this SC decision to a bunch of groups when it first came this
February out but nobody responded, or noticed I guess, so it's cool
that this guy is doing something with it, but honestly I don't think
he stands a snow cones chance in Aruba of putting this over, but I
wish him luck.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: legally, can a police officer tell you that
  he's not a cop?


 From what I know, unless he's in uniform, or on the job, no, he 
doesn't.  Unless he is acting a capacity as a peace officer, they are under 
no obligation to tell you who they are or what they do, any more than 
anyone else is required to divuldge that information.

I can say that if they do act as a police officer, while off duty, they get 
put through the ringer from superiors, lots of report writing, and 
depending on teh situation, will get a write up from their superiors, even 
if they are in the right.

In the case of if you are asking somebody if they are a cop, and are 
working as a cop (eg undercover) they do not have to divuldge that 
information.  It woudl sort of defeat the purpose of undercover operation 
if all you had to do was ask somebody if they were a cop.  They cannot 
however break the law directly in orde rto bust you.  That's 
entrapment:  eg- offering a hooker cash to have sex with them.

In the situations I deal with (club security) it's illeagal to solicite 
somebody for drugs within the bar.  Typically an undercover agent may go 
into a club and do just that.  Now, if we catch them doing it, or anything, 
they are ejected form the club immediatly (ABC violation if we don't).  If 
they are a cop, we have the full authority to eject them from the 
club.  This is the rather humor catch-22 of somebody asking you for drugs 
in a club.  They could be looking to score, and they could be an undercover 
looking to make a buy, bust and cite the club for allowing drug 
trafficing.  This is why we always ask patron to notify security if anyone 
solicites them for drugs.

Does this happen?  Sure.  The beauty is that you may very well be snitching 
on an undercover cop.  That's an irony that makes me smile.

Bottom line is, know who you are dealing with in all situations.


At 10:56 PM 6/19/2006, Bobby Burgess wrote:
>legally, can a police officer tell you that he is not a cop? i keep
>hearing conflicting reports. maybe the law varies from state to state?

In a message dated 6/20/2006 3:20:08 AM Pacific Standard Time,  
shatter@sonic.net writes:

it's  illeagal to solicite 
somebody for drugs within the bar.  Typically an  undercover agent may go 
into a club and do just that.  Now, if we  catch them doing it, or anything, 
they are ejected form the club  immediatly (ABC violation if we don't).  If 
they are a cop, we have  the full authority to eject them from the 
club.  
I helped get a couple "suspicious" guys thrown out of TELIC one time!  
(Former scout:  that was my good deed for that day.)  They were  unfamiliar and were 
asking too many people if they could get hooked up. Security  asked me to see 
if they asked me the same thing, yep, and within a few minutes  they were 
asked to leave. 
 
On the other extreme, I know for certain that there was a DEA agent at the  
door at some of the Sweets Ballroom parties in Oakland a few years ago. I  
never heard of the DEA doing any entrapment there; I think they just wanted  to 
gauge the situation and saw that although there was partying, it wasn't  out of 
control.

Content-Disposition: inline
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: BASSDROP - Wed, June 21st @ BOCA

Bassdrop
Wednesday June 21st, 2006
@ Boca (414 Jessie St.)
9pm-2am
21+ w/ID
only $5


You know how Evil Breaks does it. Super cheap with sick talent. Help
us kick off our new monthly @ BOCA with not one, but two amazing
headliners. We've taken over 3rd Wednesdays and from now on, hump day
won't be so bad. Ed209 to follow in July, and Carbon Community to
follow in August.


Featuring:

Deep Impact (Broke/Lot 49/Super Charged/Plastic Raygun/Cyberfunk) - UK

Deep Impact (aka Mark East) is a DJ/Producer from the UK who
originally started out as a Drum & Bass DJ way back in 1994, mainly
DJing in clubs and on the UKs extreme sport circuit with fellow DJ, DJ
Dust (Sie Dyson). Around 1999 the pair were hearing more and more of a
new sound that was emerging in the UK called Breakbeat and decided to
team up in the studio to have a go themselves, the subsequent track
was called "Give It" which was signed to Plastic Raygun.

Mark continued to produce with Simon moving to Brighton based
Supercharged to record tracks like "Methods" and "I Love Music" along
with remixes for The Freestylers. But unfortunately due to family
commitments Simon would have to quit, the pair's last work together
would be the mix album "Heavy Weight Breaks 2" and after a tour Simon
hung up his headphones.

Mark continued to DJ and produce and went on to write tracks such as
"Carpet Muncher" for Cyberfunk, "Rock Tha House" with fellow heavy
weight Distortionz and set up his own label Broke Recordings which
would see him team up with the Autobots for tracks such as "The
Spanish Tune" and "Bomba Latina" as well as his current outing and
IDJ's single of the month "Ultrafunkula" and "Rockin' With The Best."



Stone Lions (Marine Parade/StoneLions.net)

Stone lions is the first solo project from world-respected producer
Damian Taylor, (not to be confused with German wonder-kid Daniel
Taylor). Damian was deeply involved in the last Prodigy and Freeland
albums and is currently co producing the new Freeland album with Adam.

His debut as Stone Lions 'Snow over Arizona', is a deep rolling
musical masterpiece and very true to the original Marine Parade sound,
remember 9 Nickel? The dub mix is a heavy sound-system onslaught
designed with Adam's Fabric sets in mind.



Along with dj's:

Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks/XM Radio/AaronJae.com)
Athena (Evil Breaks)
Emerge (Disfunktion Crew/Breaks FM)


Check out mixes & get more info:
www.EvilBreaks.com

Signup to our mailing list to get info on all our events as well as a
chance to win free tickets.

-- 
--------------------------
< Brandon / DJ Bam >

DJ Bam - serving breaks and beats
http://www.evilbreaks.com

July 3rd:  Dyn-O-Might! w/ the Breakfastaz @ Mighty
July 19th:  Bassdrop w/ Ed209 @ BOCA

"No sage or savior has ever endorsed greed and gluttony as a path  
toward social justice or personal fulfillment.  These sane and  
enlightened people come to us from all cultures and all eras,  
sometimes knowing of each other but more often not.  Socrates and  
Jesus, Lao Tzu and Tolstoi, Gandhi and Martin Buber -- no one can  
find in their lives and words a jot of support for a political and  
economic regime that encourages the acquisition of wealth far beyond  
what is needed for the necessaries -- or even the restorative  
pleasures -- of life while consigning the masses to live and work in  
squalor."
-Stephen J. Fortunato, Associate Justice, Rhode Island Supreme Court.

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of  
the rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will  
gradually become visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"



--Apple-Mail-1-725757052--

How about having a demonstration called " Breasts not beasts" and
demonstrate against Islamic terrorists that tourture and kill our people
instead. Seems like it is a little more of a pressing issue then our stupid
president and his poor handling of the war. Also, doing anti military and
playing up all the bad things our militarty does just adds fodder and
support for the enemy. We need to play up the positives since this is a huge
psy war. Lets keep things in proper perspective.

> Hey Everybody

> Breasts Not Bombs is Back!

>

> THE
> BAY AREA
>
> THIS IS TO ANNOUNCE OUR FIRST OF THREE ACTIONS
>
> FRIDAY JUNE 23RD
> NOON
> THE MILITARY RECRUITMENT CENTER IN OAKLAND
> 21ST AND BROADWAY
>
> We are heartbroken over the story of US Soldier Suzanne Swift who has not
> only suffered the emotional injuries of an unjust war, but further damaged
> by the
> indecencies of soldiers in her own unit. She has refused to return to Iraq
> and was arrested by the Military and taken to Fort Lewis in
> Washington.  This
> and the ongoing indecencies of the Military under George Bush and Donald
> Rumsfeld, from Haditha to Guantanamo Bay brings us into the streets again
> to make the
> most powerful,, positive non-violent statement we can think of.  We
> welcome
> women and men to bare their Breasts to define what is decent in this world
> (mothers, babies, kindness, nurturing, feeding, education, etc.) and what
> is not
> (torture, massacres, warprofiteering, raping female soldiers, etc) Bring
> signs
> to indicate what you feel is indecent.
>
> The right to demonstrate bare breasted in protected under the First
> Amendment.
>
> If you have further questions about the legality of this demonstration
> feel
> free to contact me at mothersmilk@mcn.org

> "Look at every path closely and deliberately.  Try it as many times as you
> think necessary.  Then ask yourself and yourself alone one question.  This
> question is one that only a very old man asks.  My benefactor told me about
> it once when I was young and my blood was too vigorous for me to understand
> it.  Now I do understand it.  I will tell you what it is:  'Does this path
> have a heart?' If it does the path is good.  If it doesn't, it is of no
> use."
> -Don Juan

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: legally, can a police officer tell you that
  he's not a cop?

At 08:54 AM 6/20/2006, JonnyR@aol.com wrote:
>I helped get a couple "suspicious" guys thrown out of TELIC one time! 
>(Former scout:  that was my good deed for that day.)  They were unfamiliar 
>and were asking too many people if they could get hooked up. Security 
>asked me to see if they asked me the same thing, yep, and within a few 
>minutes they were asked to leave.

Without being too specific, we were notified at endup that some customers 
were dealing.  Now, It's a two sided coin.  Sure, maybe they are, and maybe 
somebody just wants to be bitchy and get somebody thrown out.  This is the 
case with creeping too.  We have to see it, for the most part.  Unless the 
customer is somebody we feel we can trust 100%, or we know them, then we 
take everything witha  grain of salt.  It's kind of like the girl that out 
of the blue says "That guy grabbed by ass, throw him out!"  Maybe he 
did,maybe he didn't.  Statisticaly if he did, he'll do it to somebody else, 
so we watch and see.

Well, long story short, we got a report from somebody, some time later 
(months) that they wer enot only dealing, but dealing some bad shit that 
was dropping people.  They were shortly caught and have been 86'd.  This 
goes along with even if you know the person, that doens't mean they are 
always safe.  Buyer beware.

>On the other extreme, I know for certain that there was a DEA agent at the 
>door at some of the Sweets Ballroom parties in Oakland a few years ago. I 
>never heard of the DEA doing any entrapment there; I think they just 
>wanted to gauge the situation and saw that although there was partying, it 
>wasn't out of control.

There are several clubs that have cops on staff.  Typically the cop is 
looking for extra work, so they moonlight doing security.  The interesting 
thing is if they find something on somebody on a door search, they arn't 
obligated to arrest them anymore than any other security.  However when 
they are on duty, they can act on that information in the future (eg- 
traffic violation and decide to search your car and your person at length) 
because they obtained that information about the suspect legally.



Shatter

shatter@sonic.net
http://www.sonic.net/~shatter
Y!: Shatter707  ICQ: 8953718  MSN & AIM:  TheRealShatter
Soulseek:  Shatter242
http://www.imeem.com/  Shatter

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: legally, can a police officer tell you that he's

    This reminds me of a party I went to in DC once. I was candyflipping 
that night, it was around Christmas and that fuckhead Pleasurehead had 
the gall to play an anthem trance remix of Jingle Bells. That was a lot 
to deal with, so I decided to go to one of the chill rooms and relax for 
a bit. So I sat on this couch and kind of stared off into space.
    Then, I looked at the wall in front of me and watched it go black. 
As it turned black, a green and yellow strand of DNA formed in the wall 
and started to spin around. I was watching this with great interest when 
someone tapped me on the knee. I looked down to see who it was and I saw 
a guy who said: "Hey man, do you know anyone that parties with that LSD?"
    His face was swirling around in all kinds of weird ways, but I still 
somehow knew he was a cop. "No sir, officer," I said with a hint of 
contempt.
    Damn pigs.

1. Creativity and innovation always builds on the past.
2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.
4. Ours is a less and less a free society.

Well, if you look at the last 10 years or so, the murders pile up right 
quick. I'm not talking about just Iraq, but all of the engagements of 
the US military in the last decade or so.

The exact numbers are irrelevant in any case, what matters here is that 
it's US soldiers that are killing way too many innocent people. Further, 
it does no one any good to act like they're justified in killing women 
and children for the sake of their supposed freedom, or to pretend that 
a certain level of innocent people dying is 'acceptable.'

Murder is murder my friend, and the US is bathing in it right now.

Just cuz you have the US military backing you does not justify killing, nor
does killing in the name of Allah.  And if you question the number of those
killed on the wrong end of the US' muzzle,  tallying numbers from Korea and
Vietnam alone will put you in the range of 2-5 MILLION combatants/civilians
killed.  And by no means was Ronald Reagan's War on Drugs and War  Terror
which  focused on Latin America a humanitarian effort.  The effects are
still being felt in many Latin American countries today, the re-emergence of
revolutionary Bolivarism and strong resentment against the US Government and
corporate interests meddling in the region.  The US has done some
extraordinary things, especially with europe after WWII, but it has also
managed to destroy entire countries and leave the people fighting over the
scraps, like in nicaragua.

list-unsubscribe: <mailto:sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org>
list-post: <mailto:sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: mailing list sfraves@hyperreal.org
Received: (qmail 90952 invoked from network); 20 Jun 2006 23:48:55 -0000
From: JonnyR@aol.com
Message-ID: <4d1.2244a5b.31c9e35b@aol.com>
Date: Tue, 20 Jun 2006 19:48:43 EDT
To: SFRaves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="-----------------------------1150847323"
X-Mailer: 9.0 SE for Windows sub 5026
X-Spam-Flag: NO
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Stilldream mini-review 

-------------------------------1150847323
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Stilldream 06 was my first Stilldream party, and it was amazing. The crew  
really went all out with the planning and execution. The music and vibe were  
excellent. A few thoughts: 
 
-- People came from all over! Sure, some from the Bay Area, but lots from  
Sacramento, Reno, Arizona, eveywhere. Even some people from Pittsburgh, PA;  
Finland; Russia; and Ukraine (not that they made a special trip, but it's still  
very cool). 
-- Music was nonstop and excellent. There was really a good variety, from  
hard techno to Woodstock hippie music (Sunday morning). 
-- The last four miles really ARE a very tough drive. I think I'll want to  
rent an SUV next time, even though my Tercel made it without any damage. Be 
sure  to make it there in the DAYtime, drive very carefully, and be sure your  
insurance is up to date. 
-- It wouldn't work to try to shuttle people up the hill because there's no  
way for vehicles to pass on that road. Everybody has to be drivng the same  
direction. 
-- Between 6 and 9 car break-ins. The perps were caught, thrown out, caught  
trying to get back in, and eventually Arnie announced they would go on the 
"Walk  of Shame." I heard this going on but was too tired to get up and see. I 
heard  people booing and Arnie saying not to throw things at them. Then they got 
thrown  out for good. Frontier justice! 
-- It was very, very hot in the daytime. Wasn't too cold at night. 
-- There were indeed a few substances around, like, uh, beer (only for 21  
and up, of course), and yeah ... well you know. Lots of happy ravers. 
-- There were not enough porta potties, and they got REALLY nasty very  
quickly. There was a lot of poison oak on the outskirts, so going back into the  
bushes wasn't much of an option. 
-- Some raver's car hit the only water pipe on the first day, which kept  
people from using the showers, and the crew wasn't able to set up the water  
slides and misters they had planned. 
-- My pics will go on the Stilldream site but i don't know exactly when. I  
took about 250 pictures and some video clips; I'll be getting those to GAMMA  
shortly. 
-- Psyched about next year!!!
 

-------------------------------1150847323--

At 03:22 PM 6/20/2006, JonnyR@aol.com wrote:
>To clarify a bit, when I said "I helped get a couple 'suspicious' guys 
>thrown out of TELIC one time!" it might have sounded like I meant dealers. 
>Actually, I meant people who seemed to be cops. They were too insistent 
>about finding someone with something to sell:  "Come on, man, you must 
>know somebody who can sell us some great rolls of e!"
>
>Uh, no, gentlemen. Out they went, not to return.

Exactly my point.

Had they asked around that much and the venue NOT done something, they 
could have been brought up on a fine/shutdown.

Regardless of your feelings towards recreational drugs, they have to be 
kept out of the clubs, or we will not have any clubs.  period.

I mean, its' pretty simple.  Do whatever your going to do, outside of the 
venue, ESPECIALLY if they have an In & Out policy.  Don't bring it 
in.  Leave it in the car, do it before you get there, whatever.  Respect 
the club, the owners, the promoters, the DJs, the security, the bar staff, 
etc etc., by not putting their jobs at risk.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Best Club in LV ??

1) Baby's closed at the Hard Rock 2 years ago.
2) Rain is at the palms and totally lame.
3) Pool party at the palms... great if you like
steroid looking guys and hookers.
4) Rehab sunday at the har rock pool is fun... but see
warning o number 3
5) THE ONLY clubs you have a chance of hearing decent
music are ICE ( which is off the strip and has
TERRIBLE management) and Empire Ballroom Afterhours
(which years ago was called Utopia)
6) If you wanna do bottle service and dress well...
your choices in order of possibly having fun are : TAO
at the Venetian, PURE at Caesars, and TRYST at Wynn.
7) Things to note: Clubs here change over faster than
out-of-towners understand. What was cool 3 years ago
is definitely lame now. with the exceptions listed
above, you are going to hear the same
hip-hop-radio-house-all-ammerican-swag-a-lag music
everywhere.The palms has the lamest club scene in town
PERIOD.

Oh yeah... and I live here and go out all the time.

E

Subject: Re: [sfraves] SRR: legally, can a police officer tell you that he's not a cop?

Yeah, same here.  I's a quick: "Nah, sorry.", and then I make a point  
of being elsewhere fairly soon.

For some reason though, whenever I go out partying, I just seem to be  
a magnet for people both looking to sell, AND for for people looking  
to buy pills.  Even though I've never dealt, and I can't recall the  
last time I bought at a party, it's been so long; but both buyers and  
dealers seem to flock to me.

My personal favorite, though, was at one of Skills' Popsicles....  It  
had to be about the most obvious undercover in the world.  What it  
said to me was:  "Hey bro!  You look pretty OG.  Know where I can  
score some X?"

W !
T !
F ????

I don't know what is more funny and/or pathetic.  The fact that the  
pigs used a friggin *GAME* that depicts made-up SoCal gangbangers in  
the early '90s to try to figure out how us "punk kids" talk in the  
real-life SF rave scene in the mid '00s....  or the fact that even if  
this WERE San Fiero, instead of San Francisco; that it thought I  
would looked "OG"!

(Question for people who've both played GTA and seen me at parties  
before...  If "OG" were real-life terminology, would what *I* look  
like at the average party fit the bill?  I think not!)

If I had been more fast-witted, I guess I should have replied: "You a  
buster." like I was a character in the game as well.  Instead I just  
said my usual: "Nope... sorry", walked away, and totally failed to  
contain my laughter about ten feet later.  I almost fell over, I was  
laughing so hard.


cya,
john

> 1) Baby's closed at the Hard Rock 2 years ago.
> 2) Rain is at the palms and totally lame.
> 3) Pool party at the palms... great if you like
> steroid looking guys and hookers.
> 4) Rehab sunday at the har rock pool is fun... but see
> warning o number 3
> 5) THE ONLY clubs you have a chance of hearing decent
> music are ICE ( which is off the strip and has
> TERRIBLE management) and Empire Ballroom Afterhours
> (which years ago was called Utopia)
> 6) If you wanna do bottle service and dress well...
> your choices in order of possibly having fun are : TAO
> at the Venetian, PURE at Caesars, and TRYST at Wynn.
> 7) Things to note: Clubs here change over faster than
> out-of-towners understand. What was cool 3 years ago
> is definitely lame now. with the exceptions listed
> above, you are going to hear the same
> hip-hop-radio-house-all-ammerican-swag-a-lag music
> everywhere.The palms has the lamest club scene in town
> PERIOD.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Best Club in LV ??

Baby's got replaced by a club called body english...
They must pay off the fire-marshall, cause they pack
like 3 times what is comfortable in the place, and
again, its a really big steroid and hooker crowd.

Utopia back in the day was fun, and so is afterhours
at the NEW Empire Ballroom... Its actually on the
strip, basically a few big blocks from the hard
rock.... but you have to remember that you cannot see
it from the street. I think its behind a walgreens
pharmacy.

E

At 07:57 PM 6/20/2006, Alex Laughlin wrote:
That's a little unrealistic, don't you think?

Not in the least.

I know of quite a few of the regulars who are all on E, who have admitted 
as much to me, or coke, speed, whatever.  They all leave it outside the 
club.  Hell, I'm pretty much quoteing THEM when I say "leave it outside, do 
it outside."  They make frequent trips outside, do their thing, and come 
back on in, and keep havinga  good time.  I've never thworn any of them 
out, never caught them with anything, because they love the place, the 
scene, the venue, and the staff.

I mean, if you can go out to your car anytime you like, why take any risks 
with having your night blown if you get caught?

can be found.

From: Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com>

Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2006 6:38:54 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Best Club in LV ??

1) Baby's closed at the Hard Rock 2 years ago.
2) Rain is at the palms and totally lame.
3) Pool party at the palms... great if you like
steroid looking guys and hookers.
4) Rehab sunday at the har rock pool is fun... but see
warning o number 3
5) THE ONLY clubs you have a chance of hearing decent
music are ICE ( which is off the strip and has
TERRIBLE management) and Empire Ballroom Afterhours
(which years ago was called Utopia)
6) If you wanna do bottle service and dress well...
your choices in order of possibly having fun are : TAO
at the Venetian, PURE at Caesars, and TRYST at Wynn.
7) Things to note: Clubs here change over faster than
out-of-towners understand. What was cool 3 years ago
is definitely lame now. with the exceptions listed
above, you are going to hear the same
hip-hop-radio-house-all-ammerican-swag-a-lag music
everywhere.The palms has the lamest club scene in town
PERIOD.

Oh yeah... and I live here and go out all the time.

E

Subject: Fw: [sfraves] BSP: 7/22 - 7/23 - Sacramento Summer Music Festival!!!

Electro Revolution Presents:

SACRAMENTO SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL
Concert . Campout . Party

www.sacramentomusicfestival.com

Infoline: (916)771-0186

Gates Open on 7/22 @ 5pm sharp!

The First Annual Sacramento Summer Music Festival
SSMF 2006
Dub Star Universal

SATURDAY SUNDAY
July 22 - 23, 2006
MARYSVILLE, CALIFORNIA
www.SacramentoMusicFestival.com


Electro-Revolution Experience
The first Annual Sacramento Summer Music Festival or simply the 
Electro-Revolution as its become known as, is the summer installment of the 
largest electronic dance event in the Sacramento area. With a massive 
variety of music, artists, performers and music lovers from around the 
world, it is an experience that is unique and enduring for all those who 
love electronic dance music.


It is the Electro-Revolution Experience that we invite you to enjoy with all 
of your friends, family and soon to be friends. After searching across 
northern California camp sites Dub Star Universal has chosen a site that 
will allow us to create an event that is true to the out door experience. 
Camping, dancing, and enjoying the company of friends and everything else 
that the Electro-Revolution Experience can only be enhanced by the presence 
of the hot sun and the bright stars!

Dub Star Universal will be transforming the Electro-Revolution Experience to 
a themed environment that will create a completely new level of connection 
and interaction with the music, the land and each other. All performance 
stages will be themed.

The Sacramento Summer Music Festival is presented by:
Dub Star Universal & Friends



With performances by:

Main Stage
brought to you by Dub Star Universal

Dub Star Universal is a Sacramento based event Production Company owned and 
operated soley by James Mondragon a.k.a. (SilentBeat). Dub Star is fully 
committed to producing Quality events from internationally headlined shows, 
club nights to underground electronic music parties. These events range from 
700 to 12,000 people.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Best Club in LV ??

There are really only two places that are strictly
afterhours now:

1) Good ole DRAIS at the barbary coast. Sweaty
underground location, that on occasion has great music
by local dj's.
2) the much bigger and more comfortable new Empire
Ballroom... which is definitely the hot spot at the
moment.

I think the club youare talking about may have been
held at a place called "Seven".... but im not sure... 

And... everyplace in town is pretty much open til 4 or
5... and the afterhours places open between 12 and 4
am....

E

Hey Lovers,

The crew that brought you Love Parade San Francisco, now bringing you =20=

San Francisco LoveFest, hope you're enjoying your summer so far!

We also hope you've set aside the weekend of September 23rd to come =20
take part in the evolution of Love in America. We're not quite ready =20
to start telling you all the amazing talent that will be taking part =20
in LoveFest weekend, but be assured, you'll want to be here.

In fact, we want to invite you to be a part of the event, by =20
producing a float in the parade this year. Our 2006 SF LoveFest Float =20=

Applications are now available for download from our site HERE. The =20
deadline for submission is Friday, July 21st. Check the site and =20
application for more information...

Volunteer Opportunities!

San Francisco LoveFest is an all volunteer non-profit. We are seeking =20=

help from the community to pull off the biggest dance music event in =20
the country. Please see below for all the ways you can help, and hit =20
reply to this e mail if you're interested in helping, and we'll get =20
in contact with you!

PROMOTIONS AND MARKETING

Help get out the word about San Francisco LoveFest! The Promotions & =20
Marketing team is extremely important to SFLF. This position is =20
responsible for the marketing and branding for this event and events =20
in the future. This position is responsible for the marketing budget =20
approved by the board, strategic planning, developing, managing and =20
implementing marketing initiatives. Managing the relationships with =20
the marketing publishers. Working with the President, Policy and =20
Procedure team to create the strategy for promotions, news media =20
strategy, marketing collateral and drive marketing tactics. This =20
position reports to the board president.

HOSPITALITY

Serve as the chief of protocol for San Francisco LoveFest! In plain =20
language you will serve as host to all Loveparade VIP's including, =20
but not limited to representatives from other like minded =20
organizations, polititions and headline entertainment.

COMMUNITY PARTNER RECRUITER

Help San Francisco LoveFest locate like-minded not for profit/=20
community service organizations who would like to raise funds for =20
their organization and San Francisco LoveFest through taking part in =20
the Parade and Festival.

FLOAT/PARADE COORDINATION

Ever wonder what it takes to put on an actual parade?. Perhaps you =20
are one of those people who wants to do a little more than just sit =20
on a float. Well here is your chance. Help us organize the parade =20
line-up and more. Don't be shy!

SITE

If you are a 'nuts-n-bolts' type of person this team is for you. =46rom =20=

ordering tents to tea to permits we do the work. No job is too large =20
or small for us. Help us plan the festival site for San Francisco =20
LoveFest from the ground up"

LOVE WEEK

Are you the type of person who lives and breathes the nightlife and =20
loves to interest with the movers and shakers in the late night =20
community? Put your love of the nightlife and our community to work =20
with us.

As a Love Week member you would be playing a key role in:

o Incorporating stake holders surrounding the days leading up to and =20
after the annual Loveparade event.
o Working with Marketing & Media team to attract larger attendance/=20
tourism throughout the week of Loveparade by ensuring a dynamic and =20
robust line of tie-in events.
o Stimulating revenue generation among additional stakeholders and =20
the city with the vision of creating an international destination =20
festival week.

Check the site often for updates, we'll be in touch very soon.

Get ready for a higher Love.

www.sflovefest.org =EF=BF=BC=20=

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: AIDS Marathon

--0-988140796-1150927453=:73175
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi guys,
   
  I am a permanent lurker here on SFraves. Some of you know me, some of you don't. One of the things that originally attracted me to the whole rave scene was the compassion and community that you all exude. I am currently trying to raise donations for the AIDS Marathon and would love it if some of you could help me out. I am not much of a runner but I thought I would try to push myself and raise money for such a worthy cause.
   
  Here is the link to my page http://www.aidsmarathon.com/participant.asp?runner=SF-4113&EventCode=HN06
   
  Even if you can't donate, words of encouragement help. I'm not really a morning person either and getting up at the crack of dawn to run is tough. Anyone else here doing the Marathon?
   
  Thanks a ton,
  Amber

Subject: [sfraves] Teknique gets Silky



I know some of you lurkers live up here and so this is for you...  

Hmmmmm.... Houseandtechno-flavorisindahouse

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------

Teknique - the original bi-weekly held at Bo Jangles was the place to be
during the spring Sunday nights in 2000. In addition to the nutter residents
(D'John, DJ Pat & Dragn'fly - oh and Josh), Teknique was known for bringing
in some sick ass talent to these parts; amongst them Jerry Bonham, Chris
Jackson, Amber & Andy W and others. Ahh... the memories... 

In the end, Bo Jangles burnt down and our little night came to an end...

But..

"theyyyyy'reeee baaaack":

At least for one night, so come out and join us for this reunion of sorts...


And since we have Mek as our guest tonight, we've decided to double this
event up as a "Stilldream Decompression" party.
So come on down and have a few with us.

TONIGHT!

Wednesday, June 21st, 2006

Teknique gets Silky

w/

Guest DJ:

Mek (Stilldream / Technotruth)

and Residents:

DJ Dragn'fly
DJ Pat
D'John 

Silk
1011 Del Paso Blvd
Sacramento, CA

Ages 18 & Up
I.D. Required


Cover: FREE

Via Sinistrae- Ecstatic Dance Ritual

Shed your false skin and be liberated=20
in the forbidden wisdom of immortality

The sexual energy is Life.=20
Rise as the serpent and the eagle, the spirit united with the flesh
as we dance the dance of existence, death, and change.

The evening will include a full continuous mix of live electronic music =
by Trip Tech=20
(from ambient to tribal, from experimental to trance),
and continuous video projections coupled with a Magickal Invocational =
Ritual.

This is the real thing.

Life unhindered, death unmasked , in a dance older than form.

Friday - June 23, 2006 7:30pm - 10:30pm (No one will be admitted after =
8pm)

At the Gatehouse at Fort Mason Center, San Francisco, California, 94123

$12 at the door or $8 if you purchase your ticket in advance.

Visit http://www.viasinistrae.com/events.htm=20

Send me an email if you have any questions about this event.=20
Send it to jc@viasinistrae.com or just reply to this email.

Juan Carlos
Black Note Music - Techno Shamanic Music
-- Energized Sound Creations --
http://www.deconstructionist.com/blacknote/

from this shit?"... is a thought that went through my own head =20
several times today.  If this were acceptable, I could just go back =20
to florida and live much more cheaply.  I just got out of a cool bath =20=

myself.  The AC is out at work, and by the time I got home I felt =20
like the floor of a movie theater.

If there is a god, maybe he really DOES hate fags.  According to the =20
forecast, it's supposed to continue to be putridly hot, under the =20
vile glare of the accursed day-orb, all bloody weekend!  And, to my =20
recollection, Pride weekend has suffered this horrible weather every =20
year since I've lived here.   *sigh*   What I wouldn't give, right =20
now, for a more normal nice and cool, moist and foggy and cloudy, San =20=

Francisco weekend for Pride.

I swear.... when I finally conquer the world; top of the to-do list =20
is to find a way to destroy the damned sun.

Check out my event on tribe.net:

Copy and paste this URL into your browser to see the event:

http://sanfrancisco.tribe.net/event/58389e98-dd3c-4bc2-a44b-d8c702a3071a

Date & Time: 2006-06-22 1:00 PM
Location: 


d i v i d e n d
thursday, 06.22.2006
10p-2a
nickie's, 460 haight st, sf, ca, usa, the metaverse constantly reforming
itself inside will wright's mind

see I wasn't even trying to kid you last time about turning up the heat.
like moths to a flame the reinvesting masses swarmed to flutter to the
rhythms of our skilled selektas, and a hot time was had by all. the tempo
turned so high and the beats dropped so thick that charlie nearly had to
spray everyone in chocolate syrup just to keep us from combusting. and what
a shame that would have been. so let's pick up where we left off, shall we?
without further ado...

:: Smoove (Newsbreakz) ::
your girlfriend's favorite dj returns from his interstellar cruise ship
tour, after being last spotted in kansas city wrangling every last drop of
red state riddims out of the cowtipping masses. you know how he do, so just
make sure to welcome him back home right.

:: DJ Unagi (Word of Mouth / Just Us Productions) ::
a southern california transplant back for a second revolution at the
dividend wheels of steel. expect this repeat offender to serve up a fresh
plate of breakbeats glazed in soy marinade and grilled to perfection.

:: Daneekah () ::
from down south to down under... a relatively fresh face on the san
francisco scene, australia's latest and greatest makes her first appearance
on the dividend stage, bringing her trademark slamming, frenetic mix of
dancehall and electro-breaks guaranteed to move your feets.


dividend : slippery when wet

http://www.false-profit.com/dividend
http://tribes.tribe.net/div
________________________________________________________________

Above the Sky 2 Round 2
June 24 2006

As many of you know, Mother Nature decided to throw a fit and rained-out our last party. But not being the sort of people who take a beating and stay down, we decided to throw a make good party. Originally we had planned to exactly repeat the last show's lineup, but due to some scheduling conflicts (that's what happens when you put together a party on short notice) we've made some changes. We think you will agree, though, that this lineup will be just as much fun as the last. So without any further babbling on my part, here's the new lineup for Above the Sky 2 Round 2 June 24th :

LINEUP :: ORDER OF APPEARANCE
ACTUAL RAFIQ Trip-Hop
:: the dRow .San Jose
DJ ABC Nu-Jive + Rare Grooves
:: SCUnderground .Santa Cruz
DJ UNAGI Breaks
:: Word of Mouth \ Justus productions .San Francisco
DJ DICE Breaks
:: Straylight \ Just Say Agency .Monterey
DJ RIPPLE Breaks
:: Subscience \ BreaksFM.com .San Francisco
MICHAEL LIU Psytrance + Breaks
vs
OFFICER BUNCH Psytrance
:: Illumination Records \ Secret Psychedelica .San Jose
:: Ooze System .Sacramento
MUBALI Dark Psytrance
:: Straylight \ Trishula Records .Berkeley
PARADIGM Full On Psytrance
:: Straylight \ Mindfunk Records .San Francisco
VAX Psytrance
:: Ataraxia .San Jose
HYDROPONIC Old School Breaks
:: Native State .San Diego
TACQUAN THE PICKLED RADISH Psytrance
:: Santa Cruz
OPEN DECKS 'Til we quit

Go to the following link for more info:
http://www.thehothouse.net/straylight/inde

Posted by: DJ


Tribe.net is a free service for connecting to your local community. You can find information, see what's available for sale or rental, and connect with people who share your interests.

1. Creativity and innovation always builds on the past.
2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.
4. Ours is a less and less a free society.

Message-ID: <BAY104-F29B1348668C134E9378071D97A0@phx.gbl>
X-Originating-IP: [24.120.142.250]
X-Originating-Email: [plurranger@hotmail.com]

In-Reply-To: <f4684b260606230813i73b71cb4yda583ee5642ea9db@mail.gmail.com>
From: "Ranger -" <plurranger@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Date: Fri, 23 Jun 2006 10:31:58 -0700
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 23 Jun 2006 17:32:03.0415 (UTC) FILETIME=[F0DCBE70:01C696EA]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby Ya! - Update

Tryst is amazing..  you know how endup has this little waterfall outside.. 
okay.. imagine about $500 mill to beef that up to a 100 foot three level 
casading actual water fall.. with a pool at the bottom and the whole thing 
is lined against the outside walls with white lounge tables.  Then throw in 
about 10 bars, stripper poles, hot hot hot hot women, and some pretty nice 
people all around all after the same thing.  The sound was great, the 
lighting excellent,

I was supposed to be on the guest list, and when I rolled up to the spot 
there were like 300 people clammoring to get in.  I heard from two people 
that the way in is 1) know someone, and 2) through the doormen.  Once I 
dialed in who was working the list.. it was all  gravy.  I made sure to go 
to the cash machine for $100 in fives, and then started handing em out like 
candy.  Ya.. that worked.  Sometimes rolling solo is so much easier.. there 
is no group complication and it is just easier for people to deal with you.  
I kinda had the feeling last night that is what got me in the door since I 
found I wasn't on the list.. yeah for style points.

It was funny how people (girls) that danced on the platforms had to be 
smokingly hot to be up there.. or they would be asked to leave.  It was 
funny how I had to know somebody in the group to be dancing by their table 
or I would be asked to leave.   People are straight up - who do you know, 
why are you here (on a thurday night).  At the end of the night, the only 
people I really vibed on was this married chica and I don't do that.. but I 
am down for meeting new people so I still made the connect.  I also learned 
how to play three card poker and won $80 for my first time gambling.. easy 
to stop when your up right?

More later, I have a headache :/

xoxo
Ranger



SFR: Ranger
San Francisco
plurranger@hotmail.com
Who knows where the night leads
It's dark and no one can see

quick cut faders.

Booth out Stereo (-10dBv; Jack1/4 unbalance)
Monitor headphone out Stereo (130mW; Jack 1/4")

Channel 1 2
Input switch: phono / line / line; Input trim control; 3-band isolator =
type equalizer: high 4/-85dB, mid 4/-85dB, low 4/-85dB; 3-band cut-fader =
with peak LED: high, mid, low; channel fader.=20

Channel vol.
Channel 4 (Microphone)
Channel vol.; Channel tone filter.

Output level control; Both out level control; Stereo output level LED =
bar display; Select switch: Master program
Monitor

on/off.

SPECIAL NOTICE:

THE SFRaves Calendar is being fixed, tested and checked for various
stresspoints under test.

If you are interested in working on helping to fix the SFRaves Calendar or
know of someone who is interested in becoming involved with the next
generation of the SFRaves Calendar Project - please email
karina@hyperreal.org

If you would like an event posted to the Calendar, please submit to:
karina@hyperreal.org and it will be listed on the Weekly Calendar Mailing.

The SFRaves Calendar is located @
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

Technologies: Zope: http://www.zope.org

Experience with / understanding / development experience with *a Plus* :

* authoring and building applications using the Zope application framework
(http://www.zope.org)
* ZPT * Python (http://www.python.org
* PHP
* MYSQL
* Plone

Please note if you are seeing issues with the current calendar (bugs,
errors, etc) please note that I am aware of them and am currently in the
process of addressing / fixing these issues.

Please send responses to karina@hyperreal.org

Alternative solutions are also being considered for the next generation of
this codebase. Other languages are being considered to enhance the SFR
Calendar Application. This includes languages specific to the development of
applications in a web environment.

Friday, June 23, 2006 * Predawn Summer Solstice Celebration *

Date & Time:  Friday, June 23, 2006 more on this date 11:00 PM Hello 
Friends! On the night of Friday, June 23rd we will be celebrating the 
arrival of the summer solstice with music, dance, and our unique 
collective energy. We hope you will join us as we gather late Friday 
night at a beautiful, discrete outdoor location near San Francisco. We 
will celebrate together through the night and watch the rising of the 
dawn sun together in the morning. In the past you may have celebrated 
equinoxes with us at the top of Mt Davidson. This year we will be using 
a new location that we are extremely excited to share with you. For 
info. please e-mail me (Forest) by 3PM (at the latest) Friday, 6/23 at 
bookdjforestgreen@yahoo.com After 3PM I will be unable to respond. 
dj's: Aberation Andy Highland Forest Green Micron Schwa We ask you to 
use great discretion when sharing this information with your friends. 
Please, do not forward this email to any other lists. Also, we would 
love if you would be so kind as to help with cleaning up, and keeping 
things tidy over the course of the night, and in the morning. Pack it 
in, Pack it out. Leave no trace. Thank you! =) We are looking forward 
to spending time with all of you! Happy Summer Solstice! ---- Much Love 
and Light, Predawn

Saturday, June 24, 2006 * Martel+Nabiel & SF-Vibe Present: Chus & 
Ceballos *

Date & Time:  Saturday, June 24, 2006 more on this date 10:00 PM Anyone 
who considers himself to be a serious lover of House music has spent 
many magic hours embracing the infectious sounds of Chus & Ceballos. 
Hailing from Spain, this dynamic duo has effortlessly carved out a 
secure slot amongst the elite with numerous slices of picture perfect 
modern House on their very own imprint STEREO PRODUCTIONS. In addition 
to these original epic productions, the crew has also revamped many 
special projects on such labels as Yoshitoshi, Shinichi, Skyline and on 
and on. Famous for their trademark Iberican sound, a delicious blend of 
hypnotizing, warm, inviting tribal soundscapes laced with a brilliant 
use of modern tech elements, Chus & Ceballos have figured out the 
formula that easily satisfies every punter within the clubbing 
collective. It is not only the starry eyed clubbers that worship at the 
altar of Chus & Ceballos. The worlds most celebrated DJs rely on this 
duo to fill their box with some of the most essential late night 
grooves known to man. With a list of credentials as impressive as that 
of these likely lads, it is no mystery as to why Chus & Ceballos are 
some of the most in demand DJs on the global circuit. Apart from 
satisfying the on-going demand for their DJ services, Chus & Ceballos 
have not skipped a beat regarding their studio efforts. As their legend 
continues to flourish, the team find themselves collaborating with some 
of the other heavy hitters on the scene. The House lovers of the world 
anxiously await these definite future classics with baited breath. In 
the words of the legendary DANNY TENAGLIA, Thank God for Chus & 
Ceballos! Truer words have never been spoken!

Saturday, June 24, 2006 * FunkyCozy @ Anu *

Sat June 24th 9pm-2pm With Guest Hac Le (playcomusic chicago) rezzies: 
Jon Beech Sinukus Tim McCormark and new rezzie Jason Short <BR> Here we 
go for another FunkyCozy - whew, I thought we just had one... erky! 
<BR> Thanks to everyone who made it out to Damian Lazarus last Thursday 
- twas a riot. <BR> <IMG src="www.sinukus.com/images/hac....jpg"> <BR> 
<BR> We're flying in Hac Le ( playcomusic.com/ ) from Chicago for an 
extended stay. Hac has emerged with a distinctive musical style - 
fusing his previous West Coast experience with the local Chicago House 
and Techno scenes. Known for his contrast of light and dark emotive 
soundscapes, Hac has captivated crowds across the country with his 
energetic, chunky, throbbing beats, performing in Chicago (Crobar, 
Transit, RedNoFive), Los Angeles, Milwaukee and Mexico with some of the 
best talent in the industry such as John Digweed, Moshic, BT, The 
Crystal Method, Taylor, Sandra Collins, Paul Van Dyk, Deep Dish, Pako & 
Frederik, Hector Romero, James Zabiela, Kazell and Hernan Cattaneo. 
<BR> <BR> Recently, Hac was recognized by one of the top DJs in the 
world. His mix was hand picked by John Digweed out of over 1,800 
entries as the winner of FutureMusic's Next Big Thing DJ contest. John 
Digweed was so enamored by Hac's winning entry that he decided to 
feature the mix on an episode of his internationally syndicated Kiss 
100 radio show. Hac was also flown out to Denver to open for John 
Digweed's and Desyn Masiello's Endless Summer Tour at the world famous 
venue, The Church. The media exposure has catapulted Hac's name and 
sound onto an even larger international stage.

Friday, June 30, 2006 * SF-Vibe 5 Year Anniversary *

Date & Time:  Friday, June 30, 2006 more on this date 10:00 PM Can you 
believe it's been 5 years since the needle hit the record for the very 
first time at an SF-Vibe party? We've played the biggest clubs and the 
smallest dives, and everywhere in between. Late nights at Big Heart, 
tacos on Tuesdays, staying afloat with a Watermelon, cuttin' it up with 
the Funk Divas at Sublounge, getttin' our Moov on at Luna, great 
fantasies at Lingba, Fabulous times at Levende, a prom queen at 
supperclub, and a not so little underground where John McEnroe would 
feel right at home- yes, of course, the 80s Tennis Party- where the 
ladies look fly in white skirts, and the guys don't mind at all. Join 
us on the 30th at the recently renovated Cat Club for three rooms of 
aural stimulation- Chuck Love and Miles Maeda are headlining, supported 
by a cast of DJs that have kept us bumpin' through the night for 5 
years. Housin': Chuck Love, M3, DJ Fluid, Uncle Larry 80s: Miles Maeda,

Heads). Fully permitted, virgin, San Francisco venue. Limited capacity
event, doors open at 9pm. Infoline 510.286.7955

Wednesday, August 02, 2006 * BOOM FESTIVAL Magic *

Date & Time:  Wednesday, August 2, 2006 - Wednesday, August 9, 2006 4:00 AM
Heya, All! We would like to share with you information about a very special
global arts, music and culture-gathering that incarnates biannually in
Portugal. Boom Festival takes place in a stunning outdoor location on the
shore of the Lake Idanha-a-Nova, approximately 2 hours North-West from
Lisboa. Bringing together the latest in psychedelic sights & sounds,
phantastic art installations & workshops, this week-long event is a harmonic
convergence of people, energy, information, and philosophies, from planet
Earth & beyond. Synchronized multi-dimensionally with the full moon of
August, the next Boom-Festival is taking a bio-dynamic approach by
incorporating a variety of sustainable techniques, and Earth-based forms
throughout its infrastructure. Reflecting a harmonic balance of the organic
and the cyber-technologic, Boom 2006 maps the metaphysical framework in
accordance with Peace, Love, Unity and Respect. A very magical event indeed!
5000 BOOM Festival 2006 Early Bird Tickets are available now. They are only
70 Euro for 7 days. Getting there is no big deal. Reasonable flights to
Lisboa can be purchased on most of the European Budget Airlines, and
Transatlantic flights from America are also quite cheap. The Boom has
organized busses that take you directly from the international airport to
the sacred womb of the vacation party paradise. This year, Boom-festival has
extended its length to ONE WEEK! Great news about the timing of BOOM 2006 is
that it's not happening in conjunction with Burning Man, so the devoted
"Burners" have a chance to partake on European creative community
expression. BOOM is similar to Burning Man, but with a lake & great sounds!
Not to be missed ... For more info, please visit: www.boomfestival.org

Friday, August 11, 2006 * Sound Asylum by Mizumo Music and Dj Denise *

With DJs: DRC (destra music/sfhousemusic / blue moon productions), Denise
(mizumo music), Dragn'Fly (dj4norml / strategik), Enemy, Adam Ant
(nocturnalism/earwacks), DJ Whisper, introducing DJ K3. LIVE and amazing
vocals by Audio Angel (celebrityjunglist). Lasers & lights by STIM-U-LIGHTS.
18+ event located in the heart of San Francisco. Access to full bar for the
21+. 9pm-4am. $20 @ door. Infoline 415.267.7656

------------------------------------------------- Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week. To subscribe to the
list, send a message to: sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

If you have events to add to the SFRaves calendar, please publish them by
Friday @ Noon to be included in the SFR Calendar Weekly Edition Mailing.

SFRaves is a not for profit entity serving the Bay Area & all forms of
electronic music for 14 years.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby Ya! - Update

Ah yes.. can I just say that life away from the strip is no less self 
indulgent in LV than it is on.. especially when your chilling with Mr. 
Spires.  I love it when ravers take it all the way.. from love of beats, to 
DJ, to producing, and then over the top to a whole new level.. ya that is 
where Eric is these days  its a whole new game.

Check it - going out Friday was classic LV for me cuz I when I think LV I 
think dinner, gambling, cocktails, and strip clubs. Nothing I couldn't right 
home about but it definitely involved a few seedy places, lot's of scantily 
clad women, kicking it with the boys, losing about $200 and travelin off the 
strip to hang out with some new friends.

Jumping to the good stuff - I lost my partners in crime at 3am and decided 
to call up Mr. Spires.  Of course he has a $1000 bottle table right in front 
of the stripper poles at Tryst, kickin it with several very kind peoplz and 
his girlfriend who bartends at one of the hottest clubs in town.. that's 
Tuesdays plan :)  He comes out and gets me because I am a cheap bastard and 
didn't want to spend $30 bones for an hour before they closed.. and then we 
all roll over to Eric's new flat in west LV.

This house is right out of freakin arch digest.. classic modern desert floor 
plan.. gated, sprawling, amazing in every regard.  Needless to say I would 
have never left if I hadn't had to be working by 11am.. so I stayed untill 
7am..lol got two hours of sleep and rolled into work.  what a trip.

Eric has some kick ass art.. wanna sell me a painting bro?  I was listening 
to a disk he made a few years back.. bomb ass Proggy House, and he is 
building a studio to do more production work.. hit this boy up for his 
labeled goods ya'll.  Anyway.. rollin onto the spot with these kidz is mad 
fun and I just want to say how bomb it is that we have eachother in SFR 
land, because you are all the freakin shit.. and always will be!


More to come.. Tuesday!


SFR: Ranger
San Francisco
plurranger@hotmail.com
Who knows where the night leads
It's dark and no one can see

> home about but it definitely involved a few seedy places, lot's of
> scantily
> clad women, kicking it with the boys, losing about $200 and travelin off
> the
> strip to hang out with some new friends.
>
> Jumping to the good stuff - I lost my partners in crime at 3am and decided
> to call up Mr. Spires.  Of course he has a $1000 bottle table right in
> front
> of the stripper poles at Tryst, kickin it with several very kind peoplz
> and
> his girlfriend who bartends at one of the hottest clubs in town.. that's
> Tuesdays plan :)  He comes out and gets me because I am a cheap bastard
> and
> didn't want to spend $30 bones for an hour before they closed.. and then
> we
> all roll over to Eric's new flat in west LV.
>
> This house is right out of freakin arch digest.. classic modern desert
> floor
> plan.. gated, sprawling, amazing in every regard.  Needless to say I would
> have never left if I hadn't had to be working by 11am.. so I stayed untill
> 7am..lol got two hours of sleep and rolled into work.  what a trip.
>
> Eric has some kick ass art.. wanna sell me a painting bro?  I was
> listening
> to a disk he made a few years back.. bomb ass Proggy House, and he is
> building a studio to do more production work.. hit this boy up for his
> labeled goods ya'll.  Anyway.. rollin onto the spot with these kidz is mad
> fun and I just want to say how bomb it is that we have eachother in SFR
> land, because you are all the freakin shit.. and always will be!
>
>
> More to come.. Tuesday!

    SPECS ARE AS FOLLOWS:


    Vestax PMC-250, a fantastic house mixer with isolators.
    With 2 main channels each having its own 3 band isolators on rotary =
and quick cut faders.


    Specifications=20
    SPECIFICATIONS
    INPUT:
    Phono inputs Stereo (RIAA 42dBv; RCA) x 3
    Line inputs Stereo (-10dBv; RCA) x 5
    Microphone, Inputs (-50dBv; Jack1/4) x 1

    OUTPUT:
    PA out Stereo (0dBv / -10dBv switch able; XLR balanced)=20
    Line out Stereo (-10dBv; Jack1/4 unbalance.)
    Booth out Stereo (-10dBv; Jack1/4 unbalance)
    Monitor headphone out Stereo (130mW; Jack 1/4")

    CHANNEL:
    3/4Channels; (3 stereo, 1 mono)
    Channel 1 2
    Input switch: phono / line / line; Input trim control; 3-band =
isolator type equalizer: high 4/-85dB, mid 4/-85dB, low 4/-85dB; 3-band =
cut-fader with peak LED: high, mid, low; channel fader.=20
    Channel 3 (Aux.)
    Channel vol.
    Channel 4 (Microphone)
    Channel vol.; Channel tone filter.

    MASTER:
    Output level control; Both out level control; Stereo output level =
LED bar display; Select switch: Master program
    Monitor
    Phones level; Cue selector switches: CH 1; Aux; CH2; Stereo cue =
switch: on/off.
    Cross-fader PCV; Channel 1- 2=20

    FREQU. RESPONSE:
    20-20000 Hz /-1dB
    S / N RATIO:
    >75 dB THD: <0.01%

    DIMENSIONS:
    (W x H x D) 482 x 138 x 132 mm (19 3U)
    WEIGHT:
    4.0Kg.
    POWER SUPPLY:
    Vestax AC-12A

    ACCESSORIES / USER REPLACEABLE PARTS:
    Input fader; IF-25
    Cross fader; CF-PCV

X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2900.2869

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Weekend review - Revolution Campout

------=_NextPart_000_00B9_01C69907.16A65C60
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Holy fucking shit...I had one of the best times of my life at the =
Revolution campout this past weekend.=20

Got to the site around 10pm - got semi-situated by the fire w/ our =
mobile bar and started the partying...

Shawn Allen kicked things off quite nicely, and then things got trippy =
with Chris Yap playing what sounded suspiciously more like psytrance =
then techno, hehe. El Juan and Shank tore it up, as did a few others =
that I won't be remembering due to the quantity of liquor I had consumed =
by that point.=20

About that time, I snuck in two hours sleep in the car - then woke up to =
sunlight...

The spot in the daytime was amazing...beautiful location right next to a =
lazy creek that has natural pools in it. When the heat of the day was =
full on, the bulk of us were down at the pools, naked, half naked or =
otherwise...smoking up, quaffing drinks (or whatever other potent =
potables were around).=20

The word I'd use for the spot/vibe would be "idyllic". People were just =
beaming with happiness all weekend long. Sharing with their friends, =
laughing, loving a nice weekend out in the woods.=20

During the early portion of the day, there was some great hip-hop and =
downtempo-y house & breaks w/ Marin, Hickory and someone else I am =
forgetting - then evening segued into some tasty house & "eclectica" w/ =
Cubik & Origami. (amazing set you two!) Then some more breaks w/ Mark =
Ameba, who played one of my all time favorite Bassex tracks much to my =
happiness.=20

Not sure if there was someone after him, but by the time night got on =
(and after a short music-less interlude for some art shenanigans), Donna =
Matrix got things seriously cooking with one of the BEST sets I have =
ever heard her play. At several times during her set I heard records I =
sold her be dropped, and I had to smile at knowing she was getting good =
use of them. After her was honestly one of the BEST sets I have ever =
heard...and I mean EVER. Brian Seed (aka DJ Brian) from the Moontribe =
crew played one of the SICKEST sets ever. It harkened back to the old =
days of crafting a set that  "went somewhere". House, breaks, techno - =
heavy on the psychedlic side of things...it really took us all on a =
journey, and nest to Miranda's set (Donna Matrix), it had the most =
people up and dancing around the fire all night. Midway through the next =
guy's set, I was tired and pretty tore back, so I popped a nap in, and =
then awoke about 2 hours later to more of the same vibe...

Stayed up all morning long drinking and toking and having good =
conversation with friends/family. Around 11am we had a nice little =
grilled meal, then packed up and headed back, as some of our crew =
actually had to work on Sunday.=20

I will be going to next year's campout for sure...slightly better =
prepared and taking an extra day to enjoy the spot.=20

This was definitely one of my best times in California...

~Marco




------=_NextPart_000_00B9_01C69907.16A65C60--

From: georgeC | origami <newstylesound@yahoo.com>

To: Ranger - <plurranger@hotmail.com>, sfraves@hyperreal.org

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby Ya! - Update

Wow, this place sounds like an awful waste of money.  I thought "ultra lounges" in the city were bad...  

Bottle/table service is the wackest thing since Hypercolors..  I just can't imagine why anybody'd feel like a pimp just because they paid $300 for a $20 bottle of liquor and the sainted right to sit at a tiny table.  I can throw a wicked house party for 30 people for not a whole lot more than $300.  I guess if one has enough money that $300 is a trifle and they'd rather sit and mix their own drinks than go, say, dance, or trouble themselves by going to, say, the bar for a drink, then, hey, that's a great entertainment value!  Meh.  Exclusivity by design, not by function.  It's like selling gold-plated turds.

"Hey, have you seen my new Fendi turd?  It's dipped in platinum!  Cost a cool 2 Gs.."

"Yeck, I think I can smell it through the coating.  Fendi, though, huh?  Pretty fly.."

"Yeah, it's from the 'Affluent Effluent' series, the girls LOVE IT."

"Oh yeah, I think I'm going to pick up their new donkey piss-filled zirconium-encrusted money clip soon."

"Score bro!" *hi5*

Personally, I think megaclubs with megaqueues and guest list politics are the penultiwack.  I've played a few of them and inside it's always the same- moneyed idiots that can't dance and the golddiggers that magnetize to them, all surrounded by bad architecture, tasteless attire, and vibe in the sub-zero range.  For all of their external bling, most of these places have substandard dj booths, pay performers horribly, and offer paltry niceties to the talent- but that's just a dj's perspective.

Anyway, not to rain on your parade- it was just funny that you seemed to have a good time and like the place despite a "if you dance by my table and you don't know me you're getting the boot" attitude..  Just sounds like postureville to me.  Glad you had fun though.

-vegas-hater

----- Original Message ----
From: Ranger - <plurranger@hotmail.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
Sent: Friday, June 23, 2006 10:31:58 AM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby Ya! - Update

Tryst is amazing..  you know how endup has this little waterfall outside.. 
okay.. imagine about $500 mill to beef that up to a 100 foot three level 
casading actual water fall.. with a pool at the bottom and the whole thing 
is lined against the outside walls with white lounge tables.  Then throw in 
about 10 bars, stripper poles, hot hot hot hot women, and some pretty nice 
people all around all after the same thing.  The sound was great, the 
lighting excellent,

I was supposed to be on the guest list, and when I rolled up to the spot 
there were like 300 people clammoring to get in.  I heard from two people 
that the way in is 1) know someone, and 2) through the doormen.  Once I 
dialed in who was working the list.. it was all  gravy.  I made sure to go 
to the cash machine for $100 in fives, and then started handing em out like 
candy.  Ya.. that worked.  Sometimes rolling solo is so much easier.. there 
is no group complication and it is just easier for people to deal with you.  
I kinda had the feeling last night that is what got me in the door since I 
found I wasn't on the list.. yeah for style points.

It was funny how people (girls) that danced on the platforms had to be 
smokingly hot to be up there.. or they would be asked to leave.  It was 
funny how I had to know somebody in the group to be dancing by their table 
or I would be asked to leave.   People are straight up - who do you know, 
why are you here (on a thurday night).  At the end of the night, the only 
people I really vibed on was this married chica and I don't do that.. but I 
am down for meeting new people so I still made the connect.  I also learned 
how to play three card poker and won $80 for my first time gambling.. easy 
to stop when your up right?

More later, I have a headache :/

xoxo
Ranger



SFR: Ranger
San Francisco
plurranger@hotmail.com
Who knows where the night leads
It's dark and no one can see

>To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
>For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>
>
>
>---------------------------------------------------------------------
>To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
>For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
>
>


--
1. Creativity and innovation always builds on the past.
2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.
4. Ours is a less and less a free society.

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org
