Subject: Re: [sfraves] Table/Bottle service  Was: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby
 Ya! - Update


On Mon, 26 Jun 2006, Apollo wrote:
-&e->Raves began here when, amongst other irritations, the communal dance folks
-&e->got tired of the clubs.  Raves ended when those involved saw opportunities
-&e->to make bucks...like the clubs.  My partner collected boxes of old fliers
-&e->from late eighties early nineties SF underground gay and mixed parties we
-&e->used to attend.  All of them were hand written and run off on color papers.
-&e->Some were stickers one would paste on one's black motorcycle jacket:)  Then
-&e->came the late nineties.  Four color fliers.  BIG.

Bingo to Apollo for stating the obvious yet not often enough said.

These events are gatherings, where the promoter, the DJ and the attendee 
melted away and all became participants.  Where the rules and societal 
mores gave way to a simpler ethic, one that embraced personal freedoms, 
and a result that at worst was a lame night out, at best was a life 
changing experience.  So many nights were I came with $5 to get in and 
that's all I worried about, walking home in the san francisco morning 
light aware, in love, bulletproof.  Other nights where I brought sound.  
Other nights where I shared music.  Mornings where people would offer to 
carry my records, not because I was a DJ, but because they looked heavy.  
Afterparties where we fell asleep on each other and woke up to the same DJ 
playing Brian Eno 8 hours later.  Bringing fruit to parties and just 
handing it out in the chill room.  The communal wail of one person yelling 
in joy and having everybody else join in, we became rays shooting out of a 
sun nobody could see but all knew was there.  Tangible energy arcing 
across the sky, the future promising if only because it might be 1% of the 
way we felt right then.  We took such good care of each other and some of 
us still do.

The opposite of a proper rave or underground gathering is the VIP club.  
I don't even want to fucking hear about it.  Take your velvet ropes and 
shove them up your ass, and with gusto.  For them to have value it means 
people coming out and being told "no, you're not good enough".  Not what I 
signed up for, not at all.  I don't care what the criteria is... if it's 
who you know, what color your skin is, how much dick you suck or how much 
money you appear to have... it's fucking retarded.  The world needs 
another stuck up club full of hair product guidos and platinum sluts with 
mouths like groupers like I need a hernia.

Take your fucking SUV driving, platinum money clip lying to get laid ass 
and get the fuck out of here.  You're the opposite of getting it, we built 
this in spite of you because we wanted the music, and the dancing and the 
synergy of human energies without all that shit.  You broke rock, you 
broke disco, you break everything you touch, you are dead cities and 
capitalism and face lifts and dishonesty and fear personified.

I want to dance with the ugly people, the poor people, the outsiders, the 
freaks, the nerds, the new kids in town, the people who don't know the 
right people people.  I don't want to enjoy my obviously overpriced bottle 
of what have you in the vip lounge, I want my ass kicked by music, mind 
ripped by intensity, and if I meet some friends for life hell yeah.  I 
prefer big brains to gold chains and I prefer it when the beat is greater 
than the ego.  Make me beg at a velvet rope, search my body for shit that 
is mine, and call me a VIP?  I'm a man who doesn't buy that shit for a 
minute, fuck off.  The only service that shit provides the world is taxing 
the stupid, you're all fucked in the head.

andyw

---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

> Bingo to Apollo for stating the obvious yet not often enough said.

> These events are gatherings, where the promoter, the DJ and the attendee
> melted away and all became participants.  Where the rules and societal
> mores gave way to a simpler ethic, one that embraced personal freedoms,

> changing experience.  So many nights were I came with $5 to get in and

> sun nobody could see but all knew was there.  Tangible energy arcing
> across the sky, the future promising if only because it might be 1% of the

> another stuck up club full of hair product guidos and platinum sluts with
> mouths like groupers like I need a hernia.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Table/Bottle service  Was: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby Ya! - Update

--0-1564754002-1151438839=:92429
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

AMEN!!!!!!!  

AndyW <andy@saturn5.com> wrote:  
On Mon, 26 Jun 2006, Apollo wrote:
-&e->Raves began here when, amongst other irritations, the communal dance folks
-&e->got tired of the clubs. Raves ended when those involved saw opportunities
-&e->to make bucks...like the clubs. My partner collected boxes of old fliers
-&e->from late eighties early nineties SF underground gay and mixed parties we
-&e->used to attend. All of them were hand written and run off on color papers.
-&e->Some were stickers one would paste on one's black motorcycle jacket:) Then
-&e->came the late nineties. Four color fliers. BIG.

Bingo to Apollo for stating the obvious yet not often enough said.

These events are gatherings, where the promoter, the DJ and the attendee 
melted away and all became participants. Where the rules and societal 
mores gave way to a simpler ethic, one that embraced personal freedoms, 
and a result that at worst was a lame night out, at best was a life 
changing experience. So many nights were I came with $5 to get in and 
that's all I worried about, walking home in the san francisco morning 
light aware, in love, bulletproof. Other nights where I brought sound. 
Other nights where I shared music. Mornings where people would offer to 
carry my records, not because I was a DJ, but because they looked heavy. 
Afterparties where we fell asleep on each other and woke up to the same DJ 
playing Brian Eno 8 hours later. Bringing fruit to parties and just 
handing it out in the chill room. The communal wail of one person yelling 
in joy and having everybody else join in, we became rays shooting out of a 
sun nobody could see but all knew was there. Tangible energy arcing 
across the sky, the future promising if only because it might be 1% of the 
way we felt right then. We took such good care of each other and some of 
us still do.

The opposite of a proper rave or underground gathering is the VIP club. 
I don't even want to fucking hear about it. Take your velvet ropes and 
shove them up your ass, and with gusto. For them to have value it means 
people coming out and being told "no, you're not good enough". Not what I 
signed up for, not at all. I don't care what the criteria is... if it's 
who you know, what color your skin is, how much dick you suck or how much 
money you appear to have... it's fucking retarded. The world needs 
another stuck up club full of hair product guidos and platinum sluts with 
mouths like groupers like I need a hernia.

Take your fucking SUV driving, platinum money clip lying to get laid ass 
and get the fuck out of here. You're the opposite of getting it, we built 
this in spite of you because we wanted the music, and the dancing and the 
synergy of human energies without all that shit. You broke rock, you 
broke disco, you break everything you touch, you are dead cities and 
capitalism and face lifts and dishonesty and fear personified.

I want to dance with the ugly people, the poor people, the outsiders, the 
freaks, the nerds, the new kids in town, the people who don't know the 
right people people. I don't want to enjoy my obviously overpriced bottle 
of what have you in the vip lounge, I want my ass kicked by music, mind 
ripped by intensity, and if I meet some friends for life hell yeah. I 
prefer big brains to gold chains and I prefer it when the beat is greater 
than the ego. Make me beg at a velvet rope, search my body for shit that 
is mine, and call me a VIP? I'm a man who doesn't buy that shit for a 
minute, fuck off. The only service that shit provides the world is taxing 
the stupid, you're all fucked in the head.

andyw

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

--0-1564754002-1151438839=:92429--

Mime-Version: 1.0

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Table/Bottle service



When Eric hooked our crew up with Pure guestlist, we had
a great time.  Without bottle service, you could either wander around
aimlessly or dance.  The music on the main floor was terrible.  However,
on the upstairs patio, there was a nice little soundsystem with fantastic
music.  With the warm desert night breeze blowing on us, and the Strip
lit up all below us, we really felt like we were having a prime
Burning Man expereince.  Our crew totally got the upstairs soundsystem
jumping, all the bottle service people seemed too uptight to dance.  The
DJ was totally loving us.

We felt like we earned our free entrance by really getting a proper party
going on the patio.

Of course, when we finally got tired, there was no where to chill out,
so we just went back into the casino.  Vegas Baby!

-troy


On Mon, Jun 26, 2006 at 06:49:17PM -0700, Eric Spire wrote:
> Actually, some places will let you walk with the
> bottle if it's capped, others will hold it for the
> next night, but all of them don't tell you this and
> certainly make no effort to let you know...
> 
> My biggest thing about the bottle service requirement
> is this:
> One bottle per four people guarantees that everyone is
> drunk. Forcing you to order enough liquor guarantees
> that there is no sober driver. They are responsible
> for cutting you off if you've had to much... Thus the
> paradox of requiring you to order enough to get drunk,
> while legally having to cut you off when you've had
> too much.
> 
> Personally, I would rather have to pay a "table fee"
> and get bottles for a reasonable price, rather than
> have the table price built into the bottles. On big
> weekends, like fight nights, nascar, Car shows, etc...
> they bump the bottle requirment to a minimum of 3
> bottles, PERIOD, regardless of how many people are
> with you.
> 
> Luckily, my friends and I know someone in charge at
> nearly every establishment, and because liquor reps
> are constantly pushing their new thing, we usually get
> a buy 1 get one comped deal, which makes it about
> $400-500 for a group of 8 or so... which really aint
> that bad at the end of the night.
> 
> Like I said though, this model is moving everytwhere.
> When I moved here, I couldn't believe how lame the
> clubs were. Music wise, most still are. I thought the
> SF style would come here sooner or llater, but it
> seems the reverse is happening, including the shitty
> music format.
> 
> It's one of those things that sucks, but is coming no
> matter weather you want it or not...Kinda like trance
> hitting SF in the late 90's... It was horrible, we all
> imagined that it would never take over the groovy
> house vibe in SF... but it certainly did.
> 
> E
> 
> 
> --- Amadu78 <amadu78@hotmail.com> wrote:
> 
> > AND IM GUESSING THERE'S NO WAY THEY WILL GIVE YOU
> > THE BOTTLE TO TAKE HOME.
> > K~

> > 4
> > >> > people, there is almost no chnace of finishing
> > the
> > >> > liquor... So what do they do? They "marry" the
> > >> > leftovers into their bar stock , thus selling
> > the
> > >> > liquor twice.
> > >> >
> > >> > E
> > >> >
> > >> > --- georgeC | origami <newstylesound@yahoo.com>
> > >> wrote:
> > >> >
> > >> >> I know it's not new, but it's certainly
> > growing
> > >> in
> > >> >> popularity, and I think that sucks.  Good
> > >> clubbing,
> > >> >> to me, is still about inclusivity.  A good
> > club
> > >> is
> > >> >> just a couple of steps away from a good
> > >> underground
> > >> >> party, ideally- with better infrastructure and
> > >> >> legitimacy.  All of these see-and-be-seen
> > >> "services"
> > >> >> are the work of entrepreneurs and marketing
> > >> people
> > >> >> that strive to reap the financial benefits of
> > >> social
> > >> >> pressures and class divisions.  Bottom-feeding
> > >> >> behavior of the lowest level, and
> > unfortunately,
> > >> >> very American.
> > >> >>
> > >> >> So yeah, that attitude and its trappings may
> > be
> > >> >> age-old, but that doesn't mean they belong
> > here.
> > >> >> Just 5 years ago I could count the number of
> > >> places
> > >> >> in SF that trifled with this foolishness on
> > one
> > >> >> hand, and none of them were considered real
> > >> >> nightspots- they were considered caches for
> > the
> > >> >> rich.
> > >> >>
> > >> >> But yeah, hey, to each their own...  ..until
> > all
> > >> of
> > >> >> my favorite clubs become marina-chick/fidi-guy
> > >> >> clutches, and then, by gum, it's gonna be WAR.
> > >> (or
> > >> >> time to move)  ;)

----- Original Message ----
From: AndyW <andy@saturn5.com>
To: Apollo <apollo@speakeasy.org>
Cc: georgeC | origami <newstylesound@yahoo.com>; "SFRaves@hyperreal.org" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Tuesday, June 27, 2006 12:32:52 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] Table/Bottle service  Was: Re: [sfraves] Vegas Baby Ya! - Update


On Mon, 26 Jun 2006, Apollo wrote:
-&e->Raves began here when, amongst other irritations, the communal dance folks
-&e->got tired of the clubs.  Raves ended when those involved saw opportunities
-&e->to make bucks...like the clubs.  My partner collected boxes of old fliers
-&e->from late eighties early nineties SF underground gay and mixed parties we
-&e->used to attend.  All of them were hand written and run off on color papers.
-&e->Some were stickers one would paste on one's black motorcycle jacket:)  Then
-&e->came the late nineties.  Four color fliers.  BIG.

Bingo to Apollo for stating the obvious yet not often enough said.

These events are gatherings, where the promoter, the DJ and the attendee 
melted away and all became participants.  Where the rules and societal 
mores gave way to a simpler ethic, one that embraced personal freedoms, 
and a result that at worst was a lame night out, at best was a life 
changing experience.  So many nights were I came with $5 to get in and 
that's all I worried about, walking home in the san francisco morning 
light aware, in love, bulletproof.  Other nights where I brought sound.  
Other nights where I shared music.  Mornings where people would offer to 
carry my records, not because I was a DJ, but because they looked heavy.  
Afterparties where we fell asleep on each other and woke up to the same DJ 
playing Brian Eno 8 hours later.  Bringing fruit to parties and just 
handing it out in the chill room.  The communal wail of one person yelling 
in joy and having everybody else join in, we became rays shooting out of a 
sun nobody could see but all knew was there.  Tangible energy arcing 
across the sky, the future promising if only because it might be 1% of the 
way we felt right then.  We took such good care of each other and some of 
us still do.

The opposite of a proper rave or underground gathering is the VIP club.  
I don't even want to fucking hear about it.  Take your velvet ropes and 
shove them up your ass, and with gusto.  For them to have value it means 
people coming out and being told "no, you're not good enough".  Not what I 
signed up for, not at all.  I don't care what the criteria is... if it's 
who you know, what color your skin is, how much dick you suck or how much 
money you appear to have... it's fucking retarded.  The world needs 
another stuck up club full of hair product guidos and platinum sluts with 
mouths like groupers like I need a hernia.

Take your fucking SUV driving, platinum money clip lying to get laid ass 
and get the fuck out of here.  You're the opposite of getting it, we built 
this in spite of you because we wanted the music, and the dancing and the 
synergy of human energies without all that shit.  You broke rock, you 
broke disco, you break everything you touch, you are dead cities and 
capitalism and face lifts and dishonesty and fear personified.

I want to dance with the ugly people, the poor people, the outsiders, the 
freaks, the nerds, the new kids in town, the people who don't know the 
right people people.  I don't want to enjoy my obviously overpriced bottle 
of what have you in the vip lounge, I want my ass kicked by music, mind 
ripped by intensity, and if I meet some friends for life hell yeah.  I 
prefer big brains to gold chains and I prefer it when the beat is greater 
than the ego.  Make me beg at a velvet rope, search my body for shit that 
is mine, and call me a VIP?  I'm a man who doesn't buy that shit for a 
minute, fuck off.  The only service that shit provides the world is taxing 
the stupid, you're all fucked in the head.

andyw

---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

While I agree with the rave-ideals speech... The San
Francisco underground/dj scene is the most elitist,

you inside rather than turning you away for any
reason.

hollywood... not here... just a line like any rave...
wait and you get in.

Its unfair to shit on everything other than what you
like.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Question for the SFR Network Wizards

------=_Part_3927_24111438.1151518192909
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Disposition: inline

Most companies cache and log what internet sites have been accessed by what
internal IP. This information would most likely be stored on the gateway
server and only seen by an admin. I have found that getting to know your
companies IT department and buying them lunch and throwing them a six pack
every once-in-awhile is in your best interest.

On 6/27/06, dangrsmind@yahoo.com <dangrsmind@yahoo.com> wrote:

=20
Most companies cache and log what internet sites have been accessed by what=
 internal IP. This information would most likely be stored on the gateway s=
erver and only seen by an admin. I have found that getting to know your com=
panies IT department and buying them lunch and throwing them a six pack eve=
ry once-in-awhile is in your best interest. =20
=20
 On 6/27/06, dangrsmind@yahoo.com  wrote:  p.s. if you are being monitored,=
 they'll also know you downloaded this software, and then they'll know that=
 you know that they know... =20
=20
As an alternative you can download at home, burn the zips to a CD, and then=
 install from the CD.=20

References: <20060627223246.12855.qmail@web60811.mail.yahoo.com>
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Question for the SFR Network Wizards

Keep in mind that they can monitor all the web sites that you go to
that don't use https (SSL). And a lot of traffic from anonmyizer.com
is a red-flag - I can tell when users are doing this kind of proxy or
bouncing it off a home server.

So right now, your GMail traffic is passing in the clear. In the
address bar, change that 'http' to 'https' and hit Enter, and your
GMail traffic will at least be encrypted.

On 6/26/06, Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com> wrote:
>
> Actually, some places will let you walk with the
> bottle if it's capped, others will hold it for the
> next night, but all of them don't tell you this and
> certainly make no effort to let you know...
>
> My biggest thing about the bottle service requirement
> is this:
> One bottle per four people guarantees that everyone is
> drunk. Forcing you to order enough liquor guarantees
> that there is no sober driver. They are responsible
> for cutting you off if you've had to much... Thus the
> paradox of requiring you to order enough to get drunk,
> while legally having to cut you off when you've had
> too much.
>
> Personally, I would rather have to pay a "table fee"
> and get bottles for a reasonable price, rather than
> have the table price built into the bottles. On big
> weekends, like fight nights, nascar, Car shows, etc...
> they bump the bottle requirment to a minimum of 3
> bottles, PERIOD, regardless of how many people are
> with you.
>
> Luckily, my friends and I know someone in charge at
> nearly every establishment, and because liquor reps
> are constantly pushing their new thing, we usually get
> a buy 1 get one comped deal, which makes it about
> $400-500 for a group of 8 or so... which really aint
> that bad at the end of the night.
>
> Like I said though, this model is moving everytwhere.
> When I moved here, I couldn't believe how lame the
> clubs were. Music wise, most still are. I thought the
> SF style would come here sooner or llater, but it
> seems the reverse is happening, including the shitty
> music format.
>
> It's one of those things that sucks, but is coming no
> matter weather you want it or not...Kinda like trance
> hitting SF in the late 90's... It was horrible, we all
> imagined that it would never take over the groovy

Depending on the situation, just generating a lot of encrypted traffic migh=
t be viewed as suspicious and get flagged too...

Peter

----- Original Message ----
From: Nic Werner <nicwerner@gmail.com>
To: CHUCK G <chuckg_421@yahoo.com>
Cc: SFR <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Wednesday, June 28, 2006 12:14:56 PM
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Question for the SFR Network Wizards

Keep in mind that they can monitor all the web sites that you go to
that don't use https (SSL). And a lot of traffic from anonmyizer.com
is a red-flag - I can tell when users are doing this kind of proxy or
bouncing it off a home server.

So right now, your GMail traffic is passing in the clear. In the
address bar, change that 'http' to 'https' and hit Enter, and your
GMail traffic will at least be encrypted.

That's not completely fair IMO.  This Sunday Sunset+Stompy at Cafe Cocomo for example.  That's only $10...

Green Gorrila has been throwing some affordably priced undergrounds...

Levende lounge has been hosting some decent house DJs and has the dreaded bottle service, but I didn't feel unwelcome or whatever the one time i was there and I didn't drink anything.

YMMV

Peace,

Peter

On 6/26/06, Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com> wrote:
>
> Actually, some places will let you walk with the
> bottle if it's capped, others will hold it for the
> next night, but all of them don't tell you this and
> certainly make no effort to let you know...
>
> My biggest thing about the bottle service requirement
> is this:
> One bottle per four people guarantees that everyone is
> drunk. Forcing you to order enough liquor guarantees
> that there is no sober driver. They are responsible
> for cutting you off if you've had to much... Thus the
> paradox of requiring you to order enough to get drunk,
> while legally having to cut you off when you've had
> too much.
>
> Personally, I would rather have to pay a "table fee"
> and get bottles for a reasonable price, rather than
> have the table price built into the bottles. On big
> weekends, like fight nights, nascar, Car shows, etc...
> they bump the bottle requirment to a minimum of 3
> bottles, PERIOD, regardless of how many people are
> with you.
>
> Luckily, my friends and I know someone in charge at
> nearly every establishment, and because liquor reps
> are constantly pushing their new thing, we usually get
> a buy 1 get one comped deal, which makes it about
> $400-500 for a group of 8 or so... which really aint
> that bad at the end of the night.
>
> Like I said though, this model is moving everytwhere.
> When I moved here, I couldn't believe how lame the
> clubs were. Music wise, most still are. I thought the
> SF style would come here sooner or llater, but it
> seems the reverse is happening, including the shitty
> music format.
>
> It's one of those things that sucks, but is coming no
> matter weather you want it or not...Kinda like trance
> hitting SF in the late 90's... It was horrible, we all
> imagined that it would never take over the groovy
> house vibe in SF... but it certainly did.
>
> E
>
>

> your ass. ;)

> Sean
> 
> 
> On 6/26/06, Eric Spire <ericspire@yahoo.com> wrote:
> >
> > Actually, some places will let you walk with the
> > bottle if it's capped, others will hold it for the
> > next night, but all of them don't tell you this and
> > certainly make no effort to let you know...
> >
> > My biggest thing about the bottle service requirement
> > is this:
> > One bottle per four people guarantees that everyone is
> > drunk. Forcing you to order enough liquor guarantees
> > that there is no sober driver. They are responsible
> > for cutting you off if you've had to much... Thus the
> > paradox of requiring you to order enough to get drunk,
> > while legally having to cut you off when you've had
> > too much.
> >
> > Personally, I would rather have to pay a "table fee"
> > and get bottles for a reasonable price, rather than
> > have the table price built into the bottles. On big
> > weekends, like fight nights, nascar, Car shows, etc...
> > they bump the bottle requirment to a minimum of 3
> > bottles, PERIOD, regardless of how many people are
> > with you.
> >
> > Luckily, my friends and I know someone in charge at
> > nearly every establishment, and because liquor reps
> > are constantly pushing their new thing, we usually get
> > a buy 1 get one comped deal, which makes it about
> > $400-500 for a group of 8 or so... which really aint
> > that bad at the end of the night.
> >
> > Like I said though, this model is moving everytwhere.
> > When I moved here, I couldn't believe how lame the
> > clubs were. Music wise, most still are. I thought the
> > SF style would come here sooner or llater, but it
> > seems the reverse is happening, including the shitty
> > music format.
> >
> > It's one of those things that sucks, but is coming no
> > matter weather you want it or not...Kinda like trance
> > hitting SF in the late 90's... It was horrible, we all
> > imagined that it would never take over the groovy
> > house vibe in SF... but it certainly did.
> >
> > E
> >
> >
> > --- Amadu78 <amadu78@hotmail.com> wrote:
> >

> > > THE BOTTLE TO TAKE HOME.

-- 
1. Creativity and innovation always builds on the past.
2. The past always tries to control the creativity that builds on it.
3. Free societies enable the future by living in the past.
4. Ours is a less and less a free society.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP - moonshine BM benefit party, July 8

Yes, the rumours are true.  This will be held at the notorious
"Porn Palace" - you know, the place where "fuckingmachines.com"
videos are made.

21+, please.  And I'll be wielding the "thrillhammer".  ;)

--------

Giddy up pard'ner and ride on down for a hot night in San
Francisco!

WHAT: Moonshine Saloon Fundraiser
WHERE: 5th/Mission, SF (exact address given after ticket
purchase)
WHEN: Saturday, July 8th 9pm - 4am
COST: $12 to $20 sliding scale donation
WHY: Help the Moonshine Saloon Art Car ride again - raising
funds to get us to the playa for Burning Man 2006!

----------------------------------------------------------------
WANTED: Criminals, Loose Women, and Citizens of Ill Repute to
stock our Jail Cell
----------------------------------------------------------------

Put on your Cowboy hats & spurs or Saloon girl duds for a night
in the Wild West.
Sexy Go-Go Dancers - See the Saloon Girls (and Redstickman)
kick up their heels!

2 rooms of music!

The Dungeon:
Forest Green (SisterSF/Daly City Records/forestgreen.org)
Sinukus (FunkyCozy/Below Zero)
DJ Addison (Stargaze Family)
Jason Lee (Stargaze Family/SNDJ)
Powerlounger (Qool/Looq Records/Funk Camp/Fandango)

The Saloon:
Redstickman (Ambient Mafia/FnF)
MC Boomerang Fidget (Ambient Mafia/HATFYR)
Harken (Ambient Mafia/Epiphany)
drop (Ambient Mafia/butterzone)
Speakeasy Ray (Ambient Mafia/Hope Chest)

How to Get In:
1) Send a PayPal purchase (Services) to
moonshinesaloon@yahoo.com with your donation & your full legal
name (the one on your ID) and the names/number of people in
your party for the fundraiser ($12-$20 / per person)

Paypal deadline is midnight Friday July 7th!

2) You will receive confirmation and party location details a
day or two before the event

3) Your name will be added to the door list with the number of
guests you've paid for

4) If you are unable to send payment by PayPal, please email
moonshinesaloon@yahoo.com to arrange another form of payment


Looking forward to seeing you there!
Please feel free to forward invite to trusted friends.
- The Moonshine Saloon Crew 


-----------------------------------------------------
 www.redstickman.com

 new downtempo mix online, you should check it out.

you're in (save for at the bar, and fwiw, they make strong drinks!!)

I haven't been to either club for a while, but I was really excited when DNA first re-opened.  Remembering the bathroom from the original DNA, walking into the new clean, fresh, puke free, and fully operational facilities was a real welcome surprise.  Last time I was at the DNA, there was a homeless guy with a live chicken on his head wandering around the line area.  A few months later, in the pricey Neimann Marcus catalog aka The Book, there was a picture of a high fashion model with (you guessed it) a chicken on her head.  

Whacked.

Peter

SPECIAL NOTICE:

THE SFRaves Calendar is being fixed, tested and checked for various
stresspoints under test.

If you are interested in working on helping to fix the SFRaves Calendar or
know of someone who is interested in becoming involved with the next
generation of the SFRaves Calendar Project - please email
karina@hyperreal.org

If you would like an event posted to the Calendar, please submit to:
karina@hyperreal.org and it will be listed on the Weekly Calendar Mailing.

The SFRaves Calendar is located @
http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2

Technologies: Zope: http://www.zope.org

Experience with / understanding / development experience with *a Plus* :

* authoring and building applications using the Zope application framework
(http://www.zope.org)
* ZPT * Python (http://www.python.org
* PHP
* MYSQL
* Plone

Please note if you are seeing issues with the current calendar (bugs,
errors, etc) please note that I am aware of them and am currently in the
process of addressing / fixing these issues.

Please send responses to karina@hyperreal.org

Alternative solutions are also being considered for the next generation of
this codebase. Other languages are being considered to enhance the SFR
Calendar Application. This includes languages specific to the development of
applications in a web environment.

--

-----------------------------------------------------------------
                      The SFRaves Calendar
    Upcoming Parties and Events in the San Francisco Bay Area
            http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/

Friday, June 20, 2006 * Alumni *

Alumni w/ DJ DAN, Robbie Hardkiss, Jeno, Dutch, Carlos, Tracy, Ethan, 
Galen, Solar, Visuals by Dasx, $10 Door, $5 before 11pm, $5 with raver 
gear, 21+ with ID, DNA Lounge, 375 11th Street, San Francisco, CA

Friday, June 30, 2006 * SF-Vibe 5 Year Anniversary *

Date & Time:  Friday, June 30, 2006 more on this date 10:00 PM Can you
believe it's been 5 years since the needle hit the record for the very first
time at an SF-Vibe party? We've played the biggest clubs and the smallest
dives, and everywhere in between. Late nights at Big Heart, tacos on
Tuesdays, staying afloat with a Watermelon, cuttin' it up with the Funk
Divas at Sublounge, getttin' our Moov on at Luna, great fantasies at Lingba,
Fabulous times at Levende, a prom queen at supperclub, and a not so little
underground where John McEnroe would feel right at home- yes, of course, the
80s Tennis Party- where the ladies look fly in white skirts, and the guys
don't mind at all. Join us on the 30th at the recently renovated Cat Club
for three rooms of aural stimulation- Chuck Love and Miles Maeda are
headlining, supported by a cast of DJs that have kept us bumpin' through the
night for 5 years. Housin': Chuck Love, M3, DJ Fluid, Uncle Larry 80s: Miles
Maeda, Lance Desardi, Antonio, JZ Live: Chad Mitchell & Andrew Emil w/ Audio
Angel, The Hotness Cat Club is located at 1190 Folsom Street discount
pre-sale tickets and more info at www.sf-vibe.com

Saturday, July 01, 2006 * Electro Techno Disco Love by Skills *

Enjoy a night of Trance, House, Drum & Bass, and Hardcore. Dj's include:
Martin Roth (Germany), Robert Nickson (Holland), Deep Voices (SF, Germany),
Thomas Datt (New York), Liam Shy (SF), Denise & Carlos Alfonzo (SF) in the
Trance/House arena. Drum & Bass artists include: The Upbeats (New Zealand),
Gein (Milwaukee), Unkown Error (UK), Bicolas (SF), E$KR (SF), and The Doctor
(SF). Hardcore/Gabber arena includes: Brisk (UK), Tommyknocker
(Italy/Belgium), Cloudskipper (SF), DJ Tronic (SF), The Nice Guys (SF),
Go-Zania! & Crackerjack (SF).  ETD LOVE is 100% Fully Permitted and Secured
from 9PM-4AM.Located at SOMARTS Cultural Center - 934 Brannan St, San
Francisco, CA. All responsible adults 18 & over are welcome! $50 general
admission. Infoline 510.704.9876

Saturday, July 08, 2006 * Dots 2 presented by Nu Vision Productions *

Join us for a night packed with flavorful beats!! Dj's serving the sweet
tunes are: Company Truck (Sideways Rec./Blackhoe Rec.), Valerie Sparks vs.
Kid Orange (Femme Djs/Nu Vision), Cracker Jack vs. Hi-C (Hard Heads/Nu
Vision), Nick Nyquil (Onieromancy), Wavelength (Onieromancy), 2QT (Nu
Vision), Elixir (Nu Vision), Domino (Hella 916)...Drum n Bass, Breaks, Happy
Hardcore, Trance, Hard House, and much more! Limited capacity, All ages, SF
bay area location. 8pm-4am. $10/$15 presales then $20 @ the door. For more
information call 510.595.4633

Saturday, July 15, 2006 * Smile!  by Plays Kool *

Join us at Smile! as we dance, grin, giggle, and party the night away!
Enjoy a fun filled night of music, dancing, friends, art, entertainment
and smiles!  With smiling DJs: Majere (Plays Kool), John Beaver (Skills,
1015), James Dub (Space Monkey),  Joey C vs. Tenchi (Bionic Bubbles), DJ Owl
(MUFF!, Seekr), Cyberfryed (MOTTS), & Eternity (Plays
Kool).  Dress up and shine like a star!  Special prizes for dancers in
costume!  Go-G0 dancing and performances by the Plays Kool Dolls! Greeting
and giveaways by Teez!  One Room One Vibe!  Glowy lighting and
Mega-Mascots by PLAYS KOOL! $20 at the door.  18+  Fully permitted in San
Francisco from 9pm to 4am!  Infoline 415.267.6921

Saturday, July 29, 2006 * Full Melt *

Date & Time:  Saturday, July 29, 2006 more on this date 10:00 AM FULL MELT
Saturday July 29th 10 PM - 6 AM Undergound location * 18 and Up Prepare for
the return of the people who put the whoomp, whoomp, whoomp... warble,
warble into the San Francisco underground. We are proud to present the
cutting edge of the UK Dubstep / Grime scene - DJ Distance and Pinch. Both
these people fuse post-breakbeat / post-2-step beats with extreme low-end
frequency manipulation. Expect chest-caving, sinus tingling subfrequencies
designed to move your mind as well as your insides... Prepare for comlplete
meltdown ! DISTANCE (Hotflush, Planet Mu, Boka, Rinse FM) PINCH (Tectonic,
Planet Mu, Subloaded) ATOMIKDOG (369 Rekchordz, Bassick Frequencies) ZAPPER
(369 Rekchordz, Ooze System, Bassick Frequencies) DJ RIPPLE (BreaksFM.com,
Subscience, Full Melt, Bassick Frequencies) SUBTEK (B.I.G. Crew) * EMCEE
CHILD ...more T.B.A. ESKMO (Cyberset.cc, Eskmo.com) MR. ROGERS (Ooze System)
SOULSALAAM (Hypnomadic, Future JuJu) HYPNOTECH (Addictech.com) BERTZERKER
(Ataraxia, Full Melt) ...more T.B.A. 2 rooms of EXTREME sound. Visuals &
Lights by EYE & EYE info line: (415) 820-1625 www.subscience.org

Saturday, July 29, 2006 * Party Monster presented by Club Kidz *

DJs: House/Trance: Angel Alanis (A Squared Muziq/In Stereo/A Trax/Phat &
Phunkie - LA), Elemental (VJTV), Doza (Zapatistas/Phat & Phunkie/BR), Carlos
Alfonzo (Vibrance Recordings, House Nation, BR), Adam tha Amp (Club Kidz),
Wavelength (Oneiromancy), Kid Wicked (Tunnelvizions). Hardcore: The Nice
Guys (K12 Studios), Secondbase (Nocturnalism/Evo/HCFTP), Riff Raff
(Zapatistas/BR/Hard Heads), Joshuah vs. Andrew K (OTC/Club Kidz), Bemaniac
(Digital Blasphemy/Church of Hardcore), Rye Bread (DTS), Precision (DTS/Hard
Heads). Fully permitted, virgin, San Francisco venue. Limited capacity
event, doors open at 9pm. Infoline 510.286.7955

Wednesday, August 02, 2006 * BOOM FESTIVAL Magic *

Date & Time:  Wednesday, August 2, 2006 - Wednesday, August 9, 2006 4:00 AM
Heya, All! We would like to share with you information about a very special
global arts, music and culture-gathering that incarnates biannually in
Portugal. Boom Festival takes place in a stunning outdoor location on the
shore of the Lake Idanha-a-Nova, approximately 2 hours North-West from
Lisboa. Bringing together the latest in psychedelic sights & sounds,
phantastic art installations & workshops, this week-long event is a harmonic
convergence of people, energy, information, and philosophies, from planet
Earth & beyond. Synchronized multi-dimensionally with the full moon of
August, the next Boom-Festival is taking a bio-dynamic approach by
incorporating a variety of sustainable techniques, and Earth-based forms
throughout its infrastructure. Reflecting a harmonic balance of the organic
and the cyber-technologic, Boom 2006 maps the metaphysical framework in
accordance with Peace, Love, Unity and Respect. A very magical event indeed!
5000 BOOM Festival 2006 Early Bird Tickets are available now. They are only
70 Euro for 7 days. Getting there is no big deal. Reasonable flights to
Lisboa can be purchased on most of the European Budget Airlines, and
Transatlantic flights from America are also quite cheap. The Boom has
organized busses that take you directly from the international airport to
the sacred womb of the vacation party paradise. This year, Boom-festival has
extended its length to ONE WEEK! Great news about the timing of BOOM 2006 is
that it's not happening in conjunction with Burning Man, so the devoted
"Burners" have a chance to partake on European creative community
expression. BOOM is similar to Burning Man, but with a lake & great sounds!
Not to be missed ... For more info, please visit: www.boomfestival.org

Friday, August 11, 2006 * Sound Asylum by Mizumo Music and Dj Denise *

With DJs: DRC (destra music/sfhousemusic / blue moon productions), Denise
(mizumo music), Dragn'Fly (dj4norml / strategik), Enemy, Adam Ant
(nocturnalism/earwacks), DJ Whisper, introducing DJ K3. LIVE and amazing
vocals by Audio Angel (celebrityjunglist). Lasers & lights by STIM-U-LIGHTS.
18+ event located in the heart of San Francisco. Access to full bar for the
21+. 9pm-4am. $20 @ door. Infoline 415.267.7656

-------------------------------------------------
Administrative Notes
-------------------------------------------------

THE SFRaves.org Calendar is sent via email every week. To subscribe to the
list, send a message to: sfraves-calendar-subscribe@hyperreal.org

To remove your address from the list, send a message to:
sfraves-calendar-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org

Send mail to the following for info and FAQ for this list:
sfraves-calendar-info@hyperreal.org or sfraves-calendar-faq@hyperreal.org

If you have events to add to the SFRaves calendar, please publish them by
Friday @ Noon to be included in the SFR Calendar Weekly Edition Mailing.

SFRaves is a not for profit entity serving the Bay Area & all forms of
electronic music for 14 years.
